Imagine a future in which you can take a picture using oSnap and the software in the app can detect the objects in the image and their automatically tag them with their corresponding aromas. Recent advances in computer vision at leading universities point to a future in which such an "aromatic camera" can be made into a real commercial product. Help us get to $5,000,000 and we can develop this!
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS


Why the oPhone?

We
communicate in many ways, via sight, sound, touch, and more.  Among these is the process of olfaction, or
smelling, and has a very special physiological effect on us.  It influences our emotions, our health, and
our appreciation (or dislike) of many experiences that are fundamental to us -
like eating. If we could integrate aroma communication into the handy framework
of global communications we can communicate better, more emotively, and lots of
things would be easier.  Like buying a
coffee, or remembering a place, or feeling better.  You can help make oPhone a reality by
pre-purchasing one via our Indiegogo campaign.
Can the oPhone capture
aromas in the air?
The oPhone can only diffuse the aromas that you create
on oSnap. When you take a picture on oSnap, you choose the aromas that you want
to add to the picture – the app does not choose them for you. One technological
advancement we’re excited to implement when the time is right are computer
vision algorithms that can detect objects within a picture and automatically
tag them with their corresponding aromas. We’re not quite there yet, but help
us meet our stretch goal and we’ll get there!
Why is it
launching over a whole year?

Aromatic communication, in the
sense we imagine it, is very new. We tend to think today of aromas as sensual
environments that enclose us, remain with us, and in a way define a space and
time. That’s not how we think of aromas. We are interested in aromas as words,
sentences, and paragraphs.  We are
interested in being able to deliver many aromas over a short period of time and
by this to communicate in a way that is similar to how we communicate with
sounds and images.  It actually takes
just a few seconds to identify an aroma. Eventually our olfactory receptors
saturate. So our noses are really well designed for “aroma tweets” and we want
to see how people adapt to this idea. We are bringing this technology for free
to people and will be watching, listening, following reactions and designing
our devices, our vocabularies, our platform to make this work.  We finally want the platform that emerges in
2015 to be one that we really do use.  
Will I be able
to send or receive “any” scent or scent composition?

Yes,
eventually. Right now you will only have a “Foodie” vocabulary on your oSnap
app.  By October 2014 you will be able to
choose other vocabularies, notably a great coffee vocabulary or two.  Then by 2015 there will be many others.  You will also eventually be able to design
your own vocabulary and get us to make whatever you like.  
What will this
ultimately be (or mean to electronic communications)?

We
will integrate oNotes into our communications just like we do images and movies
today.  Sometimes we share a photo all by
itself.  We’ll do this with aromas,
too.  Media forms with have oNotes.  Like, oBooks, oSongs, oFilms.  Any tweet, any email, any electronic
communication that touches on a subject with aromatic content, will simply be
better expressed, with an oNote.  
Can anything bad
happen to me (like, can I now receive a bad aroma)?
Nobody
can send you a scent you do not wish to perceive.  Why? 
You need to have placed inside your oPhone the aroma cartridges (oChips)
with the very aroma you are looking to avoid. 
That is, you choose your aroma vocabulary, and if someone sends you an
oNote with a different aroma vocabulary, you simply do not smell it. Who are you guys?We are a team of creators working to bring olfactory wonder to mobile messaging. Our technology is the brainchild of inventor and Harvard professor David Edwards, and led by his former student and co-inventor Rachel Field, with the talented designers Baptiste Viala, Laurent Milon and Robin Barata, our sensitive nose, Marlene Staiger, our production leader Manuella Passard, our business team Blake Armstrong and Antoine Mahy, and the very special team of Laboratoire Paris. Our company is Vapor Communications.Past UpdatesThis is where we will be chronicling our updates throughout the campaign so you can see how far we've come.//////////////////////////  July 27 UPDATE  //////////////////////////Hello Everyone! We are almost at the end of our campaign! And the good news is -- we're just beginning!  Over the last week and a half we have traveled with the oPhone between New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and back to New York.  On Wednesday David will be on CNBC.  And after Thursday we all go on a little vacation … Meanwhile, at the American Natural History Museum, this weekend and last, over 1500 people came through and tested their noses on various oNotes, from enchiladas to lemongrass tea.  See the pictures below -- and the fun interview. Kids were amazing.  Many had perfect scores.  With the thousands of oNotes people have made these last weeks all around the world, the thousands of oPhone encounters, your contributions, and some emerging partnerships we will start to announce in the months to come, we couldn't be more excited.  About the next phase of the launch, we'll share more in a few days.  For now, thanks again from all of us!David, Rachel, BlakePhotos&Video Credits: Raphael Edwards//////////////////////////  July 15 UPDATE  //////////////////////////Announcing the oPhone UNO! Get the amazing UNO for $1 with your oPhone DUO order during our Indiegogo campaign!We have hinted at it -- now here it is.  The oPhone UNO, what the oPhone DUO is leading up to.  We are then excited to announce that all purchasers of the oPhone DUO, between June 17th to the end of our Indiegogo campaign, can opt-in to receive an oPhone UNO for $1 by purchasing the new oPhone UNO perk!//////////////////////////  July 4 UPDATE  //////////////////////////Hello Everyone and Happy 4th of July!This week, our third, brought some very exciting news. An important contribution just happened, the first HotSpot Perk purchase, to bring the oPhone to a great city in the USA that we will announce very soon.  And while we're super excited to be traveling with oPhone to some of the thousands who have made oNotes these last couple weeks, we're especially excited to be doing it in the context of healthcare.  What exactly this means (scents, as you probably know, are not just essential to how we experience food, they also influence our health, our memory, and more) we'll explain very soon, particularly once David & Rachel begin their little tour of the USA. When is that? Starts next weekend.  Yep, in another week we open our first HotSpot in America, in New York's amazing American Natural History Museum! At the AMNH all you New Yorkers are going to have a chance, from next Saturday (noon to 5pm), to download your oNotes -- and learn a lot about olfaction, and your own noses! More on this next week. For now, thank you, for all your oNotes, for your contributions, and for your support of sensorial sharing. David, Rachel, Blake//////////////////////////  June 27 UPDATE  ///////////////////////////Hello Aroma Doodlers! Well we doubled our campaign contributions this week -- thank you! -- and had an amazing party this evening in Paris.  Students, creators, dreamers from around the world came to Paris for an annual creator workshop. This happens ever year. It started in 2008 with the visit of David's class at Harvard. Then students from the Boston Public Schools joined, and since many other schools and organizations have joined, from Singapore, London, Dublin, Brussels, and all around the USA via the Boys & Girls Clubs of America. Students dream with David (and Rachel and lots of us) for a week. We ended the week with an oNote party. The most amazing oNotes were made. The Paris HotSpot overrun. Lots of aroma and emotion and memory.On to next week! Some very cool gifts are in the works. Not sure if we'll be able to announce next week, but, maybe!David, Rachel, Blake & The oNotes Team////////////////////////  June 23 UPDATE   /////////////////////////Hello Everyone! Thank you for making our first days of our Campaign a success. Breaking the $10K mark last Friday (June 20), we broke through our goal of $20k yesterday (June 27)!Beyond the buzz around our first transatlantic oNotes (see the Fast Company and WIRED articles) and the launch in Paris (a few photos below), an amazing thing happened. Thousands of people around the world downloaded oSnap since it became available early in the week. Right now an oNote is being created somewhere every two or three minutes.  And the content is just amazingly emotive.  We'll have some oNotes uploaded by next weekend on our site www.onotes.com.  So, thank you, updates to follow early next week! David, Rachel, Blake & The oNotes Team//////////////////////////  end June 23 update  ////////////////////////

story:
Our early alpha has been reviewed quite a lot already! Come take a look!

English

 

  • Caledorn ("I hope that you look equally as much forward as I do when the game gets more fleshed out.. I really want this game to be a success!")
  • Nookrium ("The towns get quite impressive.. impressively large!")
  • Get Indie Gaming ("This one may very well offer the interactivity and player freedom these games tend to miss out on.")
  • Loki ("I was really surprised by the gameplay possibilities already implemented and the stability overall.. I hope you will back the game, because I really want to see this happening!")

German

  •  Writing Bull (Part 1 of 4) ("This was really exciting!")
  •  CIGAR0 ("I am a big fan of Black & White and Fata Deum is such a god game!")
  • Tastenhauer ("Great project.. many great ideas!")
  • MisterMoerp

French

  • Dan Field ("I like the style! .. The fact that the vegetation and houses grow organically is great!")

There will be a French version!

Fata Deum is a singleplayer god game asking  

"With the power of a god, who will you become?".

As a powerful god you fights against up to four (AI) gods to rule a fantastic world and its mortals. These mortals act self-sufficiently and need to be persuaded to follow you. But how will you achieve this? Will you

Build great armies to expand and gain new followers by force. Or establish wonderful settlements, improve their cultural value and convince others to join your path. 

Establish wonderful villages.

Fata Deum allows you to focus on building and support aspects to raise a civilization like none before and gain new followers based on your cultural value! Build up large walls and defend towers to save your family from any villains or bloodthirsty tyrants, build farms and sawmills to let your civilization grow and prosper. 

 

Sound boring? Become the bloodthirsty tyrant instead and build barracks to train your mortals, raise lousy shacks to gain more and more of these lazy mortals for your terrifying army and sacrifice them to summon powerful demons!

Sacrifice the weak! Summon powerful demons!​

With such an army  you can conquer any of these weak civilizations, which believe in education and fun - ridicilous!

The more followers you gain the more power you receive to cast very different kinds of wonder! But how will you use your power?

Will you support your beloved followers and work good wonders to increase their energy, health and productivity? Will you save them from any evil influence and spread love to further expand your realm of peace and happiness?

Boost your mortals!​

Maybe? You can also focus on weakening your enemies, by spreading fear upon the weak! Undermine their morality with dark visions, weaken their productivity or kill them directly - the most efficient thing in the end. Over time they will understand that you are the strongest god and worship you, even if you did not help them much (or at all..). In addition, it also makes sense to torture your own followers here and there, to remind them not to stop working!

Lazy mortal detected? Send him a thunderstrike!

It is not necessary to get control over all mortals and build up large settlements to become the god with the most followers. It can be tricky, but burning everything down (at the right moment) and ensuring the few that do survive follow you would be enough to win the match in the competition's terms; you did not make the rules, right?

Burn it down!

More the productive character? Show your enemies that your skillls to raise an empire, either by fear and force, or by kindness and support, are outstanding! Finalize your efforts by build up a large monument, which is percievable from every corner of the earth, so that all mortals will recognize your superiority. 

At last: raise an epic monument!

 

All mortals have their own will, so they will act and evolve as they like - if you let them. You can watch them erecting their buildings, choosing their partners, their jobs, living their lives and only intervene here and there by working wonders to either support or prevent ongoing activities. 

These mortals are doing what they like to do: enjoying life!

Become a loud and visible god, casting more and more wonders to gain their attention and convince them to follow you without controlling their minds (at least not too much). Get rid of all these kinds of micro managment aspects and totally focus on the funny side of being a god: work wonder!

Or do you distrust these small minds? Or believe that your glory will lead them to a greater good? Influence their minds during the night by manipulating their dreams to ensure that everything proceeds as planned during the day. 

Manipulations to build a new building.

Decide what buildings will be built and which mortals will fall in love with each other to have full control of which skills and physical traits are inherited. Let enemies sign a peace contract or friendly neighbours attack each other, just because you like to see it, or because you have a greater plan in mind.  

The game consists of two main phases

  • Day Phase: this is where the action takes place. The mortals do their jobs and you can interact with them by working wonders and carrying out some minor manipulations.
  • Night Phase: this is where the main manipulation takes place, you can influence the dreams of mortals to decide what they will do the next day: build a building, work harder, attack a neighbour, etc..

You can either focus on one of these phases (action or manipulation) or act in both: whatever you focus on you get stronger at!

The campaign will contain at least three different worlds (levels), where two different matches take place in each world. During the campaign different game mechanics will be introduced step by step. In each match you have to fight against one or more AI god character with different characteristics and skills.

Custom matches can also be played in each world (skirmish), after you have finished the corresponding part of the campaign.

The main target of each match is to gain more followers than your opponent until a specific, timed event. While this target always stays the same, the opponents, the general settings and the provided gameplay mechanisms will change so that each match will be different. 

Are these praying mortals your followers?

Furthermore, you can change your gameplay style as described above. During each match you improve your skills based on your actions but these improvements will be reset after each match, so you can change your playstyle whenever you like (instead of restarting the whole campaign).

Between the different matches an epic story is illustrated by in-game cutscenes (similar to those shown in the  trailer) and by additional 2.5D cutscenes based on drawn images, like the ones shown on this page.

Campaign cutscene: mortal starts to raise a settlement.

The campaign lets you experience the story of a young god who learns to lead his human followers and assert himself through them against divine rivals. In a process of increasing challenges, you will not only find out more and more about your opponents, but also about yourself. 

Campaign cutscene: mortal supported by the player god.

His opponents are exaggerated, comical embodiments of the aspects of fertility, pleasure, violence and deceit, which both attract and repel one another. The divine aspects are not only representative of various European deities of ancient times, but also of old, external imprints and paradigms. 

Campaign cutscene: partytime with the god Pleasure.

In the following we give a short introduction of the different AI character:

  • Related Aspects: Passion, Art, Games, Ecstasy, Wine
  • Mantra: "Enjoy life! That is what it is for." 

The AI god character Pleasure.

This likeable fellow can find pleasure in everything, but mostly in fabulous feasts accompanied by various forms of artistic amusement like song, dance and theater. Even the hardships of life, like war, he is able to turn into a game - or if nothing else, a joke. His actions are as loud as his laughter and his colorful soul is nurtured by every being that feels delight or inspiration.

  • Related Aspects: Cruelty, War, Hate, Destruction, Death
  • Mantra: "I will lead the weak onto a path of power... or wipe them out." 

The AI god character Violence.

Whenever you meet Violence, you meet open opposition coupled with unconcealed cruelty. The cries of her victims are only predominated by her own shouts of anger and orders in her eternal war. She leaves no doubt that there can never be a true, durable alliance with her, because she only accepts absolute victory - no prisoners. The annihilation of her enemies and the suppression of her followers is what infuses her with strength.

  • Related Aspects: Life, Growth, Agriculture, Earth, Maternity
  • Mantra: "Sow the seed of love and you will grow." 

The AI god character Fertility.

This goddess feels like the mother of all, caring about every being. With her power, nature multiplies and grows, nursing all beings in her reach to physical health and mental fulfillment. Her love for creation is a quiet one, a gentle influence, a silent growth with only the results reaching the surface. Her heart swells when she is witness to the creation of life - mortal or immortal, plant or conscious soul.

  •  Related Aspects: Illusion, Mischief, Change, Trickery, Night
  •  Mantra: "You are ignorant and transparent... and therefore vulnerable." 

This clever god might appear differently than he really is. He is known as a master of an astounding array of impersonations. But because he veils his actions in the cloak of night and mist, whispering his wishes into the dreams of his followers, he is able to manipulate in secrecy. His mind is fed by mystery and masquerade. Outsmarting others with his tricks is his only joy.

 

In short two reasons: 

  • first we want to have a very productive alpha and beta phase where we strongly interact with our community to improve gameplay, AI, balancing and create the campaign (basic budget)
  • second we would love to increase the scale of the game (quality and quantity) in cooperation with our community and therefore we need an additional budget (stretch goals)

Long form:

In the current status of the project we have finished the technical and graphical foundation the god game Fata Deum shall be build upon. In the following month we will focus on gameplay, AI, balancing and the campaign. 

And that is the exact moment at which we would love to work together intensively with the community! Therefore, we are starting this Indiegogo InDemand campaign after our successful Kickstarter campaign to further increase our cooperation with gamers who would love to either support the development in general or who want to become a part of the development as alpha / beta tester with a strong influence on the ongoing development.

Fata Deum at the India Arena Booth (Gamescom 2019).

Since our first contact with the community during the Gamescom 2019 and the following months we have already received great input and we would love to bring this cooperation to the next level!

The gathered money of the Kickstarter campaign is mainly the necessary amount to repay our efforts for this campaign, setup a proper alpha and beta test environment, create a good exchange with the community and have some budget left over to be able to realize upcoming new feature requests.

In addition, we have done a detailed query about general features, the community would love to see and about the name of the game. In the future we will definetly continue with this approach as we want to develop a game for you - our gamers.

Community decision: game name? Fata Deum!

The result of our feature query taking place in the last months is shown below. We asked the community to do two things: first rate each feature individually from one to six (best) and second choose two out of ten features, which they would like to see in the game most. 

Community decision: most wanted features.

As you can see there were four major features (Advanced Moral System, Advanced Building System and Production Chain, Epic Story, Own Monster), the community prioritzed and - based on these results - we have defined our stretch goals.  

The development of Fata Deum is currently funded by the Film und Medienstiftung NRW (local german funding), but the provided funding is not enough to realize an intensive alpha and beta test phase with strong community interaction nor is the current budget enough to realize the additionally requested features. 

That is our main reason to do this Indiegogo InDemand campaign: we would love to extend the scale of the game!

Even not all stretch goal have been hit during the Kickstarter campaign we are keeping this list open via this Indiegogo InDemand to get as many stretch goals done as possible!

Let's get it done :) 

Soundtrack The soundtrack will consist of at least 10 tracks with an overall duration of more than 30 minutes! Furthermore, if we hit additional stretch goals, more tracks will be composed and added! 

https://soundcloud.com/nlyound/fata-deum-soundtrack-preview-1

Artbook Contains a wonderful combination of artwork, concepts and renderings at high quality similar to what you have seen on this page. In addition, we provide you with some more insides on the story and art style! 

Developer's Diary If you want to know how it is to live and work in the Indie Apocalypse, or you want to get closer to all the dirty little secrets of game development, this diary will deliver!

Alpha and Beta Access Get access to the game as earlier as possible! Provide us feedback based on your game experience and participate significantly in the development. The Alpha is accessable now!

Fata Deum Development Discord Server Access Get access to current ongoing discussions and participate on the development of new features / concepts directly. Be one of the first to comment on ideas and sit close to the developers!

Designer Reward Design a prayer (mini quest) in cooperation with the development team. Sit directly at our desk!

Fata Deum Feature Queries Over time we will ask the community to prioritize and select which features should be put into the game via Fata Deum feature queries, similar to the ones we did before to find out how to define our stretch goals. Only difference: the higher your pledge level is, the stronger your vote!

42 Bits Entertainment has been founded with one major purpose: to get the god game genre back! 

Even though Fata Deum is our first title, the core team has a lot of work experience in the game industry, so that alltogether we have over 40 years of game development experience and have participated in the development of over 15 titles which have been shipped and sold!

This is the guy, who got it started! Mainly doing all organizational parts, game design and the software development, he still cannot stop himself from getting involved in other parts, too as well!

With five years of work experience in the game industry (three years XRebirth, engine development, two years Fata Deum), equipped with a PhD in software engineering and five years of work experience in the automotive domain (where he worked as project and subproject lead with customers like BMW group, Daimler AG, ) he has already handled a lot of different things, but nothing has been as exciting and challenging as this! 

She is the mastermind behind the world, story and characters of Fata Deum. When talking with the team she ensures consistency and high player immersion and drives Christoph crazy by identifying all the potentials for improvement. Writers being deliberate schizophrenics, Ivonne can be as fun, motherly, aggressive and secretive as our four AI gods! 

With 12 years of job experience in the game industry ("The Dark Eye - Drakensang: The River of Time", "Drakensang Online", "The Parallax", ...) she is our real industry veteran!

Equipped with Italian roots his genes force him to design one artistic masterpiece after the next! All city and monument assets he designed from scratch and if Christoph would not bother him with ridicilous minor details like deadlines, they could look even more amazing! Rome was not built in a day!

For the last three years he has worked in the game industry as a 3D artist and thereby is  one of our younger team members! The missing experience, he easily compensates for, with talent!

Our composing masters of sound! We do not know how they do it, but its amazing! Did you watch the trailer? Have you listened to the soundtrack examples?  What else shall we say? Epic!

For the last six years Paul Stähr and Felix Bachlinger have been working in the game industry as composers, sound designers and audio consultants. Under the label Only Sound they have been involved in projects like Stranded Deep, Aquanox - Deep Descent, Pizza Connection 3, Construction Simulator 3 and many more.

With over ten years in the game industry (X2, X3, X3TC, XRebirth, Artist and Lead Artist) Chris is another game industry veteran supporting the project. Even his available time is very limited, he is providing very important input and shares all his knowledge and experience.

With over 12 years professional experience in the field of graphic design she is creating powerful and clever brands and websites for her clients. In 2014 Anke has founded „kamphans-die KreativAgentur“. 

Seems to be born with a brush in his hand. He draws us crazy :) All shown drawings are his work! Just wonderful!

These guys supported us with finetuning our trailer.

Twentytwo Film is producing web video formats in the area of science communication. Most known format is the german YouTube channel "Doktor Whatson".

 

Funded by

 

Risk and Challenges

There are always risks to any game development project. Especially if a new team is creating a game with a scale like Fata Deum. Nevertheless, the most important people behind Fata Deum are already very experienced in delivering games (and other software products) successfully. In addition, we are already working on this project for over two years and gained enough experience to estimate further efforts correctly.

Depending on the outcome of this campaign (and depending on which stretch goals are reached) the scope of the game could be increased significantly. If this is the case new team member needs to be hired and further progress maybe need to be rescheduled. So we see some challenge on keeping all deadlines, if the scope is increased significantly (what we hope, so increasing the scope, not missing the deadlines ;)), but we think this is still a good thing: maybe the development will take more time, but just because we add new features. In this case we still want to ensure that all backer get access to the game. As we can provide an early access version of the game to all backers via Steam, we are confident that we can still hold the suggested deadlines, even we will not be able to hit the final release deadline (because of much new content).

In addition, as a small indie developer we are of course quite vulnerable to tragic events, like long-term illnesses of one team member. In most cases we will be able to compensate this, but these kinds of events could still slow down the development process, too. Regarding Covid-19 we are not slowed down currently and do not expect a major slowdown in the future. We work separated at different cities mainly in Germany and will continue like that with most of the team. We work since 2 years as a remote team and therefore are home office experts best prepared for the current lockdowns. We are still a quite young team and therefore do not expect to have to handle long-term illnesses because of Covid-19.

Send him a thunderstrike!It is not necessary to get control over all mortals and build up large settlements to become the god with the most followers. It can be tricky, but burning everything down (at the right moment) and ensuring the few that do survive follow you would be enough to win the match in the competition's terms; you did not make the rules, right?Burn it down!More the productive character? Show your enemies that your skillls to raise an empire, either by fear and force, or by kindness and support, are outstanding! Finalize your efforts by build up a large monument, which is percievable from every corner of the earth, so that all mortals will recognize your superiority. At last: raise an epic monument! All mortals have their own will, so they will act and evolve as they like - if you let them. You can watch them erecting their buildings, choosing their partners, their jobs, living their lives and only intervene here and there by working wonders to either support or prevent ongoing activities. These mortals are doing what they like to do: enjoying life!Become a loud and visible god, casting more and more wonders to gain their attention and convince them to follow you without controlling their minds (at least not too much). Get rid of all these kinds of micro managment aspects and totally focus on the funny side of being a god: work wonder!Or do you distrust these small minds? Or believe that your glory will lead them to a greater good? Influence their minds during the night by manipulating their dreams to ensure that everything proceeds as planned during the day. Manipulations to build a new building.Decide what buildings will be built and which mortals will fall in love with each other to have full control of which skills and physical traits are inherited. Let enemies sign a peace contract or friendly neighbours attack each other, just because you like to see it, or because you have a greater plan in mind.  The game consists of two main phases

Day Phase: this is where the action takes place. The mortals do their jobs and you can interact with them by working wonders and carrying out some minor manipulations.

Night Phase: this is where the main manipulation takes place, you can influence the dreams of mortals to decide what they will do the next day: build a building, work harder, attack a neighbour, etc..
You can either focus on one of these phases (action or manipulation) or act in both: whatever you focus on you get stronger at!The campaign will contain at least three different worlds (levels), where two different matches take place in each world. During the campaign different game mechanics will be introduced step by step. In each match you have to fight against one or more AI god character with different characteristics and skills.Custom matches can also be played in each world (skirmish), after you have finished the corresponding part of the campaign.The main target of each match is to gain more followers than your opponent until a specific, timed event. While this target always stays the same, the opponents, the general settings and the provided gameplay mechanisms will change so that each match will be different. Are these praying mortals your followers?Furthermore, you can change your gameplay style as described above. During each match you improve your skills based on your actions but these improvements will be reset after each match, so you can change your playstyle whenever you like (instead of restarting the whole campaign).Between the different matches an epic story is illustrated by in-game cutscenes (similar to those shown in the  trailer) and by additional 2.5D cutscenes based on drawn images, like the ones shown on this page.Campaign cutscene: mortal starts to raise a settlement.The campaign lets you experience the story of a young god who learns to lead his human followers and assert himself through them against divine rivals. In a process of increasing challenges, you will not only find out more and more about your opponents, but also about yourself. Campaign cutscene: mortal supported by the player god.His opponents are exaggerated, comical embodiments of the aspects of fertility, pleasure, violence and deceit, which both attract and repel one another. The divine aspects are not only representative of various European deities of ancient times, but also of old, external imprints and paradigms. Campaign cutscene: partytime with the god Pleasure.In the following we give a short introduction of the different AI character:

Related Aspects: Passion, Art, Games, Ecstasy, Wine

Mantra: "Enjoy life! That is what it is for." 
The AI god character Pleasure.This likeable fellow can find pleasure in everything, but mostly in fabulous feasts accompanied by various forms of artistic amusement like song, dance and theater. Even the hardships of life, like war, he is able to turn into a game - or if nothing else, a joke. His actions are as loud as his laughter and his colorful soul is nurtured by every being that feels delight or inspiration.

Related Aspects: Cruelty, War, Hate, Destruction, Death

Mantra: "I will lead the weak onto a path of power... or wipe them out." 
The AI god character Violence.Whenever you meet Violence, you meet open opposition coupled with unconcealed cruelty. The cries of her victims are only predominated by her own shouts of anger and orders in her eternal war. She leaves no doubt that there can never be a true, durable alliance with her, because she only accepts absolute victory - no prisoners. The annihilation of her enemies and the suppression of her followers is what infuses her with strength.

Related Aspects: Life, Growth, Agriculture, Earth, Maternity

Mantra: "Sow the seed of love and you will grow." 
The AI god character Fertility.This goddess feels like the mother of all, caring about every being. With her power, nature multiplies and grows, nursing all beings in her reach to physical health and mental fulfillment. Her love for creation is a quiet one, a gentle influence, a silent growth with only the results reaching the surface. Her heart swells when she is witness to the creation of life - mortal or immortal, plant or conscious soul.
 Related Aspects: Illusion, Mischief, Change, Trickery, Night
 Mantra: "You are ignorant and transparent... and therefore vulnerable." 
This clever god might appear differently than he really is. He is known as a master of an astounding array of impersonations. But because he veils his actions in the cloak of night and mist, whispering his wishes into the dreams of his followers, he is able to manipulate in secrecy. His mind is fed by mystery and masquerade. Outsmarting others with his tricks is his only joy. In short two reasons: 
first we want to have a very productive alpha and beta phase where we strongly interact with our community to improve gameplay, AI, balancing and create the campaign (basic budget)
second we would love to increase the scale of the game (quality and quantity) in cooperation with our community and therefore we need an additional budget (stretch goals)
Long form:In the current status of the project we have finished the technical and graphical foundation the god game Fata Deum shall be build upon. In the following month we will focus on gameplay, AI, balancing and the campaign. And that is the exact moment at which we would love to work together intensively with the community! Therefore, we are starting this Indiegogo InDemand campaign after our successful Kickstarter campaign to further increase our cooperation with gamers who would love to either support the development in general or who want to become a part of the development as alpha / beta tester with a strong influence on the ongoing development.Fata Deum at the India Arena Booth (Gamescom 2019).Since our first contact with the community during the Gamescom 2019 and the following months we have already received great input and we would love to bring this cooperation to the next level!The gathered money of the Kickstarter campaign is mainly the necessary amount to repay our efforts for this campaign, setup a proper alpha and beta test environment, create a good exchange with the community and have some budget left over to be able to realize upcoming new feature requests.In addition, we have done a detailed query about general features, the community would love to see and about the name of the game. In the future we will definetly continue with this approach as we want to develop a game for you - our gamers.Community decision: game name? Fata Deum!The result of our feature query taking place in the last months is shown below. We asked the community to do two things: first rate each feature individually from one to six (best) and second choose two out of ten features, which they would like to see in the game most. Community decision: most wanted features.As you can see there were four major features (Advanced Moral System, Advanced Building System and Production Chain, Epic Story, Own Monster), the community prioritzed and - based on these results - we have defined our stretch goals.  The development of Fata Deum is currently funded by the Film und Medienstiftung NRW (local german funding), but the provided funding is not enough to realize an intensive alpha and beta test phase with strong community interaction nor is the current budget enough to realize the additionally requested features. That is our main reason to do this Indiegogo InDemand campaign: we would love to extend the scale of the game!Even not all stretch goal have been hit during the Kickstarter campaign we are keeping this list open via this Indiegogo InDemand to get as many stretch goals done as possible!Let's get it done :) Soundtrack The soundtrack will consist of at least 10 tracks with an overall duration of more than 30 minutes! Furthermore, if we hit additional stretch goals, more tracks will be composed and added! https://soundcloud.com/nlyound/fata-deum-soundtrack-preview-1Artbook Contains a wonderful combination of artwork, concepts and renderings at high quality similar to what you have seen on this page. In addition, we provide you with some more insides on the story and art style! Developer's Diary If you want to know how it is to live and work in the Indie Apocalypse, or you want to get closer to all the dirty little secrets of game development, this diary will deliver!Alpha and Beta Access Get access to the game as earlier as possible! Provide us feedback based on your game experience and participate significantly in the development. The Alpha is accessable now!Fata Deum Development Discord Server Access Get access to current ongoing discussions and participate on the development of new features / concepts directly. Be one of the first to comment on ideas and sit close to the developers!Designer Reward Design a prayer (mini quest) in cooperation with the development team. Sit directly at our desk!Fata Deum Feature Queries Over time we will ask the community to prioritize and select which features should be put into the game via Fata Deum feature queries, similar to the ones we did before to find out how to define our stretch goals. Only difference: the higher your pledge level is, the stronger your vote!42 Bits Entertainment has been founded with one major purpose: to get the god game genre back! Even though Fata Deum is our first title, the core team has a lot of work experience in the game industry, so that alltogether we have over 40 years of game development experience and have participated in the development of over 15 titles which have been shipped and sold!This is the guy, who got it started! Mainly doing all organizational parts, game design and the software development, he still cannot stop himself from getting involved in other parts, too as well!With five years of work experience in the game industry (three years XRebirth, engine development, two years Fata Deum), equipped with a PhD in software engineering and five years of work experience in the automotive domain (where he worked as project and subproject lead with customers like BMW group, Daimler AG, ) he has already handled a lot of different things, but nothing has been as exciting and challenging as this! She is the mastermind behind the world, story and characters of Fata Deum. When talking with the team she ensures consistency and high player immersion and drives Christoph crazy by identifying all the potentials for improvement. Writers being deliberate schizophrenics, Ivonne can be as fun, motherly, aggressive and secretive as our four AI gods! With 12 years of job experience in the game industry ("The Dark Eye - Drakensang: The River of Time", "Drakensang Online", "The Parallax", ...) she is our real industry veteran!Equipped with Italian roots his genes force him to design one artistic masterpiece after the next! All city and monument assets he designed from scratch and if Christoph would not bother him with ridicilous minor details like deadlines, they could look even more amazing! Rome was not built in a day!For the last three years he has worked in the game industry as a 3D artist and thereby is  one of our younger team members! The missing experience, he easily compensates for, with talent!Our composing masters of sound! We do not know how they do it, but its amazing! Did you watch the trailer? Have you listened to the soundtrack examples?  What else shall we say? Epic!For the last six years Paul Stähr and Felix Bachlinger have been working in the game industry as composers, sound designers and audio consultants. Under the label Only Sound they have been involved in projects like Stranded Deep, Aquanox - Deep Descent, Pizza Connection 3, Construction Simulator 3 and many more.With over ten years in the game industry (X2, X3, X3TC, XRebirth, Artist and Lead Artist) Chris is another game industry veteran supporting the project. Even his available time is very limited, he is providing very important input and shares all his knowledge and experience.With over 12 years professional experience in the field of graphic design she is creating powerful and clever brands and websites for her clients. In 2014 Anke has founded „kamphans-die KreativAgentur“. Seems to be born with a brush in his hand. He draws us crazy :) All shown drawings are his work! Just wonderful!These guys supported us with finetuning our trailer.Twentytwo Film is producing web video formats in the area of science communication. Most known format is the german YouTube channel "Doktor Whatson". Funded by Risk and ChallengesThere are always risks to any game development project. Especially if a new team is creating a game with a scale like Fata Deum. Nevertheless, the most important people behind Fata Deum are already very experienced in delivering games (and other software products) successfully. In addition, we are already working on this project for over two years and gained enough experience to estimate further efforts correctly.Depending on the outcome of this campaign (and depending on which stretch goals are reached) the scope of the game could be increased significantly. If this is the case new team member needs to be hired and further progress maybe need to be rescheduled. So we see some challenge on keeping all deadlines, if the scope is increased significantly (what we hope, so increasing the scope, not missing the deadlines ;)), but we think this is still a good thing: maybe the development will take more time, but just because we add new features. In this case we still want to ensure that all backer get access to the game. As we can provide an early access version of the game to all backers via Steam, we are confident that we can still hold the suggested deadlines, even we will not be able to hit the final release deadline (because of much new content).In addition, as a small indie developer we are of course quite vulnerable to tragic events, like long-term illnesses of one team member. In most cases we will be able to compensate this, but these kinds of events could still slow down the development process, too. Regarding Covid-19 we are not slowed down currently and do not expect a major slowdown in the future. We work separated at different cities mainly in Germany and will continue like that with most of the team. We work since 2 years as a remote team and therefore are home office experts best prepared for the current lockdowns. We are still a quite young team and therefore do not expect to have to handle long-term illnesses because of Covid-19.

story:
Omno tells the story of a journey of discovery through an ancient world of wonders.


Hey, my name is Jonas Manke, I am the solo developer behind Omno. I started work on Omno over 2 years ago, I’d love to show you more about the game and invite you to come on the final leg of this journey with me!

 

 

 

Join me for behind-the-scenes news! Facebook | Twitter | Discord | Newsletter

Omno is a single player adventure that will take you through lush forests, across a sun blasted desert, over a frigid tundra, and where the power of a lost civilisation will even carry you to the clouds. On the way you will meet strange creatures, encounter many surprises and maybe make a friend.

If you want to see Omno in action, here is some gameplay footage of the game:
 

 

 

The world of Omno is teeming with creatures great and small for you to observe and interact with. Shy crab-like rocks, helpful turtles, maybe even a friendly dinosaur to ride?

You must unlock the hero’s true potential and master unique skills to continue their journey.

Your magic staff is the key to powering forgotten relics, and will allow you to dash lighting fast across platforms, glide over land, sail above the clouds and more!

 


The game covers a wide variety of landscapes and is built with state-of-the-art development tools and tricks (I sometimes show behind the scene stuff in my newsletter if you are interested) to create vast areas while ensuring a stable framerate.

 

 

 

The audio of Omno features a melancholic, mysterious and at times epic  soundtrack. For the music of the trailer I worked with the versatile and experienced composer Benedict Nichols and I hope I can keep up this great collaboration with the help of the backers.

I have been working on Omno for over 2 years (the last 8 months fulltime) and now I would say Omno is about 60% complete. I took a lot of time to nail down the tech behind the game which is pretty much done already! Also all the core mechanics are finished and all worlds are in a playable stage.

 

The main thing missing is putting all pieces together, replacing placeholders with actual assets and adding way more animals, a lot of secrets to discover and overall more love to the game, which takes time of course.

 

Omno is developed by myself (Jonas Manke), a solo indie dev from Germany. Before Omno I gained production experience as a freelance animator for 10 years on many movies and games (lately 'State of Decay' series - check my personal website or IMDB for more). Working for myself in this competitive environment not only helped me gain a lot of experience in game development but also in planning projects, setting realistic deadlines and budgets. I met great people and inspiring artists along my way who I talk to on a daily basis to receive the hardest and highly qualified feedback.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

I’m probably not the first one to tell you that game development always bears certain risks. There is always a chance of unexpected problems that could occur and potentially delay the game.

That being said I have already been working on Omno for over two years and the core technology and gameplay as well as the rough levels are all there, so I’m confident with the timeline I have laid out.

As for the Kickstarter rewards, I have purposely kept the number of physical rewards low and realistic to ensure that backers will get their rewards on time.

story:
Help Develop A New Expansion For SEQUENCE STORM

Hello!  My name is Daniel Lemon and I'm the solo developer of the rhythm-action PC game SEQUENCE STORM.  I want to build a new expansion for SEQUENCE STORM, and also extend the accessibility features.  My ultimate #a11y goal is to support players that use pointing devices or eye tracking.  Please keep reading to find out more!

SEQUENCE STORM is free-to-play on Steam! https://store.steampowered.com/app/630640/SEQUENCE_STORM/

And is also available on itch.io: https://special-magic-games-llc.itch.io/sequence-storm 


SEQUENCE STORM is lauded as one of the most accessible indie games!  With this expansion, I will add even more accessibility options!

Accessibility Stretch Goal: A New Pointer-Based Game Mode ($3000)

I got the idea to do this after working with people that can only use pointing devices.  See my interview with The Crippled Critic on YouTube (but be sure to come back here!)

This will add a new game mode that is entirely playable using a pointing device.  Rather than pressing buttons in time with music, the user will hit targets on the track that approach the screen.  There will be many customizations for this mode, like target size, active area on the screen, and whether or not the player has to click the targets.  Check out the stretch goals section below for other stretch goals.

Stretch Goal: Native Eye-Gaze Accessibility ($3500)

This will build off of the pointer-based game mode, and enable players that use eye-gaze technology to play the game natively.

The cost of this goal will go toward purchasing the relevant hardware, and the time it will take to adapt all of the user interface for eye-gaze use.

Blind Accessible Track Editor

SEQUENCE STORM is already mostly accessible to blind players, including the song editor, but not the track layout editor.  With this change, all users will be able to easily create tracks by inserting premade track sections.  Insert turns, loops, and more.

Fully Pointer-Accessible User Interface

This will fix many issues for users that only have access to a pointing device.

Enlarged Text in Settings Menus

As more options are added, the text in the settings menus is getting smaller and smaller.  This will make the text larger by adding scrolling to all of the settings menus.

New Story Campaign: Olokun Dive!

Olokun Dive! will be an entirely new story campaign with a brand new rogue-lite design.

After Elijah Gale finds he has been infected with Olokun Biodynamics malware, he meets Kailani who has been investigating the mysterious corporation’s networks.

Kailani has found a backdoor into Olokun Biodynamics, where Elijah finds a mysteriously shifting network of challenges.  Each time the player fails a challenge, the network will reset and become randomized again.  Earn upgrades that will allow you to dive deeper and deeper into the network with each attempt, discovering more and more secrets about Olokun Biodynamics.

New Tracks

Olokun Dive! will add at least 6 new tracks, and up to 7 or 8 tracks if stretch goals are met.

New Character

Meet Kailani!  This daemon has been around long enough to remember a time before long the Zaibatsu Archives took control.   

To complete this artwork, I will be approaching the same artist that did the rest of the game's character portraits, Rustam Ha.

Character Design Mood Board

Kailani's design will take inspiration from Michèle Lamy, a French culture and fashion figure.  She is known for her edgy makeup and elaborate clothing.  Kailani will wear a large headset with jackal ears on it reminiscent of the Egyptian god Anubis.

Full Screen Character Artwork

Kailani will be represented in-game by beautiful full-screen artwork, instead of the small thumbnail sized portraits the game currently uses.

New Environment

Olokun Biodynamics is the world's premier manufacturer of human augmentation products.  Dive deep into their secret networks to discover a hidden virtual paradise.

Environment Mood Board

New Water Environmental Effects

Race on track that dives in and out of the water.

New Artwork

I will commission new full-screen artwork of characters to use as backgrounds for the game's user interface.

New Rig Customizations

New Rig Skin

Use Kailani’s rig, a design that will be based on Kailani’s character (TBD).

New Note Hit Effects

Replace the standard hit effects with new ones.  The first option will be a digital splash effect.  Here’s an early version.

New Rig Customizations

The first will be a rig topper in the form of Anubis/jackal ears similar to what Kailani wears.  These will appear on your rig on the Steam leaderboards.

Leaderboard Badges

Pick and choose which badges appear next to your entries on the leaderboards.  From supporter badges, to badges representing your Test Sequence rankings, and badges earned during special events.

Exclusive Rewards

Earn exclusive gold versions of the new rig skin, note hit effects, rig effect, and leaderboard badges by pledging your support to the expansion.  These exclusive versions will never be made available again!  To receive the Steam leaderboard badges, I will need to now your Steam username as it appears on the leaderboards.

New Announcer

Let Kailani guide you through your adventures in SEQUENCE STORM!

Stretch Goals

$2600: Add a 7th new track

$2700: Add an 8th new track

$3000: Add a pointer-based game mode

$3500: Full native eye-gaze compatibility

What If The Goal Isn't Met?

If the goal isn't met, then I will still work to complete the perks, however it may take longer and I may need to reduce the number of features.

story:
WHAT IS KINGS OF GLORY ?


Kings Of Glory is a medieval survival game where your main objective will be to build your own kingdom. Start looking for resources and build your own house, for every house you build more people will come to your kingdom. You can give tasks to your villagers, so they start gathering resources. With the resources that your villagers are gathering, you can expand your kingdom or go to the market and exchange them for other resources, or improve your equipment.
Recruit an army and prepare to attack other kingdoms or to defend yours. Become the greatest kingdom, or find other adventures in this medieval world.


BUILD YOUR KINGDOM


To build your kingdom you will need resources, you can find them by chopping trees or mining rocks. Once you have enough you will have the option to build entire buildings or just small parts and customize them . Buildings that are already completed will have functions such as recruiting units or other functions like having a blacksmith that will help you create tools. You can also upgrade building, for example if you upgrade a house more people will be able to live inside. The more houses you build, the more people will live in it, which will help you to grow your kingdom. Build walls and towers so the enemies can't attack you.


MANAGE YOUR VILLAGERS


Having a kingdom with a large population will cost you more resources, if you don't want your villagers to starve, give them task to do, like serching for food or gather resources. If you organize your population well you can get many resources and expand your kingdom.


TRADE IN THE MARKET


With the resources you get, you will have the option to go to the market and exchange those resources for other ones, or upgrade your equipment. You can also get these resources or equipments by your own, but in the market you might find items that are very rare.


BUILD YOUR ARMY


Even if you want to live a peaceful life without harming anyone, that does not exclude that other kingdoms want to take away your possessions. To prevent that, recruit your own army.

In your kingdom you can build buildings where you can train your villagers and prepare them to become warriors. You will have the option to recruit different types of units like infantry or cavalry. You can also build siege equipment in case you want to attack other kingdoms.
Give them orders to stay defending your kingdom or follow you to the battle.

 


WORLD MAP


In the world of Kings Of Glory you can find different adventures, help people and receive rewards or explore mysterious caves and find treasures. You can also find other kingdoms which could become your friends or become your worst enemies.


MULTIPLAYER


We cannot promise that the game will be released with the multiplayer option, but in the future we want to add it. We know that many of you want to play with your friends and that's why we will end up getting the multiplayer option at some point. Hopefully the game will have a multiplayer option on its release date, but we can't promise anything. In the upcoming months we will be giving more information.


RELEASE DATE


We hope to have the first version of the game at the end of 2020. And launch it on Steam in early 2021.

story:
Preface

Hey, everyone, I am Sergey Lipskiy, the author of GLideN64. GLideN64 is advanced multi-platform open-source graphics plugin for N64 emulators. It uses powerful features of modern GPUs to bring you new level of quality and authenticity of hardware-based emulation on desktops and mobile platforms. The project’s first public version was released in 2015. It became possible after successful campaign here, on Indiegogo, in 2014. Since that time the project lives on GitHub. Current public version released at the end of 2017 (Blog). Development continues, current work-in-progress builds also available for download on GitHub.

Campaign

This campaign continues our previous successful Indiegogo campaign "Star Wars - Rogue Squadron. High Level Emulation". Last time you helped us to make HLE implementation for very large and very complex microcode, which N64 port of "Star Wars - Rogue Squadron" uses. This time our goal is to decode and implement microcode, which Factor 5 developed to port "Indiana Jones and the Infernal Machine" to N64. This is very complex and unique microcode. It is slightly resemble the one for Rogue Squadron, but there is no direct correspondence. Developers pushed N64 to its limits to use high resolution and still having a really high framerate. Read those very interesting articles on IGN for details:
Bringing Indy to N64 and Battling the Naboo
One cite: "Our new microcode allows almost unlimited real-time lights and a much higher polygon count than the original".

Olivieryuyu and me started to work on this microcode at the end of 2017. I implemented commands, which necessary to run game intro and menus. You may see the results in the campaign demo video. I need to implement remained part of microcode and fix possible issues with frame buffer emulation in this game. It is hard task, and it will require huge efforts to get it done. I need your support and encouragement to complete it. If campaign will reach the goal, the task will get top priority. I’ll complete it as soon as possible, taken into account my limited time resources.

Completion of this task will also provide a good basis for "Star Wars Episode I - Battle for Naboo" which uses a similar microcode, but has many differences and extensions. We are planning to implement it when Indy microcode is done. Star Wars Episode I - Battle for Naboo contains some hard and puzzling code. We cannot guarantee that it will be fully emulated in HLE but we will do our best to implement it as well. At this moment only the first screen of the game is emulated:


 

Plan for Project Completion

The plan is nearly the same as for Rogue Squadron campaign. I will implement the microcode step by step. All backers will get access to WIP builds of GLideN64 for Windows emulators. When all code will be ready, I will fix issues with frame buffer emulation and do other required polishing. Source code will go to master branch and built for supported platforms.

Time-line estimation: I started to work on this microcode in top-priority mode and it took circa a month to reach the current state. Remained part of microcode will take another month or two, depending on my limited time resources. Few weeks will take bug-fixing and frame buffer emulation. Thus, project completion requires circa three months of work after reaching the campaign goal. Also, completion of Indi microcode will mean that Battle for Naboo is circa 75% ready. We hope that remaining part will not take long. 

Risks & Challenges

We decided to reduce possible risks to minimum and not included Battle for Naboo to campaign goals. Indi microcode is almost completely understood, which makes us sure that its decoding and implementation will be completed. Implementation of any of these microcodes is “mission impossible” kind of tasks. We are going to implement both.

story:
Summary

Eclypse is a collectible card game played by one or two players using virtual decks of cards. The cards represent creatures, objects and instant effects on the battlefield that consists of 6 columns and 7 rows with a wall to be destroyed at both ends of the columns.

During the turn-based game the opposing players place cards on the battlefield and their creatures start to march against the enemy wall. When two of the creatures meet they fight each other. The outcome of the combat is decided by the attack/defense value of the participating cards and a 4-sided dice.

Anyone can choose their preferred species or type of game as  campaign, skirmish, deathmatch, arena and friendgame playing modes are available throughout the game and there are four races with unique abilities. During your adventures you can upgrade both your cards and heroes. These changes are displayed in the game.

Game website


Goal of the game

In the world of Eclypse players command a hero and their subordinate army. The heroes, depending on which side they take, fight for protecting or conquering the people of Utopia. For each side the goal of the game is to make at least one unit enter the fort or base camp of the enemy.


What We Need & What You Get

We have:

  • Game concept
  • Storyline and background
  • Artwork - most of it :)
We need money for:
  • Game engine development
  • Music
  • Web front-end, app micro site
  • Web back-end
  • App SEO
  • Promotional campaign
You'll get
An iOS & Android comaptible, astonishingly unique mixture of card and tower defense games.


The Impact

Eclypse merges the variety of a collectible card game and the speed of a fast action Tower Defense game, which is completely new on the market.

Other Ways You Can Help

We gladly accept drawings, artwork and creature concept from the donators. Your images that fit in style could be included in the game.

story:
Why Free Mind Today

Once we have noticed and I'm sure you also experienced a few second periods in your lives when you can’t control your actions, thoughts and emotions. As if a mechanism is activated that blocks your mind and body, for example, during a public speech. My brother and I want to face and overcome this strange feeling of helplessness in a funny and gameful way. If you also want to do it, then this game is for you. 


What is it?

The website www.freemind.today (FMT) is a free two player game for best friends that helps you know yourself, your strengths and weaknesses in real life. The game is available in English, Ukrainian and Russian languages and you can play it on any web browser, including mobile ones. Also, the game has a notification system and a chat for instant messages.


How it works?

In short, you create a game and select a skill set (zone) that you want to improve. Then you invite your friend to connect the game. After that you start creating private challenges for each other according to selected zones. When all challenges are done by both players, the game is ended. You are a winner if you have more successful challenges than your friend.


About Us & Our Mission

My brother and I are software engineers. We started playing this game before it was even created. One day we decided to create a special web application for it and our efforts resulted in  www.freemind.today. Creating this game, we try to archive two purposes: step out of a comfort zone and improve creative thinking skills by making up proper and interesting challenges for each other.  

Our goal is to help people improve themselves and the lives of those they touch. That's why the game is free, and we are happy to share it. We hope you love FMT and we will do our best to keep it online and free even if we don't raise a lot of money. 


What We Need & What You Get

We have created a core of the game, but we need your help to improve it and add extra free features. The main directions of future developments are:

  • user profile
  • privacy settings
  • personal and site-wide statistics
  • possibility to invite existing FMT users to a game
  • 1-player mode (you won't need a friend to play)
  • game content (challenge examples, zones, etc.)

If you want to support our efforts, please consider a donation.  Every penny will go towards enhancing our game, giving you more features.  

In return, we're committed to developing and maintaining the game.  Also, we would be happy to send you monthly reports about our expenses and a current state of the project, so please consider "Investor" and "My Story" perks. We believe they can give you better insight of project outgoings and help you in the future if you decide to create your own web application or startup. To find out more about "My Story" perk, please click here to view the questions that will be covered and the list of gifts that will be added for free.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are a few more, please:

  • get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your family and friends about this game
  • let us know if you are interested in translating FMT into other languages
  • contact us if you want to have a feature that hasn't been included into FMT yet or have any comments

FAQ

How much money do you spend to support the game?
We are paying 100$ a month to Amazon services that provide us two servers. Please consider the "Investor" perk to find out more.

Will you create special mobile applications?
Yes, we are considering it. Once we hit the main campaign goal, we will talk about stretch goals, including this one.

Why Paypal contributions aren't allowed?
Paypal contributions aren't allowed in this campaign because Ukrainian customers can't receive money.  We regret the inconvenience caused due to this.

If you have more questions about FMT, please visit Q&A page or contact us (admin@freemind.today), also you can start playing the game. Note, we don't require an email during registration.


What Experts Say

story:
Our Story

Blackwyrm Books And Games is a publisher of experimental fiction and quality roleplaying games. In conjunction with Hero Games' release of the Star Hero 6th Edition roleplaying game at GenCon 2011, we are attempting to simultaneously release seven science fiction settings that can be played using the Star Hero rules.  

 

We're calling this entire undertaking Project WyrmStar. 

The Impact

Hero Games isn't planning on releasing any settings for Star Hero: only the core rulebook and some equipment books. We are hoping to "fill the gap" that leaves by releasing unique and interesting setting books that can be used to play the game immediately, rather than forcing Game Masters to take the time to create their own setting. 

 

Denver Mason's 3rd World for HERO System 6th Edition is one of these settings. 

?df?%n?mo />?df?%n?mo:p>

We're calling this entire undertaking Project WyrmStar.

What We Need & What You Get

They're here...and they're not going anywhere soon!

 

Mankind once looked to the stars and wondered what, or who, might be out there. But before they could go out and seek the answers, the answers came to them. Humanity endured the onslaught of a Dark Alliance that savaged the very planet, forever changing its face. Others born of the stars came to the planet's rescue, but at a terrible cost. These savior races have divided the globe among their own, leaving Native Earthlings second-class citizens on their own planet. Former nations have been portioned out among an alien government known as the Co-Operative and broken up beyond recognition. Human cultures have faded over the decades under the rule of this or that species. The resources of Earth are no longer its own but are used to line the proverbial pockets of the newcomers. Some of these aliens spoke of Earth as a holy land promised to them, others merely as a commodity. Some saw a chance for acceptance, and still others sought to help... even if their help is not always welcome.

 

Now it is the 23rd Century. Generations have passed where the Earth held not one, but many sentient species. The stars remain distant and, for most, inaccessible. It is on the Earth itself where colonists must craft their future. It is on this planet where the descendents of humanity must decide what of their past they hope to salvage. Wonders and terrors await them. Finally, the age of ashes has passed, and now comes a new world of clay that the brave and determined have a chance to shape. Earth is now used or ignored in turn.  It is truly a 3rd World.

 

Will you let it remain so?

 

Discover...

-The rich history of Humanity, including the fate of its lost children and the war against the Dark Alliance.

 

-The alien races of the squabbling Co-Operative. Here are the curious and brilliant F'Trana and the headstrong and passionate V'Sharl. Here are questing Drugan who require death so they might truly live, and the ruthless and material Razneeth.  Learn also of the offspring of the defeated Dark Alliance, some of whom still live on Earth; be they the rapacious Murkot, the nihilistic Glastyx, or the doomed Volvant. And learn how each of these species isn't always so easy to label.

 

-Study the numerous new dominions built on the bones of the United States and other countries of old Earth. Perhaps you prefer the all too perfect F'Trana Utopian Projects, or wish to partake of the grand experiment of the Free Allied States? Maybe you will rebel against reptilian overlords in New Tianxia, or hope to escape from the aggro strip.

 

-The drug that makes psychic powers possible, and how its presence on Earth is both a curse, and perhaps a salvation waiting to be utilized.

 

-Mysteries and motives yet to be fully revealed in a world that mixes cyborgs and wastelands. A place that needs desperately heroes, but is not yet without hope.

 

-Samples, examples, and suggestions to help you get started on your way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell other gamers about BlackWyrm and Project WyrmStar!

story:
NOTE:  All backing options include the rewards for all the lesser options.

 

Who am I?

I am Eric Ruth of Eric Ruth Games; creator of Pixel Force: Left 4 Dead, Mega Man Rocks, Team Fortress Arcade, & Pixel Force: Halo.  I have been an independent video game developer for 8 years and have worked on nearly 30 game projects in that time.  My goal is to become self sufficient in the world of game development so I don't need the outside aide of IndieGoGo or other sources to continue my work.  After all, this has been my dream since I was a small child, and I will work as hard as I can to bring you the entertainment you enjoy so that we can all love gaming together.  But now, on to the project!

 

If I reach my full funding goal:

Hauntlings is a game designed to be browser based in HTML5.  Each player will have an account that they will sign in with at the Hauntlings web site.  Once signed in, the player will be able to manage their settings (key bindings, audio, etc), Set up a game lobby, or join a lobby already in progress.  At launch, there will be 20 unique Hauntling characters to choose from; each with their own skills to be utilized and combo'd in battle.

Currently, there are 3 game modes available to play.

  1. "The Cemetery" is a shorter game map with only 1 guardian statue on either side, and a mausoleum at the ends of the map on either side.  This game mode is designed for shorter play; between 8 and 10 minutes.  This mode is available in 1 v 1 or 2v2.
  2. "The Town Square" is a longer map with identical game play goals to the Cemetery.  There are 2 guardian statues on either side of the map, as well as the 2 mausoleums at either end.  Since the map is longer, game play time ranges from 10 to 15 minutes.  This mode is available in 1 v 1 or 2v2.
  3. "The Mansion" is a short map with a tower defense game play.  There are 2 guardian statues placed back-to-back in the center that must be defended from increasingly sizable waves of demon babies.  This mode is playable by 1, 2, 3 or 4 players and is entirely cooperative.  Instead of playing against your friends, play alongside them and see how long you can last.

To win your game, you must push in on your enemy's guardian statue and destroy it before you move on to crumbling their mausoleum.  However, the other team will be hoping to do the same to you, so your defenses will have to stay up when you're on the offense.  First person/team to destroy the other team's mausoleum will taste the sweet dew of victory.

 

Where are my contributions going?

  1. Computer hardware- My PC is never "in top shape," and has a few peices that are on the fritz, including my video card, and one of my monitors.  I need to keep my only means of game development functioning or else nothing will ever get done.
  2. Coding Assistance- I have a lot of skill in very specific types of coding, with a very specific language.  However, I am NOT a network coder and I've never understood how to take care of anything server side.  This is where the assistance comes in.  I need to be able to hire someone to kind of fill in the blanks with the things I can not do properly so that the players can have the best experience possible.
  3. Music Licensing- I will be licensing audio from the great musical duo of Midnight Syndicate.  I have had the pleasure of working with them before, and can absolutely promise you that when it comes to eerie/haunting musical ambience, no one on Earth does it better.  Don't believe me?  Go see for yourself at www.midnightsyndicate.com
  4. Ramen/Coffee- I gotta eat and I gotta stay up all night.  There you have the 2 basic neccessities of game development.  Now you can say you learned something today.

 

What if you don't reach your funding goal?

If I don't obtain the full $35,000, Hauntlings will still see a release, but in a much more "neutered" state.  If I can't afford network programming, the game will simply not have online functionality.  That means that the game will retain all of its game modes, maps, characters, etc, but will not be able to entertain online challenges.  If the projects funding comes in VERY short, then music licensing will be forgone and a generic production music soundtrack will be applied in its stead.  Also, with minimal funding, the game will also lack immediate priority, and will have a longer delay until public release.

 

NOTE:  All backing options include the rewards for all the lesser options.

story:
Lupinball (now on Steam!) is universally praised at every convention it goes to. We won the PAX Aus Indie Showcase in 2015! We had a mobile cart wheeled around PAX East, which became a late-night fan party with Lupinball memes! We even made an impromptu booth at the Intel Developer Forum in 2016, with just my laptop and a few controllers! Now, we have our sights on TwitchCon 2017.

With our TwitchCon booth, we aim to get mega-famous streamers excited about Lupinball, which in turn brings in a much bigger online player-base!

Our goal is set at the amount TwitchCon charges for the lowest-price indie booth. With a flexible goal, if we fall just short of the target, we will pay the difference out of our own pockets and go to TwitchCon anyway! If we exceed our goal, we can make a bigger, better TwitchCon experience, and provide additional help to the composer and artist who'll give you your perks! Speaking of which...

  • A discounted Lupinball 4-pack. Steam doesn't allow 4-packs for recent games, so this is the only way to get a Lupinball 4-pack to share and play against friends. 
  • The soundtrack! It hasn't been officially released yet, so you will get the Lupinball soundtrack early by contributing!
  • A sprite by the Lupinball artist! He will draw you one image sprite, of a custom character, in the pose of your choice, in the Lupinball art style.
  • Your very own "wolf fact" added to the loading screens of Lupinball! (note that the wolf fact must be funny/witty and not inappropriate) Lupinball shows wolf "facts" on each loading screen, you could add your own!

With your help, Lupinball will make a real splash at TwitchCon as it becomes the online party game of choice for streamers! See you at Long Beach!
