story:
"The year is 2172. For the last century, humanity has focused it's collective energy on space exploration. Spread out across the galaxy are roughly one hundred colonies, outposts and space stations from this initiative.

Space travel however is limited to relatively few; many do not meet the regulations or have the wealth to grease the necessary hands. There's also the problem of patrols that go along established routes - officially they're there to keep the peace and ward off pirates - in reality; they've been known to open fire on anyone unfortunate enough to be passing through without the proper clearances.

But with such limitations, comes opportunities. A small but lucrative trade exists for transporting goods and passengers outside the usual restrictions - although not technically legal and with no guarantee of safety, they make up for it with little to no background checks and affordable rates."

Infinite Loop is a mystery adventure game set in the near future on board a smuggling vessel. You play the captain and to your horror you find out that in 5 days time everyone on board will be dead and the ship most likely destroyed. Suspects? Well basically everyone. The regular passengers are all shady with colourful pasts and even your crew have their own personal issues. The only thing for it is to get stuck in; talk, sneak, search or physically 'interrogate' if you have to - the clock is ticking and no approach should be ruled out... will you rise above it or sink to the level of the passengers you're transporting ?

The game will also feature RPG elements; character back stories, dialogue trees and key decisions to be made. We want to make a game with narrative complexity and some cool unique ideas (sprinkled with some dry humour) - a game that in all likelihood wouldn't be created in a big studio because it wouldn't tick the right boxes. 

*not 100% finalised, but close to it


We have two main targets when it comes to funding. A minimum one that would allow us to finish the game with a good amount of polish. At this level we would commit most of the money on music and sound effects - an area we don't have much experience with and would much rather hire in someone who knows exactly what they're doing. Indiegogo and Paypal take a small cut by default (related fees) and we would also want to pay for both Steam Greenlight access (so it can be sold on Steam) and a game engine license. Finally, after all of those are paid for, we would commit the rest of the money to hire in additional help with the art side of things where possible. This is not a necessity, but it would speed up production with the aim of getting the game launched quicker than it otherwise would.

Minimum Target -- £1200



Desired Target -- £2500

If we can achieve this level, we really could do all the things we wanted when we first envisioned the game. Extra content can be added; in particular additional endings and more bonus stuff to unlock in game. The music and sound budget would increase by 30% and we'd also commit a small amount to online advertising as well a dedicated website when the game launches.


'Is this even possible' target -- over £2500

This is just us dreaming here, but if we can over even our desired target we'd commit to adding some ridiculous amounts of polish to the game. Things like cut scenes,  additional character back story, more mini-game challenges, possibly even new characters.

  • Feel free to ask us any questions.
  • If you like this project, please help spread the word about it and this campaign.
  • We'll set up a twitter account soon, to give updates and to interact with fans.

story:
Order today and be one of the first who play an iKazoo.  

Share our campaign and join iKazoo's team today! 

 

We all know what a Kazoo is!

A wind instrument that adds a "buzzing" timbral quality to your voice when you sing into it. The kazoo is a type of membranophone – a device which modifies the sound of a person's voice by way of a vibrating membrane. In this way anybody can produce any sound using just their voice.

 By replacing the membrane with a piezo microphone the sound can be amplified and alternated. Tunes can be converted into numbers [midi]. These numbers can control electronic instruments on your Smartphone, Tablet, PC or Laptop. Making such an electric kazoo might be cool for awhile, but probably it would get boring pretty quickly. That is why,we introduce the iKazoo. 


iKazoo

iKazoo is extremely versatile with tons of amazing functions! The flute side is a breath synthesizer. That's why iKazoo looks like a flute from one side.

 


The complete surface is touch and shock sensitive, so you can tap on different positions with different intensity to get a super drum computer or beat box. Plus, if you hold iKazoo in your hand instead of between your lips, the built-in microphone can record and alter your voice, while the tunes you have created previously are automatically looped. This will give you an unbelievable performance.

A bi-directional bluetooth transceiver connects wirelessly with your smartphone or tablet.

Want to play a game?


 The iKazoo's built-in Arduino platform is equipped with optical and motion sensors.  This turns the iKazoo into an Optical Game Controller. So just move the iKazoo around and play your favorite games easily.
The two multicolour LEDs allow you to connect to any device that has a built-in camera, such as your Phone, Tablet, or a PC.

Just hold the iKazoo in front of the device, and our driver application will search and sync up! You will never have to use a touch screen again. Connect your device to your TV and you have a game console. 

 Our OGACO interface connects your iKazoo wirelessly with your favorite apps. Want to discover the OGACO universe? Every contributor becomes a member of OGACO online community (OGACO Land), a virtual gadget paradise for free.

 

iKazoo is an open source platform. Soon we will be able to share many other gadget ideas, generated by you and your friends with other members of OGACO online community. You can also peek into our secret closet full of new gadgets coming up. Plus, our "members only" website shows you tons of iKazoo features and applications. So help us to get started and become a member of OGACO. Your contribution means a lot to us and motivate us to come up with lots of innovative ideas.

 

 

Specifications & Parts

Arduino Compatible Microcontroller
Bluetooth Audio/Data Device
Open Source Software
Piezo Membrane
Shock Sensor
Electret Microphone
Multi Touch Sensor
Accelerometer/Gyro
RGB LEDs
Mini USB Port
Battery Charger
Lithium Battery
Headphone Jack
Strap

 


 

iKazoo Applications 

 

Music

Electronic Flute
Touch & Tap Midi Controller
Karaoke
Microphone
Sequencer
Auto Looper
Effect Controller
Breath Synthesizer
Sound Pick-Up ("attach'n touch")

Game

Crazy Motion Controller
3D Air Joy Stick
Racket, Paddle, Sword-, or Golf-Club Simulator
RC Controller
Robot Controller

Art 

Quick Draw Utility
Airbrush Simulator

Who we are

OGACO Gadgets is a US/Canada registered company based in Canada. We are supported by a team of creative people who are as dedicated to the product and its success as we are. We have strong industry partners to assist us in manuafacturing. 

In OGACO Gadgets, we wanted to find a way to interface the real and virtual worlds with complete synchronicity and make it accessible to anyone. So, we created new form of “personal assistance” devices! We call them “Fun-e-tizers”, synthesizers of FUN!


With iKazoo, we wanted not only to make the most versatile device imaginable, but also to bring people together by creating their own open source apps and sharing them in our online OGACO community. But we’re not stopping here....iKazoo is just the first gadget of OGACO’s revolutionary devices on the way. We want you to realize the future of OGACO Gadgets, the new way to play, create, stay fit, share and connect. OGACO Gadgets is dedicated to new ways of thinking, sharing, playing, creating, and making YOU a part of innovations! So, please contribute today, and join our team!

 

 

Where we are

The prototyping of the iKazoo is done. The hardware components are chosen and the printed circuit board is ready. We have contacted the manufactures and are ready for production. We need to raise 150K with your help in order to bring the iKazoo into your world.

We are also searching for general distributors. We plan to have the product finished and ready to be shipped by August 2013 at the latest.

We value your questions and opinions, please feel free to reach us at :info@ogacogadgets.com. 

 

iKazoo's prototype



Join Your OGACO Community Today to Help Making:

THE MOST VERSATILE ENTERTAINMENT GADGET EVER!

 

Please share iKazoo with your friends!

Facebook - Twitter - Youtube - Vimeo

Media Coverage 

  

 iKazoo: Kazoo-inspired controller is one weird gadget 

 First look at the feature packed iKazoo, Ep. 115  

 Ikazoo, a multifunctional entertainment device for music and more 

 

iKazoo to Support MIDI, OSC and Audiobus

 

 External Game Controller for Android, iOS, ...

 

 Remember kazoos, those cheap musical toys? The iKazoo can control your Android phoneRead more

 

 IKAZOO AIMS TO BE THE SWISS ARMY KNIFE OF CONTROLLERS!

IKazoo, the Magic Flute!


OGACO IKAZOO OFFERS UP PLENTY OF FUNCTIONALITY IN A CUTE, FUN PACKAGE!

 

 OGACO IKAZOO, THE STRANGELY FASCINATING GADGET, MOTION CONTROLLER & FLUTE!


iKazoo is on IndieGoGo!

 OGACO IKAZOO IS WEIRDEST NEW GADGET OF 2012

 A KAZOO AND SO MUCH MORE!

 

Not Your Grandpa’s Kazoo!

 

Please share our story with your friends through social 
networking sites and help us to be heard!

                          Facebook - Twitter - Youtube - Vimeo

story:
You can now download a "demo" of the game here!

The game works on both Windows and Mac, to play it, place the main folder into My Documents and run the .bat from there.

Remember, this game is EXTREMELY Alpha right now

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/65793444/ForlornExistence.rar


Hey there people! i'm flynn, and i'm not so great on camera so it would be better for you guys to read here if you'd like to know about our game!

We are an indie-game company known as FourBytes Studios, and our purpose is to create a typical game and turn it into something awesome that involves the player brings indie games to a whole new level.


ABOUT THE TEAM

I'll keep this short and casual since i'm sure you'd rather read about the game!

I'm Harry Callard, but i've always gone by the nickname "Flynn". My role in the company is to look after everything, create the music, cutscenes and all the things that don't involve coding! I've been learning code for a while now and soon i'm going to be taking a part in coding the game c:


Hi I'm Patrik Spengler, main developer of the game and founder of the fourbytes team. I only started developing applications one year ago but I never actually finished anything. My dream is to have success at this or any game, thus my philosophy about making games is creating a fun game that even I would play for a longer time. If you finish something that is even enjoyable for you, you can expect success, especially with great friends such as Flynn and Angel.


I'm Maik Macho, and i am the lead coder of fourbytes. I basically write the majority of the game code, keep the engine working and fix errors.


WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

There are a few reasons we need the help of you lovely people out there, and they are mainly to get the game noticed, to buy appropriate software to enhance the code engine and to pay licenses. Our main aim of forlorn is to get it sold cheaply for all platforms worldwide for everybody to enjoy, it would be a dream come true to see people playing a game that revolves around them. Anyway, let's move onto the game itself!

FORLORN EXISTENCE

Now, i hope you'll understand that we don't want to ruin any surprises here so hopefully you can picture the game in your head.
The idea that we put behind the game in development is to create a simple platformer game that isn't what you think it is. The plan is to make Forlorn Existence the game that changed the eyes of indie-players forever. We want to bring more casual gamers towards indie games, not many people realise how talented some producers out there really are and they definately deserve more credit for such fantastic work, so hopefully we can draw an audience to all you incredible developers out there!
The story of Forlorn revolves around one player who will travel through space during a gigantic fight against the government, however, it doesn't turn out how you may think! After the player crashes, realising he is free from the tight bond of war and policy, he travels through randomly generated planets and scenarios, making friends, kitting out and also creating his own lawless land. But of course, it's not happy and friendly free-bouncing the whole time, as war's can be tough times, he will often run into space pirates, extremely strange planets that will endanger him and much more. Before realising it, the player begins to start a revolution, leading people on his trek through space with him, freeing them from the tight shackles bound to them that go by the name of war and government. Basically, i giant space-trading feud is underway, and the player will uncover more about this throughout the game.

PLAYER INVOLVEMENT/MAIN FEATURES

Most of the features are still in progress and unreleased, but here is a few samples

RANDOM PLANET GENERATION - Probably the biggest feature of the whole game purely because it leads each character on a completely different playthrough every time, stumbling across fantasticly well built cities and planets, right down to a deep, undiscovered over-run planet, lurking with who knows what?

CUSTOMIZABLE CHARACTERS - Now of course, we couldn't just leave the average customization idea with out tweaking it a little, therefore players will be able to actually draw their characters faces, hats, whatever they like! They can also purchase new clothing slots from stores they discover along their space travels, such as a top hat section to draw on, or maybe a bowler hat section to draw on. The player will be able to draw all parts of their characters clothing on, or pick from a preset of characters we have created for the game.

ADVANCED PLATFORMER CONTROLS - Now, when we say this is a platformer, we had to screw with that idea too, so this is not just any simple platformer with simple movement, we'll leave that for you to experience when you do, but all i'll say is, the movement took a lot of time to perfect!

Well, that's pretty much everything i have to say here, what we've shown is not even half of what we hope players will experience in the game, i hate it when people ruin games for me, so we won't do it for anyone who reads this!

You can follow us/like us at these links, or visit the website for information!

fourbytes.tk

facebook.com/fourbytesgames

twitter.com/patrikspengler
twitter.com/angelde98
twitter.com/fourbytesgames

Also, i will soon be starting up a personal page on facebook which will probably post content MOSTLY irrelevant to games, but more entertaining things, c:

Thankyou for reading all of this, i know it's quite a bit, but hopefully you will take an interest in Forlorn! I wish all you amazing people the best and i hope you enjoy what we have to offer!

Love Flynn and the team, :3 <3


SIDE NOTES

If the money raised goes over our goal, it will be put straight to a trusted charity or put to further gaming projects for the company c:

story:
What is Townian?

If you have ever played a strategy browser game like Tribal Wars or Travian, you'll have a good understanding of what Townian is. Except, unlike almost every strategy game out there - you can actually earn real money by playing Townian!

Most games encourage you to get bigger and bigger with the sole purpose of squashing everyone else. What if you could build an empire and then start profiting from it? Townian lets you do that. You can exchange your game resources (Food, Wood, Stone, Iron and Gold) into real money! We call it cashing out. And you can do it whenever you want, as often as you want.

Got your attention yet? Yes, it means that if you play smart, you can actually earn money. So when your mom/girlfriend/husband/etc. tells you to stop wasting your time playing games, tell them you are earning money to buy them something nice =)

Townian has all the traditional components of a good strategy game:

  • Start with a small town and upgrade and expand it into a kingdom
  • Settle new land or conquer other player's towns
  • Research and build troops, upgrade and equip them for battle
  • Buy and sell in the market
  • Forge Alliances, create peace pacts or declare war
  • and much more!

Current Project Status & Use of Funds

The game is already in beta stage - it is fully playable and 90% of the planned features are already implemented. It needs some extensive play testing for bugs and gameplay balance - and a final push to complete the list of tweaks/refinements/extras to get it "out the door." 

So where is the money going? It will enable the developers to take time off from their full time jobs to commit to finishing Townian. If any of the "Bonus" goals are met, it will also enable us to add some pretty cool new features and upgrades too.

Goals

$1000 - reaching this goal will enable us to take time off work to develop full-time for Townian. It should give us enough time to finish everything off and bring the game out of Beta.

$1300 - this level will give us enough to add a list of our "most requested features" which includes: adding a combat simulator, making more buildings upgradable, upgrading the Alliance forums with more features and a better interface, resource calculator and max option, and the ability to create your first town on water or not.

$1800 - if we hit this, we'll hire a professional graphic designer to redo our "Town" graphics including all buildings and the main "landscape" background.

$2000 - we'd be able to afford to have the graphic designer upgrade the user interface by designing buttons, banners, and redoing the boring tables and otherwise sprucing up the layout.

$2500 - mobile version here we come! This level would enable us to start the development of a mobile version of the game so you can play on your phone or tablet from anywhere! 

$2500+ - if by some miracle we raise even more money - it will go towards a huge add-on that we have planned. Though we can't disclose too many details, let's just say it is EPIC! It will more than DOUBLE the size and depth of Townian making it unlike any browser game in existence! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, or you already did (thanks!) - you can still help by getting the word out and making some noise about Townian:

  • Use the "share" tools at the top of this page to spread the word.
  • Post our project on your blog/social media/forehead
  • Keep us motivated by leaving a comment.

Perk Info

For anyone supporting us with a perk that includes Beta access to the game, please give us up to 72 hours to setup your account. Hopefully we will get it done much quicker than that though. PLEASE NOTE: once the Beta round is over, the world will restart. This means that any progress you make will be lost... we know, that is a bummer, but it keeps everything fair.

If your perk includes 1 or more months of a Premium Account, this will be applied to your game account after the Beta is done. You can decide when to activate it and which world you want it active on.

Premium Accounts include: (premium normally costs $3/month)

  • 25% discount on troops
  • Ability to exchange every kind of resource into game currency
  • 1 extra build slot (build 3 buildings at once instead of just 2)
  • Lower minimum withdrawal level ($3 instead of $5)
  • No in-game ads displayed

Perks that include private forum access will be setup within 72 hours (or sooner). We'll email you the access info.

If you grab a perk that includes a copy of the "Make Your Own MMORPG" book (see it on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/dp/0983171602), we'll ship it out ASAP (again, give us about 72 hours or so). If you live outside the US, you'll need to pay shipping if you want the book. You can opt not to receive the book if you don't want to pay for shipping. We'll work it out with you via email.

Perks that include a listing on our Supporter page mean that you can have your name/business and/or website listed on this exclusive page. The page is prominently accessible from any area of the game (there is a direct "Supporter" link on the navigation bar on every page of the game). 

If you select the Honorary Designer package, we'll send you info on how to access the developer server to preview the latest features and give you access to the game spreadsheets.

For those who become Honorary Partners, we'll get in touch ASAP. There is a lot to talk about so we can get you setup on the "inside" =)

story:
Sojourn is a first person RPG currently in the pre-alpha stages of development. We are creating a procedurally generated, open world game and we plan to have the first public pre-alpha release within the next month, free for all to download and try out! This initial release will only demonstrate the core mechanics that make up the game, such as fluid movement and combat in a procedurally generated dungeon, with regular releases after that which introduce more mechanics and content.

 


Our planned feature list;

  * A procedurally generated world of towns, dungeons, and endless terrain to explore.

  * No hidden dice rolls or gameplay based around numbers - if you swing a sword and it hits, it hits!

  * Full character customisation, with a perk system that allows you to give your characters abilities such as parkour-like movement, powerful magic, or brutal combat moves that knock your enemies away!

  * Any item that can be picked up can be used as a weapon, and dual wielded. Use swords, axes, spears, torches, shields, boxes, bags, or anything and everything else as a weapon!

  * A tactile experience that utilises the PhysX engine to bring the world to life. Doors must be grabbed and pulled open, levers have to be manually operated, and traps use physical presence to crush and batter the player.

  * Two separate magic systems for the initial release - raw elemental geomancy that let's the player release the pressure of the earth and causes rock to erupt from the ground and crush enemies or block passages, and magemancy that lets the players themselves write their own spells into books and cast them once power has been accrued.

  * Magical items that feel magical. Magic items will be rare, but could grant abilities such as levitation, teleportation, invisibility or direct mind control!

  * Enemies that often require unique strategies. Hordes of zombies that are only temporarily incapacitated by damage and require that you find and destroy the focal point of their generation. Ghosts that cannot be harmed and will move toward you when you turn from them, requiring utter vigilance while moving through their domain. Demons that can only be damaged with holy weapons, and even then spawn hordes of imps to assail those who battle them.

  * Mod support in the form of easily modifiable XML files that contain all the 3D tiles, clutter, monsters and items that the game populates the world with.

 

 

Sojourn is being developed by a 2-man team, and we could use your help to move this project into a full time permanent commitment for both of us so that we can bring you Sojourn sooner! Follow us on twitter at https://twitter.com/#!/HorrificGames or check out our blog at http://sojourngame.blogspot.co.uk/ to get updates as they come!

story:
Introduction to our campaign:

Hello! We are a group of three developers, here to inform you about our game Brother, and also to kickstart the funding of the game!
Our game Brother, is a unique, story-rich game, where you control a young boy named Dillon. Dillon wakes up one night to find that his brother Adam, whom he lives with, has completely vanished. Afraid and confused, Dillon ventures out of his home into the mysterious forest in which he lives in. Dillon walks down a path outside of his house, searching for his brother, to find a house, shrouded in fog and almost completely unnoticable from sight. 
In beautiful 16-bit graphics, and a unique, original story, Brother is a game you would not want to miss out on!



What we need from you and what you'll receive!

We need around $500 in total. $400 of this money will be put towards resource packs, textures, better sound, and horror materials, for this current project and our projects in the future. 
The remaining $100 will be put towards the Greenlight fee on Steam so our game can be accessed by different gamers from around the world!
The Perks of donating to our game can go from having your name included in the credits, to having your own MAJOR character in the game, getting a steam key before the game is released, and having a special skype call with the developers,  where you will get behind the scenes coverage of the game before it's released!

    The Impact

    With horror games being more, jumpscares and less story driven, Brother with it's unique story and well balanced gameplay, might be able to change the horror genre all together, making horror games be MORE story driven, and LESS full of pointless scares than they ever were!

    Risks & Challenges

    There are few challenges to this campaign, but they are very impactful.

    1. We are only a small team of three developers.

    2. We aren't as experienced as the other developers of the horror genre may be.

    3. We are all still attending school, so most of our free time goes into development of the game.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      You can spread word by putting a link to our campaign on Facebook and Twitter, or even just telling friends or family about it,

story:
Introduction:

I would first like to thank you for taking the time to read this campaign. It means a great deal to me to have your attention for the next few minutes in order to share with you my passion for gaming and entrepreneurship. 

My Story:

My name is Everett Coleman, more commonly known as 'Small' throughout the competitive gaming and E-Sports community. I was born in Houston, Texas on June 4th, 1993 and lived there for 17 years. I had always played video games growing up, but until I discovered Halo, I hadn't felt passionate for gaming. Halo was a way for me to meet people from all over the world, develope a sense of competitiveness, and give myself goals to accomplish. Halo may just be a videogame to most, but I believe this game helped shape who I am today.

As I got older, I found myself getting better and better at competitive Halo while balancing gaming with school work - a difficult task while attending a college preparatory private school. It wasn't until high school when I found out about Major League Gaming, the largest competitive console gaming league in the world. By this time, gaming had taken over a large part of my life. I began competiting in online and local tournaments in hopes to one day set foot on stage at an MLG event. I finally made arrangements to attend and spectate MLG Columbus in 2009 where my mother drove me the 27 hours from Houston. After seeing everything in person, I knew that I wanted to pursue competitive gaming. It was fascinating to me that people would travel all over the world from all different walks of life and come together sharing the same goals, drive, and passion as everyone else in the venue. 

My competitive gaming career started upon attending my next MLG event where my team and I placed in the top 128 - my least favorite tournament placing, but an event I will never forget. After feeling the rush of adrenaline as nothing more than a complete amateur, I wanted to find myself on top of the leaderboards establishing myself as a top player in front of thousands of spectators. I jumped from team to team looking for the perfect mix of players that would be the recipe for success. Several tournaments of increasingly better placings passed and I began to find interest in not only playing the game, but also in coaching. Coaching was a way for me to share my passion and knowledge of the game with other players. We were able to collaborate on ideas and develop strategies that could contend with the best of the best. I coached a team named Ambush and made my very first top 16 placing, considered to be "pro." After this exciting accomplish I underwent several different team changes and top 16 placings until I found myself coaching world renowned Str8 Rippin. Str8 Rippin, consisting of MLG's most successful, storied pro gamer, Tom "Tsquared" Taylor, was a team I looked up to as an amateur years earlier. I now had an opportunity to join forces and compete alongside this iconic team rather than just sit and watch from the stands.
 
This team was a life changing experience. I made it to my very first MLG championship match at MLG Columbus 2011 where we took second place. Despite not winning the event, I felt on top of the world. I competed with Str8 Rippin for a year until Halo was unfortunately removed from the MLG circuit. During this time, I moved to Glen Rose, Texas and finished my last year of High School. Soon after I graduated, I moved to Waco to attend Baylor University. After completing my first semester of college at Baylor, I returned home to start my own business and continue classes online. 

My Dream:

Now, I am in the process of creating my own business named D-Pad which utilizes my passion and knowledge of gaming. I will be producing high quality, gaming (E-Sports) related content while also running my own LAN center in Glen Rose in attempt to spread my love for gaming on a local and worldwide scale. The content that I produce will be published on a website (coming soon) and my social media through the sponsors and partners that I have obtained as a professional gamer such as YouTube, Machinima, and Twitch.tv. This means that my consumers will be able to enjoy the content I produce while generating revenue from my partnerships. I have already completed the construction of a broadcasting studio with the help of Gelbach designs - a prestigious studio construction company.
Once I can come up with the equipment needed to run the studio, I will begin broadcasting podcasts, talk shows, and online tournaments ("The Weekly Challenge"). Due to the current position of the competitive Halo scene, these tournaments will be not only the highest quality and best competition, but also the most frequent. In the meantime, I am putting all of my efforts into my store.
The store includes the studio, LAN center, and a snack shop.  I have stocked this center with 8 Xbox's, monitors and PC's. This allows customers to sit down at a station and have a choice of playing console or PC games on top-of-the-line equipment. Our doors are always open for local gamers, but we also aim to house LAN's among top teams where members of each team will travel to D-Pad from around the country to practice. These practice sessions will also be streamed to our online audience.

My Need for Donations: 

Now, let's cut to the point, I created this fundraising campaign in order to gather enough money to cover the high cost of equipment that I need to deliver the content in a suitable, attractive way. As you can see, the set alone has already been completed. Unfortunately, I am unable to fully take advantage of the set without proper equipment. I am working to deliver broadcasts of the highest quality with the ability to switch between different camera angles, display video assets such as intros, lower thirds, transitions, etc. and a variety of today's most popular, competitive games.
 
I have listed the main expenses below with a brief description of their purpose in order to better explain where your donations will go.

Expenses:

  • (1) Blackmagic ATEM 2 M/E Production Switcher - $4,995
    • This switcher has 16 video inputs which will be used to connect each console and PC to the switcher along with the studio cameras. This gives me the ability to switch between each input at any time throughout the broadcast so that we never miss a moment worth watching!
    • http://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/atem/models/
  • (8) Blackmagic Intensity Pro - $199
    • The capture card enables me to connect each console to a PC in order to feed them into the video switcher while also sending the same signal to the player's monitor.
    • http://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/intensity/models/
  • (8) Blackmagic Mini Converter HDMI to SDI - $295
    • This converter will be used to convert the HDMI cable coming from each PC to an SDI cable so that it will be compatible with the video switcher.
    • http://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/miniconverters/models/
  • (1) 16 Channel Audio Mixer
    • The audio mixer enables me to combine and adjust audio from each device used in the broadcasts.
  • "In-House Cameras"
    • I plan to set up multiple cameras in the building to give the broadcast a reality TV type feel. Our audience will be able to watch live feeds of their favorite professional gamers coming together to practice. Moments that would normally never be seen by fans will now be easily accessible.
  • Studio Cameras
    • I plan to have multiple cameras within the studio to achieve the ability to switch between each one during broadcasts to highlight individuals that may be commentating, being interviewed, etc.
  • Any additional expenses
    • The list above covers the primary goal for this fundraiser. Any additional funds will be used to cover costs of operation, prize money for tournaments, and any additional equipment that could further enhance the broadcast iteself and the experience for our audience. We intend to later expand to a more extensive website, a larger staff team, and coverage of a wider variety of games. We believe that the future is bright and we can assure you that any additional funds will be invested into the future of our vision.

Perks:

As this campaign progresses, we will introduce more and more perks. If you make your donation before a perk is introduced, do not worry, you will be added to the list of recipients anyway. Stay tuned for more perks to be added.

Conclusion:

Once again, I greatly appreciate your time and I hope that you share the same excitement that I do about what the future holds for this project. I believe that with the right amount of resources, hard work, and dedication, this project could evolve into something greater than I imagine. I appreciate any and all support whether that be through monetary contributions or simply spreading the word with your friends and family. In the meantime, feel free to check out my social media on Twitter (www.twitter.com/MLGSmall) and Facebook (www.facebook.com/MLGSmall). 
 
Best regards,
Everett "Small" Coleman
story_txt:
Introduction:
I would first like to thank you for taking the time to read this campaign. It means a great deal to me to have your attention for the next few minutes in order to share with you my passion for gaming and entrepreneurship. 
My Story:
My name is Everett Coleman, more commonly known as 'Small' throughout the competitive gaming and E-Sports community. I was born in Houston, Texas on June 4th, 1993 and lived there for 17 years. I had always played video games growing up, but until I discovered Halo, I hadn't felt passionate for gaming. Halo was a way for me to meet people from all over the world, develope a sense of competitiveness, and give myself goals to accomplish. Halo may just be a videogame to most, but I believe this game helped shape who I am today.
As I got older, I found myself getting better and better at competitive Halo while balancing gaming with school work - a difficult task while attending a college preparatory private school. It wasn't until high school when I found out about Major League Gaming, the largest competitive console gaming league in the world. By this time, gaming had taken over a large part of my life. I began competiting in online and local tournaments in hopes to one day set foot on stage at an MLG event. I finally made arrangements to attend and spectate MLG Columbus in 2009 where my mother drove me the 27 hours from Houston. After seeing everything in person, I knew that I wanted to pursue competitive gaming. story:
Lost Spells at Wise Old Duck Games

Wise Old Duck Games on Facebook

@WOD_Games on Twitter

Hi, I'm Kevin! I like - love - to make games. I started all the way back in high school as a hobbyist, back when floppy disks were a real thing and they were floppy. Eventually I got to do it professionally, as a consultant, for NAMCO, and at Crowdstar. Now I hope to launch my own indie casual studio - Wise Old Duck Games.

My first independent title, Lost Spells, is going to release shortly on iOS. This game is a lot of fun and will hopefully bring a little joy and mental exercise into a lot of people's lives.

What We Need & What You Get

Lost Spells is close to ready - I've been working on this game quite a bit just on my own, but would like to sign up some supporters and pre-sales so I can get what I need to make it sparkly-polished and extra-awesome. Also, I'd like to move forward on other fronts - an Android port, a multiplayer expansion, and a version set in an underwater kingdom designed for children.

The perks represent a limited-time opportunity to get some upgrades in the initial game that will never be available again. There are also beautiful memorabilia at higher levels, that you can keep as a memento of your support during the early days of Lost Spells and Wise Old Duck.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

I am excited by what crowd funding sites like IndieGoGo bring to the relationship between game developers and game players. I think we will see more players getting games they enjoy, and lower hurdles for creative professionals to be independent and try out original ideas.

I'm dedicated to my craft and believe thoughtfully put-together games are a great passtime that make the world a better place. There are a lot of great games out there, but there is also some gunk in how are presently funded and sold.  Join in and be part of a new, more personal approach to creativity!

story:
Everyone Who loves Legendary Island Can Help to Make it Populated Again

Dear Adventurers,

Legendary Island needs you now as never before because we are going to make it on the top of the minecraft server list like it was before. All the raised funds will go into placing Legendary Island on top of the list of minecraft servers. Without your help it cannot be possible. Any contribution is helpful, and two biggest contributors will receive Spirit Rank for one month. The bigger budget we will have the more players we will bring to Legendary Island; therefore, the more players we will see online. You are the ones who can help Legendary Island to get 100 players online again! Let's do it! Let us bring Legendary Island's fame back! All perks are active for one month.

story:
Puppets.life

I built a 3D virtual web puppet that reacts to a physics engine. I did this with web technologies because I wanted it to work in the browser. Then I took it one step further and developed a bridge between the puppet and a smartphone's gyroscope data (the puppet reacts accordingly).

I wanted to go beyond the most used example of using the smartphone as a steering wheel for a simulated car and showcase something that mimics life itself, hence the puppet.

I want to develop a web page that displays a theater where anyone can come in and role play. Where users can become whoever they choose to be.
I wish to let the users choose from tons of puppets so that they can day dream about becoming chefs, karate fighters, scuba divers, musicians, architects, ninjas, sports enthusiasts, spies, surfers and even story tellers! You name it!

Why?

To empower people to fulfil their dreams! 

By role-playing around with virtual puppets I believe they can get the motivation needed to go ahead and fight for their dreams in real life. By enjoying different scenarios and different roles I believe this can help them choose a characterisation of themselves and by taking real world actions (moving the smartphone around) and translating this into the game play I believe it can show them how easy it might be to start out something they might some day love.

Where am I at right now?
I asked a few investors for the money.
I applied to several accelerator programs.
None of it has worked so far.
I have been working on a marketing plan lately but I'd rather spend my time doing what I love the most: developing the game itself.
I have a working demo (showcased in the video!) that shows the technology works. My next steps include:
  • making it possible to customise the look & feel of the puppet and the theater
  • make it possible to choose from different types of puppets
  • plan a social strategy to help people tell their friends what they can do with the virtual puppets
What would you get for helping me out?
First of all: A LOT OF LOVE. Cause frankly it would really help me out and I would really APPRECIATE it.
Then, the perks (hell yeah, you help me out I give something back):
  • Imagine Theaters with your name on them!
  • There are a lot of puppets I wish to develop, imagine if you help me choose where to start (seriously, I would develop a caveman puppet if you'd like me to)! And maybe name the puppet after you (if you fancy such a thing).
  • Imagine your name on big letters on my website next to a huge "Thanks to this awesome person I was able to build this and you are able to play here"!
What happens if I don't reach my goal?
Well, I'm asking for money to hire a web designer, an artist (someone to draw the puppets), another tech guy and to pay the bills while I devote myself full time to this project (in all seriousness I did quit my job to do so, but eventually I will run out of my own funds). I'll use any money I get to stay afloat and when/if it runs out, I'll do what I have been doing so far: getting a regular 9 to 5, saving up and then pursuing this project again!

Cheers,
Gorka
Expect Awesomeness


The demo:
Go to the following address in you r computer (chrome browser - only one working for this demo) and it will display a QR code/URL.
Open the url in your android device in chrome (iOS coming soon) and enjoy.
http://demo.puppets.life

story:
6th Annual NES Marathon Benefiting Children's Miracle Network Hospitals

Pat and Ian are back for another LIVE classic Nintendo gaming marathon as they raise money for the Children's Miracle Network! Watch them LIVE during the event as they play from a library of over 750 8-bit Nintendo games, interact with viewers, and give away prizes. There's also special guest cameos of other internet personalities who "stop by" via video! This year there will be events (exclusive videos, game challenges, etc.) that will be unlocked via donation amount goals reached! This page will be updated with those events as well as the giveaways as they are announced!

The live event begins Saturday, Nov. 21st at 3PM EST / 12PM PST! Tune in and watch the fun at NESmarathon.com!


Donating & Shaping the NES Marathon

All proceeds will go to the Children's Miracle Network, an organization that provides money to children's hospitals in need: 

Since 1983, Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals has raised more than $5 billion—most of it $1 at a time—for 170 children’s hospitals across the United States and Canada, which, in turn, use the money where it’s needed the most. These donations have gone to support research and training, purchase equipment, and pay for uncompensated care, all to save and improve the lives of as many children as possible.

Any donation amount is greatly appreciated! As a thank you to donors at the $25 and above level, they will be able to help choose what games Pat and Ian play! Donors who select those perks have the option of making the donation in the name of any NES title released on the system, via Indiegogo's comment system. The more money raised in the name of any individual game, the more time will be allotted for Pat and Ian to play it! The NES marathon really relies on the input of the viewers -- so help out a great cause and help make the event what you want to watch! Another bonus in donating: since it is a charitable organization you are donating to, your contribution will be 100% tax deductible!

Note: All game-playing and time lengths are up to the discretion of Ian/Pat. Game-play lengths may not be exact and may be cut for time due to amount of games selected/scheduled.

So that's what's going on! During the event, we'll have fun, prizes, and some surprises in store. This page will be updated in the near future with more perks and specific stretch goals that you can look forward to. 

Sponsorship Opportunities

Another way in which the NES Marathon is able to raise money is by offering visibility and advertising to websites, organizations, businesses, and individuals who wish to make a larger donation and help sponsor the event. In return for these generous donations the donor will receive exposure in the form of banners on the marathon's main page, radio style read-out ads, commercial spots during regular break times, and at the highest levels call-ins and dedicated hour blocks. Tens of thousands of viewers watched the 5th Annual event last year... here's your chance for your website/business to gain some great exposure while helping out a great cause with a 100% tax-deductible donation! Please check out the available package perks at the side for more details! If donating, all marketing pictures/materials must be submitted by November 15.

Spreading the Word

The NES Marathon's success is based largely upon others spreading the word via Twitter, Facebook, etc. Indiegogo.com can actually track how many donation referrals come in through your retweeting, posting the link, etc. To show our appreciation, we will reward the person responsible with the most donation referrals with a prize! We'll announce what this is later.

Thank You!

The NES Marathon has raised over $70,000 for hospitalized children in its first five years and we hope to continue strongly this year and into the future. Thanks to everyone for taking the time to read this page and all past/present donors and sponsors. Please help spread the word spread the word about this event on social media, twitter, etc. to help get the event more exposure and donations! We can't wait for Nov. 21st!

$13,800 Wally Bear and the No! Gang
$14,100 Pat Chooses a Game
$14,400 Baby Boomer
$14,700 Guerilla War 2 player co-op
$15,000 TBA
story_txt:
6th Annual NES Marathon Benefiting Children's Miracle Network HospitalsPat and Ian are back for another LIVE classic Nintendo gaming marathon as they raise money for the Children's Miracle Network! Watch them LIVE during the event as they play from a library of over 750 8-bit Nintendo games, interact with viewers, and give away prizes. There's also special guest cameos of other internet personalities who "stop by" via video! This year there will be events (exclusive videos, game challenges, etc.) that will be unlocked via donation amount goals reached! This page will be updated with those events as well as the giveaways as they are announced!The live event begins Saturday, Nov. 21st at 3PM EST / 12PM PST! Tune in and watch the fun at NESmarathon.com!Donating & Shaping the NES MarathonAll proceeds will go to the Children's Miracle Network, an organization that provides money to children's hospitals in need: Since 1983, Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals has raised more than $5 billion—most of it $1 at a time—for 170 children’s hospitals across the United States and Canada, which, in turn, use the money where it’s needed the most. These donations have gone to support research and training, purchase equipment, and pay for uncompensated care, all to save and improve the lives of as many children as possible.Any donation amount is greatly appreciated! As a thank you to donors at the $25 and above level, they will be able to help choose what games Pat and Ian play! Donors who select those perks have the option of making the donation in the name of any NES title released on the system, via Indiegogo's comment system. The more money raised in the name of any individual game, the more time will be allotted for Pat and Ian to play it! The NES marathon really relies on the input of the viewers -- so help out a great cause and help make the event what you want to watch! Another bonus in donating: since it is a charitable organization you are donating to, your contribution will be 100% tax deductible!Note: All game-playing and time lengths are up to the discretion of Ian/Pat. Game-play lengths may not be exact and may be cut for time due to amount of games selected/scheduled.So that's what's going on! During the event, we'll have fun, prizes, and some surprises in store. This page will be updated in the near future with more perks and specific stretch goals that you can look forward to. Sponsorship OpportunitiesAnother way in which the NES Marathon is able to raise money is by offering visibility and advertising to websites, organizations, businesses, and individuals who wish to make a larger donation and help sponsor the event. In return for these generous donations the donor will receive exposure in the form of banners on the marathon's main page, radio style read-out ads, commercial spots during regular break times, and at the highest levels call-ins and dedicated hour blocks. Tens of thousands of viewers watched the 5th Annual event last year... here's your chance for your website/business to gain some great exposure while helping out a great cause with a 100% tax-deductible donation! Please check out the available package perks at the side for more details! If donating, all marketing pictures/materials must be submitted by November 15.Spreading the WordThe NES Marathon's success is based largely upon others spreading the word via Twitter, Facebook, etc. Indiegogo.com can actually track how many donation referrals come in through your retweeting, posting the link, etc. To show our appreciation, we will reward the person responsible with the most donation referrals with a prize! We'll announce what this is later.Thank You!The NES Marathon has raised over $70,000 for hospitalized children in its first five years and we hope to continue strongly this year and into the future. Thanks to everyone for taking the time to read this page and all past/present donors and sponsors. Please help spread the word spread the word about this event on social media, twitter, etc. to help get the event more exposure and donations! We can't wait for Nov. 21st!      Marathon Milestones & Goals!(subject to change)

story:
Update May 10th:

The alpha applications for turfbattles for non-donators is now in progress, please email contactus@turfbattles.net if you want to be in the alpha, Donators will also need to contact us to give us their emails.

Update April 30th :

We have finally reached our goal!, this is awesome news, and it really gives us power to make this game!, thank you all for your donations and we hope that you'll continue supporting us ;) remember we can still go over 5000$, and it'll just help us out more!

Update April 27:

Wow, this is amazing, we are now featured on the front page of indiegogo!, this is a great opportunity to show turfbattles to the world and open turfbattles up to an entire new community!, thank you indiegogo! and every one who has supported us!.

April 17:

Hello, thank you for your contributions, it is amazing how much we have raised so quickly, if you want to donate a large amount of money (over 500$) please do not send it through paypal, please do a direct transfer.

April 15:

Wow, in 24 hours we have raised over one fifth of our goal, we can also licence our game for commercial use, thank you very much!.

NOTICE:

750$ guarantees that we can licence our game and provide it to you in a commercial environment.

APRIL 14th Update:

we have gotten our first donation!!, thank you very much. Here is another picture, this is frozenland, a PvP area, it has igloos where you fight monsters too. Bosses that are very strong are in the igloos!.

 

We are Envision, an inde development team with alot of experienced people in our team. We are players of old games such as Diablo 2, remember in the good old days when we all loved the old games with small amounts of grinding and lots of fast paced PVP?. Now the day has come to finish developing our game Turf Battles. We as a team see no MMO's anymore that have old school PvP (player versus player action), that can satisfy our lust for PvP like in diablo 2, who wants cast times?, our game will not have cast times, except from the cast times that are part of the animation. The grind in our game will be fun, the game is meant to be fun.

TurfBattles is an action PvP game, it is a fast paced game with lots of action, it is a fully 3D game. We are putting all our efforts into the game, we also can not promise a game that is 100% complete at the end of this funding.

This is the game we "Envision" hence our teams name. We have a community of players waiting on this game.

Story behind the game:

Humans and Elves have fought for generations, but one day, a disease mysteriously spread across the land, this meant the humans and elves had to call a truce and fall back onto the land of fuan. The disease mutated normal humans and elves into zombies, and hideous monsters that no one had ever seen before. Once the humans and elves had regrouped in numbers, it's their turn to fight back, destroy the mutant monsters, make sure to rid them of the land which was once your home!.

The funds raised will allow us to become that much closer to completing the game of ours and many other peoples dreams.

 More about our game!

Turfbattles is a MMORPG game, many players will be able to interact with each other, explore the vast worlds and capture turfs!.  Found your own tribe, fight it out on the turfs and make sure to defend them!.

The money donated will go towards:

  • Licencing of the game engine
  • Outsourcing artists
  • 3D modellers
  • C++ programmers

story:
Quantum Gate Concept Art

We Are The Swarm

Is the internet becoming self aware? As a side effect of development and deployment of autonomous software agents on the internet, a network of self sustaining, self directed daemons has evolved and is showing evidence of pre-sentient behavior. Self discovery, self modification, intention, and other attributes of higher order cognition have been found in the behavior of this complex web of entities and information packets that appear to operate as probes of the global information space. Analysis of this web has shown evidence of larger scale behaviors akin to schooling fish and flocking birds. Also exhibited is spontaneous organization into what are best described as “factions”, competition for resources, and the evolution of probes into behaviors optimized for specific tasks (e.g. attack, defense, harvesting). Few humans are even aware of these probes, and none are sure of the daemons’ true intentions.

Game Mechanics
The game mechanics and economy are still in flux. These are the critical design issues that ultimately make a game engaging and fun or boring and lame. These items reflect our current thinking, but nothing is set.

  • Resources

    • Resource probes traverse paths to harvest

    • Resources available are proportional to the length of the path and previous depletion

    • Resources on paths replenish

    • Random drops - paths can have special items that are scattered randomly. Harvesting along a path harvests the item

  • Path Control

    • To control an path you must control each end. Controlling both ends confers some type of bonus. A team or faction controlling both ends gives a bonus to all team members. An individual player controlling both ends gets a bonus different from a faction.

    • At each end of a path is a Quantum Gate. To pass through a gate you must pay a toll to the owner of the gate.  The toll is paid in the base resource mined by resource probes. The toll could be very high to unfriendlies. Transit could be not allowed at all if hostile. Controlled gates could be bought and sold.

    • A path could have a level based on the levels of the two ends. So if the gates at each end are level 10 then the drops and resource allocations along that edge would be consistent with level 10 play.

    • A high level path could be impassable to a low level player.

  • Achievements - Individual Achievements, Team Achievements, Exploration, Conquering, Upgrading

  • Operational cost - For certain probes to continue to “live” they require a constant stream of the base resource. Upgrades can either reduce or eliminate the operational cost of probes.

  • Finding upgrades - In addition to a tech tree, players can mine up or find pieces of “software” floating around in the paths. Once a player finds the appropriate  pieces they can combine them at a cost and obtain the upgrade.

  • Proposed Daemon Types

    • Player Daemon 

    • Service Daemons - Repair or Auction Daemons or other practical services scattered through the game space by admins

    • Dead Daemon - Daemons of players that have exited the game

    • Dormant Daemons - A node still in the system but not actively played

    • Control Daemons - Enforcers of level compatibility and partitioning of the game space

    • Meta Daemons - Monitors of the System. Known for injecting instability into the information space to force evolution of lower order Daemons

    • Omni Daemons - God level. Special peaceful nodes that new players will create their first path to. These also control experience matching to help prevent ganking newbies. Also have other super powers invoked as needed.

  • Combat

    • Players send squadrons of probes. Gates have various defenses such as turrets and shields.

    • Player can strategically recall probes if they are weak against specific defenses

    • Probes and turrets have varying strengths and weaknesses against each other. Certain attacks are great against shields, others against armor.

    • More tactical probes can involve “hacking” and converting enemies to the players side.

    • Weapon types include: Beam weapons, ramming, being pulled apart by electrostatic force, crushing, energy draining.


 

Control your information space with Quantum Gates!



Use your Attack Probes to capture territory and destroy enemies!

Harvest Qubits with Resource Probes!

Send out Scout Probes to discover new places!

Defend your Quantum Gates with Turrets!

YES! We are giving away loot.

All you need to do is make a pledge to be eligible, But there are a few rules.

  • You can only win once
  • The drawing takes place the day after the campaign ends. This is so we know how many we are giving away and so everyone has an equal chance.
  • The Loot Crate is random. There is no good way to let you pick a certain one.

Net Neutrality

Hyperswarm is a computer game using an AI engine that enables emergent, un-programmed behaviors. It also has the pleasant side effect of producing a data stream that will monitor performance internet in a way that allows us to track changes in data flow as regulations for Net Neutrality are finalized and implemented.

Net Neutrality is a broad ranging topic, but it essentially boils down to who gets to control the Internet and how that control affects consumers. In the end, it is the consumers that make the engine of the information age run. It's not in our best interests to cede control of the most important technology of our lifetimes to a short list of very large multinational corporations. Some of the specific issues include:

  • Bandwidth Throttling
  • Data Discrimination
  • Search Neutrality
  • Tiered Internet Service.

The underlying AI system for this game uses the peer to peer connections between players to extract a rich data stream of internet performance metrics. From this we will develop a database that can be used to monitor information flow throughout the Internet. For more information about Internet Neutrality look at these websites:

https://www.publicknowledge.org/issues/net-neutrality

http://mashable.com/2014/09/06/internet-without-net-neutrality/

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Net_neutrality


    What We Need
    Same story, different campaign. There really are a lot of good ideas out there and we all need the same thing - the resources to go from an idea to reality.
    • Legal and Accounting fees. There is nothing worse than running afoul of the tax man. And every way we turn there is another form or other legal document that needs to be filed.
    • Patent and Trademark costs. The underlying AI technology is innovative, but if patents already exists that overlap with it, the entire project could be shut down by a lawsuit. An initial patent search has been completed and it looks like we are good to go for a filing. We have a patent firm on retainer and are moving forward with the process. Trademarks are just as important. If we infringe on any trade marks we would be forced to rename everything on the fly. This is expensive and confusing. 
    • Infrastructure. Our servers are cloud based which keeps the cost down, but we still need to keep them alive. We also need some hardware for testing multiple platforms
    • Licensing development software. For example, the Unity Pro game development platform costs $900 per year per developer.
    • Marketing. We are travelling to regional gaming conventions on a listening tour, getting feedback regarding game play, graphics and monetization. 

    Development Plan

    The immediate goal is to release the Internet Sensory Array as soon as possible. The reason for this is that there are a number of critical technical hurdles that must be addressed before it can be integrated with the game. These include peer to peer communications, fault tolerance, navigation and security.

    While we solve these technical challenges, we will be pushing ahead with more concept art, game mechanics and initial renderings of the game space using the Unity game development platform.

    Release dates depend on the success of this campaign and our other efforts to finance the project.
     

    The Impact of Hyperswarm

    The perceived social impact of computer games is often the victim of bad press. Glorified violence, gratuitous sex, addiction. You know - "Computer games are destroying the world!". We'll leave that discussion to the internet trolls, talking heads and social voyeurs. With Hyperswarm, there is a genuine social benefit. While we really want people to have fun with the game, the impact on the Internet Neutrality debate is potentially immeasurable. One of the real challenges in the controversy is that it is difficult to prove how data flow changes as Internet Service Providers modify their policies and user agreements. We believe our system will peel back the curtain and reveal things that some big players would prefer remain hidden.
    Risks and Challenges
    Every project has risks and challenges. Hyperswarm is no exception. These are some of the issues we have to overcome:
    • Intellectual property. Our core engine has to be vetted to ensure it does not infringe on current patents. We have already put a patent law firm on retainer and are completing a patent application. The initial patent search has already been performed and it looks positive.
    • Scalability. The core engine will not work until there are sufficient numbers of data collectors deployed in the wild. We think 1000 "sensors" will do, but until we get to that level the accuracy of the system is degraded.
    • Time delays. If we ultimately cannot fund this project, the time it takes to develop and deploy would likely kill it. Technological innovations happen with blinding speed and if we can't fast track the development, the train won't just pass us by, it will run us over. 

    No spare cash? You can still help!

    If you really like this project but can't support us right now, you can still help us. First, take our online survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/GWKQDHB. Second, and most importantly, you can help us by getting the word out. The hardest part of a crowd sourcing campaign is getting the attention of the crowd. Helping us build our social links and forming our crowd is HUGE.  After all, we only want you to 

    BE THE SWARM!

story:
Design your life and draw out your hidden talents easily by playing this deceptively simple & fun game which all students and working professionals can enjoy.

Introducing A Brand New Online Gamified Training Programme That Naturally Awakens Your Hidden Abilities And Powers To Control & Design Your Life Exactly The Way You Want It!


Best part: It doesn’t matter what stage of your life you are at right now, this gamified training programme is designed to extract your reservoir of potent magnetic power that pulls you towards your destiny.

Dear Friend,

Have you ever heard of Final Fantasy, World of Warcraft, Diablo, Grand Theft Auto, Call of Duty or Pokemon? 

Where you start out in the beginning with practically nothing, then you gain experience, skills, powers, equipment and you finally become a strong, unstoppable hero to take on any challenge the game throws at you?

No matter if it’s fighting seemingly impossible bosses or solving really difficult puzzles, you know you’ll be able to beat it if you had the right hints and guides. 

Imagine if your life was like a game - where you live an adventure and you get guided through life to take on those difficult challenges to live the life you want.

Using Gamification As Your Personal Winning Strategy To Achieve Your Goals

Gami-What?

Gamification is the use of game concepts, game design principles and game elements in non-game contexts. 

I'm sure you know some people who spend a lot of time on games - imagine if all the usually long, boring tasks become fun-filled engaging games and activities... you'll be auto-motivated to do extraordinary things and achieve your goals.

Gamification motivates you to do extraordinary things and achieve your goals by:

  • Subtly motivates and engages your entire being
  • Gives you clarity, understanding and meaning
  • Take command of your behavior
  • Develop your skills through play, just like how you learnt tough skills even as a kid
  • Awaken your untapped innovative problem solving capabilities.

“The Awakening of Heroes” Is The First-Ever Online Gamified Training Programme

“The Awakening of Heroes” is designed to help you take complete control of designing your life right now just by playing. 

This concept of playing is not new but we’ve taken a revolutionary spin to it by making it a totally unique experience that summons up your potent power, for real.

When you play this gamified programme, you’ll receive all the benefits from Chinese Metaphysics, Strengths Psychology, Self-empowerment Coaching, Positive Mindset and even Mind Doodling as “The Awakening of Heroes” is backed up by thousands of years of history and science! 

“The Awakening of Heroes” has 3 game quests:

  1. Level 1 Quest: Awakening - Discover your hidden resources and power
  2. Level 2 Quest: Your Calling - Live out your true calling
  3. Level 3 Quest: Power Up - Empower yourself to take consistent actions
The 3 game quests are designed around a gamification framework - meaning that you'll go through a smooth seamless interconnected process, helping you change your old, destructive and negative habit patterns into new, powerful and driving forces to achieve your goals with ease and enjoyment... all while playing a game!


A Player-Centric Designed Gamified Programme!

To gauge your progress on the adventurous journey in this programme, you will start off with these 3 stats: Clarity, Passion and Drive. 

They are the key elements of achieving your goals and dreams in your real life.

In order to achieve long-lasting effect and successful change through the programme to deal with life's constant changes, we have mimicked these 3 elements. 

You will be going through game quests to increase the level for each stat.


Level 1 Quest: Awakening - Discover your hidden resources and power

“Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.” - Aristotle 

In the very first quest, let's help you gain Greater Clarity. 

If you feel that you deserve a better life and there is so much more to life that what you are living right now, the good news is - you can change it! 

Clarity is an important factor to change and being aware of it is merely the first step. When you are sure of what you want, you will know what you need to execute and change your life.

In this quest, you will learn and develop the skill to be aware of yourself with clarity, thus, helping you make better choices. 

On top of that, having equipped with this skill, you will also understand others better and help you to build rapport with them.

What's In It For You? 

  • You will get to know yourself (your game character’s life codes, roles and many more) in the   form of pictures through the first ever Character Metaprofiling by just keying in your birth date and time.
  • Learn the universal pictorial technique of Bazi, The Eight Characters, to discover your hidden power and resources. How to unleash the power? How to boost your strengths? How to manage your weaknesses? When is the best moment of your life to reach your ultimate goal and dream?
  • Detect and be aware of your current level of drive and passion.
  • Decode the best wealth creation path for you, determine your optimum career direction and discover how you can build great relationships.

Level 2 Quest: Your Calling - Live out your true calling

 "

The things you are passionate about are 

not random. They are your calling.”


In the second quest, you will be constantly firing up your Passion!

By doing what you love, what you good at, what serves the world, you will find the sweet spot in life - that is your calling. In this quest, we introduce you an unique and interesting story-based questioning technique to derive your calling!

This quest will also show you how to set goals effectively to have a balanced and fulfilling life. We go deep and discover the secrets of how some are able to achieve their goals while most are not able to.

What's In It For You? 

  • Write your story to discover your ultimate purpose, ignite your passion and maximise your potential.
  • There will be step by step guide for you to determine your core values and limiting beliefs.
  • There will be hands-on activities to know what you really want to do and love to do now by doing your Circle of Life assessment.
  • Set compelling goals effectively that give you a balanced and fulfilling life.

Level 3 Quest: Power Up - Empower yourself to take consistent actions 

"I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand." - Confucius

For the third quest, you will be empowered with ever-lasting Drive!

Many people don’t take consistent actions to achieve their goals, as they did not create appealing images in their minds that drive them to their goals. 

To reach your goals, you not only need to mind doodle your identity and goals, you also need to creatively mind doodle the process as well. 

In fact, this process "sticks" to your mind, constantly feeding you strength to positively empower and overcome any challenges towards your goals.

We created affirmative doodling techniques to help you to unburden your mind, stay focused and drive you to take consistent actions.

What's In It For You? 

  • Learn how to mind and speed doodle what's on your mind!
  • Create affirmative doodles for yourself as an empowering tool to solidify your identity and goal.
  • Use affirmative doodling technique on your strategies to overcome common challenges on your journey to achieve your goals, such as fear of rejection, fear of losing, self-doubts, lack of confidence and procrastination. 
  • Also, use affirmative doodling technique to drive you towards your goals with your core values, strengths and new empowering beliefs.

/ * Note: The 3 above-mentioned quests contents could change as we continue to improve on them /

This Gamified Programme Is For You If...

  • You want to quickly recall all the useful techniques you've learnt but forgotten from all the self-upgrading workshops you've spent your precious time and money on
  • Discovering your hidden potential, passion and reigniting your drive is what you need right now

  • You are not satisfied with your current level of studies, career and life but you know very well that you deserve better than where you are now

  • The thought of "self-discipline" scares you but you know you can achieve your goals and dreams as long as you can overcome this obstacle

  • You simply desire and want to have more fun, enjoyment and fulfillment in achieving your goals and dreams

Whether you’re going to graduate soon, you're a fresh graduate looking to start your career, or, currently as a working professional, you'll find this programme particularly useful to you and amazingly practical yet fun!

We Need Your Help

We have a bold and audacious goal... we want to impact 1 million lives through this gamified programme. 

We need your help to bring this programme to as many people as possible - creating a world with more empowered heroes with actionable dreams, happiness, courage, creativity and a life filled with meaningful purpose. 

Your contribution to this project will help students set their paths to a more fulfilling career while also helping today’s working professionals perform at their absolute best and have lots of fun at work.

We aim to raise USD5,000 and your contribution will help us with the funding necessary to complete the creation of this online programme and bring this life-changing experience... to the comfort of many people's home where they can watch the videos and level up at any time!

We believe that with the collaborative effort of your help, this is not a far-fetched goal. 

And if you know of anyone who needs more motivation, who needs more fun in their lives and become more driven to success, please share this gamified programme with them! 

You can really help just by sharing this programme with your friends.

We seek to roll this programme out to the masses by November 2015. 

The game is almost 30% complete, but we face restrictions with resources. We aim to raise USD5,000 in funding to assist us with the following:

  • Getting cameras, filming lights, and other tools and equipment
  • Manpower costs for filming of The Awakening of Heroes 3 Quest videos
  • Creation of The Awakening of Heroes gamified training website
  • Creation of theme music and sound effects for The Awakening of Heroes

With your help, this is definitely possible! 

And with every kind contribution, you will also get exclusive rewards that we have specially prepared for our backers (refer to the Perks for more details). 

And if you change your mind due to our inability to launch the programme by the promised date (which we certainly want to strive towards, but just in case..), we will hold ourselves answerable, and be glad to refund your pledge to us, within 30 days after supposed launch date, with no questions asked.

You can also get regular updates about the game progress through our Facebook Page (https://www.facebook.com/theawakeningofheroes) to find out the progress of this exciting new programme! Let's embark on this journey together! 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support us by:

  • Getting the word out and make some noise about the game to reach 1 million individuals.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell you friends to play the game and level up together. Remember: Games are best played with friends!

Free Bonus: Signed Paperback Book For All Contributors

With your generous contribution, you will get a special free signed copy of my new gamified self-development book “The Secret Code: Is It For Real?” with written foreword by Asia’s Top Success Coach Adam Khoo and Social Entrepreneur Elim Chew. 

The retail price of this book is USD32, but you’ll get it for free if you’ll just help contribute to this project - I’ll even absorb the shipping and handling fees!

It is a practical book bringing together the essence of games, art and stories to find your identity, your talents, improving concentration in your learning as well as achieving your goals with exciting game-like leveling up approach.

Imagine, for a moment, what would your life be like a year from today? How well are you doing? 

If you continue to do the same things the same way you’ve been doing for the past few years, you’re going to get the same results.

A year will pass by very quickly - the time to take control and design your destiny is now. 

You have nothing to lose because regardless, the free book is yours to keep just for showing your support.

Last words...

"The game of life has two participants: spectators and players. Pick one."

We hope you can join us on this amazing and fun adventure! Let’s play to win this game of life together and I look forward to helping you win.
