story:
Artifact is an epic journey to stop a great and powerful lemon scented evil from taking over and ruling the world. Your adventure will bring you to many different locations, as you side scroll and defeat minion after minion. Each location will have its own unique setting and contain special interactive items for you to use and uncover. Explore, discover, and upgrade with Artifact!



How do we give you epic, mind boggling, adrenaline quenching action? By assembling an assortment of unusual enemies, strong characters, and interactive areas. With different sets of characters and playable maps to choose from, you’ll have plenty of ways to fight off evil!



This retro indie game would not be the same without its dynamic gameplay. We’ve created features including:

  • 8 Unique Characters
  • 3 Interactive maps
  • Competitive Horde Mode
  • Leaderboards
  • Achievements

 



Artifact comes with 8 interesting, unique, powerful characters. Each has varied attacks and statistics, bringing their own kind of excitement to the battleground.

The awesome characters of Artifact include:


The Steambot - A robot powered by... you guessed it, steam! His attacks and movements come directly from his power source. He is a machine to be reckoned with.


The Agent - The man in disguise. No one knows his true identity. He uses the tactics of stealth and deception to take out his enemies. Who knows, he may even be watching you this very second...


The Patriot - The iconic symbol of America. Recognized for his bravery and patriotism, the Patriot’s mission is to protect liberty from evil.


The Spartan - Recognized as the greatest warrior in all of Greece, he started his training as a child. The Spartan seeks to conquer and vanquish his opponents with his sword and shield shaped by the blood and suffering of thousands of men.


The Wiz - An ancient sorcerer from the dark age. He may be old, but his mastery of the arcane arts makes him a force to be reckoned with.

The Tweeter -  The core of 21st century media and the long-lost inspiration for epic posts. Social media is a powerful tool, and it kicks butt to rule the world.


The Assassin - Highly trained in the art of death, taking out his enemies from the shadows. He doesn't even make a sound.


Maps in Artifact use a vectored drawing style. This gives our maps a more pixilated look, which works well with characters. It also helps the game run efficiently. 

The epic maps of Artifact include:


Hyper-Jump - Take shortcuts to navigate the map. These platforms let you jump high in the sky to survive against huge waves of enemies


Booster - A convenient form of transportation, boosters let the player glide upwards to reach and avoid enemy attacks


Maps in Artifact use a vectorized drawing style. This gives our maps a more pixilated look, which works well with characters. It also helps the game run efficiently. 

The epic maps of Artifact include:


Metropolis - A bustling city composed of soaring skyscrapers and cement walkways. The Metropolis is the result of financial growth and the dreams of making it big


Foundry - An urban, indoor environment nestled in the heart of the industrial complex. The Foundry serves in the manufacturing of many different products, including some available for purchase at the Superstore


Sacred Earth - The long forgotten location of the Artifact. The area remains a legend as old as the forest itself


Horde Mode is the main component of our game. You’ll fight numerous waves of enemies on the screen. As you progress through higher waves, you’ll face more and more enemies who get noticeably faster and stronger. Additionally, your score multiplier increases as you kill more enemies, pushing you to survive longer each time.

The scoring system is based off of earning points through a multiplier. The multiplier improves by 1 as you kill more enemies. For example, if you kill 100 enemies, your multiplier will earn you 100 points per kill. More enemies spawn as you get farther in the game, giving you more opportunities to earn points.


The leaderboards will post the high scores you earn from Horde Mode. Each character will have their own section for posting scores and a section for the highest scores overall. You’ll be able to brag about your high scores on Facebook and Twitter. Whether you’re competing for top spots, or just want to show off against friends, the leaderboard system adds a competitive twist to Artifact.


Achievements give the player objectives to accomplish in Artifact. These achievements consist of additional challenges that test the player’s various skills in the game. Achievements are based on the amount of points you achieve, the number of enemies you kill, your purchased items, and many more. With these goals, players can challenge themselves to achieve perfection.


Our passion for making great games has no limit, but our budget sure does! We happen to be a group of game designers and programmers who are currently enrolled as Juniors and Seniors in High School. The resources available to us simply aren't enough. Should you decide to fund us, you'll be investing directly into our product. Funds will go to research and development costs, software, and additional equipment to make all our endeavors for the game, a reality! We want to produce of additional material that we had originally intended to put in. This is why we need your support.



Baseline ($4000) - The game will include Horde Mode, 3 maps, and 8 characters. We will also begin to develop and integrate the in-game store and items into our game

Campaign ($5000) - Our game will come to life with an engaging story line. You’ll be playing on a variety of maps, facing an onslaught of minions and bosses! Keep on fighting until you come face to face with an evil enemy who has the ultimate power, the power of the Artifact.

Multiplayer ($7500) - Engage in intense 1v1 multiplayer battles on a variety of maps, challenging you to test your skills and adapt your fighting strategies. Feeling less competitive? We’ll also add a co-op option to horde mode, allowing you to kick some butt with a friend.

Donating to Charity/Non-Profits ($10,000) - If we reach a certain limit, we will donate half of our game’s future profits to local charities and non-profit organizations within our community.

No Ads ($20,000) - Artifact will have no annoying ads. Period.


A Special Thanks

We are very grateful for Indiegogo and its community for being able to give us a real opportunity to make our ideas a reality. Even if this project doesn't come to fruition we have learned the concepts of engineering, design, and marketing first-hand. We have sacrificed blood, sweat, many hours of sleep, and our hard earned money to develop this game, and we now understand the value this site has to offer. We would like to thank all our backers for sharing in our fervor and enthusiasm for this product, and believing in our ability to push through with this project. Success will surely be a life changing experience (and an educational one) that will truly kickoff our career in the engineering field, as we will be driven to deliver the best customer experience we can. Thank you!

The Spartan - Recognized as the greatest warrior in all of Greece, he started his training as a child. The Spartan seeks to conquer and vanquish his opponents with his sword and shield shaped by the blood and suffering of thousands of men.



The Wiz - An ancient sorcerer from the dark age. He may be old, but his mastery of the arcane arts makes him a force to be reckoned with.



The Tweeter -  The core of 21st century media and the long-lost inspiration for epic posts. Social media is a powerful tool, and it kicks butt to rule the world.

The Assassin - Highly trained in the art of death, taking out his enemies from the shadows. He doesn't even make a sound.



Maps
in Artifact use a vectored drawing style. This gives our maps a more
pixilated look, which works well with characters. It also helps the game run
efficiently. 
The
epic maps of Artifact include:
Hyper-Jump - Take shortcuts to navigate the map. These platforms let you jump high in the sky to survive against huge waves of enemies



Booster - A convenient form of transportation, boosters let the player glide upwards to reach and avoid enemy attacks



Maps in Artifact use a vectorized drawing style. This gives our maps a more pixilated look, which works well with characters. It also helps the game run efficiently. 
The epic maps of Artifact include:
Metropolis - A bustling city composed of soaring skyscrapers and cement walkways. The Metropolis is the result of financial growth and the dreams of making it big



Foundry - An urban, indoor environment nestled in the heart of the industrial complex. The Foundry serves in the manufacturing of many different products, including some available for purchase at the Superstore




Sacred Earth - The long forgotten location of the Artifact. The area remains a legend as old as the forest itself







Horde Mode is the main component of our game. You’ll fight numerous waves of enemies on the screen. As you progress through higher waves, you’ll face more and more enemies who get noticeably faster and stronger. Additionally, your score multiplier increases as you kill more enemies, pushing you to survive longer each time.

The scoring system is based off of earning points through a multiplier. The multiplier improves by 1 as you kill more enemies. For example, if you kill 100 enemies, your multiplier will earn you 100 points per kill. More enemies spawn as you get farther in the game, giving you more opportunities to earn points.



The leaderboards will post the high scores you earn from Horde Mode. Each character will have their own section for posting scores and a section for the highest scores overall. You’ll be able to brag about your high scores on Facebook and Twitter. Whether you’re competing for top spots, or just want to show off against friends, the leaderboard system adds a competitive twist to Artifact.



Achievements give the player objectives to accomplish in Artifact. These achievements consist of additional challenges that test the player’s various skills in the game. Achievements are based on the amount of points you achieve, the number of enemies you kill, your purchased items, and many more. With these goals, players can challenge themselves to achieve perfection.




Our
passion for making great games has no limit, but our budget sure does! We
happen to be a group of game designers and programmers who are currently
enrolled as Juniors and Seniors in High School. The resources available to us
simply aren't enough. Should you decide to fund us, you'll be investing
directly into our product. Funds will go to research and development
costs, software, and additional equipment to make all our endeavors for the
game, a reality! We want to produce of additional material that we had
originally intended to put in. This is why we need your support.



Baseline ($4000) - The game will include Horde Mode, 3 maps, and 8 characters. We will also begin to develop and integrate the in-game store and items into our game
Campaign ($5000) - Our game will come to life with an engaging story line. You’ll be playing on a variety of maps, facing an onslaught of minions and bosses! Keep on fighting until you come face to face with an evil enemy who has the ultimate power, the power of the Artifact.
Multiplayer ($7500) - Engage in intense 1v1 multiplayer battles on a variety of maps, challenging you to test your skills and adapt your fighting strategies. Feeling less competitive? We’ll also add a co-op option to horde mode, allowing you to kick some butt with a friend.
Donating to Charity/Non-Profits ($10,000) - If we reach a certain limit, we will donate half of our game’s future profits to local charities and non-profit organizations within our community.
No Ads ($20,000) - Artifact will have no annoying ads. Period.



























A Special Thanks
We are very grateful for Indiegogo and its community for being able to give us a real opportunity to make our ideas a reality. Even if this project doesn't come to fruition we have learned the concepts of engineering, design, and marketing first-hand. We have sacrificed blood, sweat, many hours of sleep, and our hard earned money to develop this game, and we now understand the value this site has to offer. We would like to thank all our backers for sharing in our fervor and enthusiasm for this product, and believing in our ability to push through with this project. Success will surely be a life changing experience (and an educational one) that will truly kickoff our career in the engineering field, as we will be driven to deliver the best customer experience we can. Thank you!

story:
We enjoy games like Monkey Island or Broken Sword. Like creators of those games, we also have a story to tell. A story about a geeky science student struggling through real life who is faced with an adventure of a lifetime.

We are making the game really fun. There are not just funny comments and scenes as in most of the other point and click adventure games. Conversations resemble the ones from popular movies and series, sometimes in a different context bringing them to new dimensions. There are situations in the game that are like real-life situations and everyone can relate to. Check the movie clip below to get an idea!


If you are at least a bit geek you will find yourself in situations similar to what you have experienced, remember the awkwardness or silliness and laugh about it. In our experience the things that you can relate to or happened to you are the most funny. We want to make you laugh.

In the game, you play a geeky science student Peter Frog using traditional point and click mechanism. You can interact with almost any object in the scene as well as talk to anyone. What is more, Peter Frog can combine objects in the scene. For example, a cup and water pipe can be combined using drag and drop to make Peter Frog fill the glass with water. Note that the cup is not in the inventory. This opens even more possibilities for puzzles. We try to make all, even not so meaningful interactions and combinations, possible, at least resulting in a funny remark.

If goal is unlocked, we will be also adding another feature to the gameplay. It is called flash forward and revert. The mechanism is simple: if you try something awkward or something that would result in your end, the sequence would be played normally. At the end, however, there would be a fast playback to state before you did this awkward/wrong thing. This will bring even more fun to the game!

We have been working on Geek's Lair: The Crazy Scientist for 10 months already. Starting from nothing, a great progress has been made and the game is nearly complete. We have been working hard!

The game still needs polishing though. Some interactions are not in place yet and not all animations are working as they should. Most of the conversations are written but we need voice actors to read them out loud. We also want a really good theme music that we can't do ourselves. Last but not least, in order to port and test the game thoroughly on different platforms, we need to buy hardware and software. We don't want to publish half-polished product with bugs that doesn't work on some platforms as expected. With your support, we will make game that you want us to make!

2.400€ - buy professional licence of the game engine Unity Pro. It will enhance performance (dynamic batching), make animations better (inverse kinematics) and allow for some other visual features.
2.000€ - hardware for testing and porting.
2.000€ - hire studio and voice actors.
1.600€ - create theme music.
1.000€ - rewards and shipping.
1.000€ - Indiegogo and Paypal fees.

Spread the word about Geek's Lair: The Crazy Scientist. If you like the project and can spare some money, support us by contributing financially. All the money gained will be used to make the game better. Choose one of the rewards and become a part of Geek's Lair: The Crazy Scientist.

Supporter (5€+): I like your project. Be an active part of the game. You will be added to the list of contributors and listed in credits of the game. All following rewards include this perk!

Adventurer [Early bird] (10€, limited): Be the first to contribute and get a digital release of the game for Android or iOS before anybody else!

Adventurer (15€): Get a digital release of the game for Android or iOS before anybody else! 

PC Adventurer [Early bird] (20€): Be the first to contribute and get a digital release of the game for Windows or Mac. This is an exclusive PC distribution for Indiegogo backers, there is no plan to release the game on desktop platforms!

PC Adventurer (30€): Get a digital release of the game for Windows or Mac. This is an exclusive PC distribution for Indiegogo backers, there is no plan to release the game on desktop platforms!

I want it all (50€): Poster plus PC Adventurer and Adventurer rewards. Add 15eur shipping cost for non-EU countries.

I want it ALL (100€): T-shirt with logo, signed poster plus PC Adventurer and Adventurer rewards. Add 15eur shipping cost for non-EU countries.

Creative Supporter (500 €): Your personal favourite (funny) quote or scene will be added to the game. Plus previous rewards.

Is this me? (1000€, limited): Send us your picture and a character in the game will be created based on you! Includes all previous rewards.

We kept the team intentionally small so new ideas can be exchanged rapidly and we can work side by side. No bureaucracy, just brotherly love. We sometimes fight but five minutes later, we are working as if nothing has happened.

Maj Osolin (left) – 3D modeler, animator, electrical engineer.

Žiga Osolin (right) – Researcher, game programmer and designer, physicist.

We would also like to thank our friends for ideas and support. Most of all, we would like to thank all contributors – YOU - for making our dreams come true and spreading the word about Geek's Lair: The Crazy Scientist.

We have developed a large portion of the game and succesfully tackled with every obstacle we have encountered. Apart from music and voice recording (which we have tried already and works, we just need voice actors), the story of the game just needs completion and the game needs some further polishing. 

Even though this is our first professional project, we have worked on many projects like smaller games (puzzles, 3D space shooters), game engines (ZeusEngine, BaadEngine, SharpMedia) and complicated numerical school projects. We have nearly 10 years of experience in this field. All that said, we are confident that Geek's Lair: The Crazy Scientist will become a game for true adventurers. The only con is that we might not finish the project by the end of 2013 if some major issue arises, or more features than expected are implemented. This is especially true if the funding goal is not reached. But fear not, the game will be made!

What platforms will Geek's Lair: The Crazy Scientist run on?

It is currently working on Windows and Android. We plan to port it to iOS soon. Other platforms are easily possible with enough funds since we are using Unity engine that has support for almost all of game platforms out there.

When will the game be released?

We plan to release the first version by the end ob 2013.

Will the game be available in other languages?

In the core version, probably not. However, if stretch goals are reached or we find a volunteer to translate game to another language, we would happily include it. Voice acting in other languages is also dependent on stretch goals.

story:
Our Story

My name is Steve Pastro and I am currently a Masters student at the Centre for Digital Media in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia.  Over the past several years I have devoted endless hours to prototyping games for web and mobile platforms and am finally ready for the big show.  I am currently developing an addictive puzzle game for iOS called Light Byte that tests your reflexes and memory by combining the excitement of a shooter with the colour-matching element found in old memory games.
 
 
As a student (and one who has incurred an incredible amount of debt), I am unable to release this game without your help!  While I have been lucky enough to develop this game using an education license for the game engine Unity 3D provided by my school, I need to purchase my own licenses both from Unity and Apple if I want the game to ever see the light of day on the app store.  All money contributed to this campaign goes directly towards the payment of these overhead fees, while I work full time at school during the day and full time at home on this game at night in order to have the app ready for release by the second week of March.
 
I wish I had the luxury of doing this completely on my own, but I need your help!  I have and will continue to work day and night on the project to ensure it's completion, but without the requisite licenses it will all be for naught!

 

The Impact

I am confident this game has the potential to become a hit, and with your help will do all in my power to ensure that it does!  

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

What I need:

 

While this project can use all the help it can get, here's the breakdown of where the money goes as it comes in:

 

First $100 - Covers the cost of the Developer License from Apple which allows one to publish something to the App Store.

 

Next $400 - Covers the cost of the basic iOS License for Unity 3D, allowing the game to be released commercially, but with a Unity branded splash screen and lacking several optimization tools.

 

Next $200 - Covers the cost of various plug-ins and toolsets from Prime31 which will allow the integration of features such as Leaderboards and Facebook and Twitter integration, and the optimization of assets to keep the file size small.

 

Next $2600 - Here's the big one: Covers the cost of the iOS Pro Unity 3D License, allowing the game to launch with a custom splash screen (ensures a professional feel from the outset), play full screen video, and take advantage of several optimization tools to ensure the game runs smoothly on all devices.

 

Above and Beyond - Any money made of the game will be split between PR and marketing spending to gain exposure and ensure the app succeeds, and the purchase of an iPad 1 so that I can begin work on an HD iPad version of the game and have a proper unit to test on.

 

THE PERKS:


I wish I had more to give to you wonderful people, but here's the best I can do for now:

 

$5 Donation gets you: A Light Byte themed Desktop Wallpaper (1440 x 900 pixels)

 

$10 Donation gets you: A 3-track (MP3 format) .zip file containing the game's soundtrack plus the Light Byte themed wallpaper.

 

$20 Donation gets you: Early acces to a beta version of the game playing on Mac and PC in a password protected .zip file, and the above items.

 

$50 Donation gets you: Beta Access to the game via Test Flight, your name on a "Special Thanks" page in the game, and the above items.

 

$100 Donation gets you: A one hour Skype conversation with me (time and date TBD and schedule dependent) where we can talk about anything you'd like, including how the game was made in Unity.  You also receive all of the above perks.

 

Last but not least...

 

For the generous donation of $500: I will personally spend two complete work days (16 hours) prototyping a game of your choosing for iOS devices, and do my best to return to you a playable demo (of variable quality, depending on the game desired) in the form of a .zip file containing the entire Unity Project and source code upon completion.  Again, you receive all of the above perks in addition to your brand new game demo :) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word and post this link to your Facebook and Twitter feeds.  I love making games but with the money needed to be able to actually release them (not to mention the ominous cloud of student loans lurking ahead) I can't do this without you!  It'd mean the world to me if you could help out in any way possible, whether it be via a donation yourself or just passing it along to a friend it truly means the world to me! 


Thanks so much for reading my writeup and I hope you enjoy the game!

Thanks so much for reading my writeup and I hope you enjoy the game!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mike Stevens and I am a golf professional in Tampa, Florida. I have been involved with this wonderful game for 54 years as a player and teacher. About 15 years ago I became acquainted with what is referred to as hickory golf and was smitten with it. Basically it is how the game was first played in Scotland and then brought to America. Over the past few years, hickory golf has been making a comeback and taken root across the world. The number of tournaments and players has grown year after year. The growth has good reason. The hickory game is colorful, fast, easily understood and fun. I'm asking you to be a part of that growth.

I created the United States Professional Hickory Golf Championship to commemorate golf’s early years in America and the men and women who popularized the sport. The event honors our country’s first golf pro – John Shippen, an African American who played in the first U.S Open alongside of Oscar Bunn a Shinnecock Indian. Both men’s story I dare say are unknown to golfers of modern times. This tournament day will serve as a call to remember the game of days gone by. And what better way to do that than to have the men and women who teach and play the game for a living pass on golf’s history by actually competing like  our forbearers. In its brief operation the tournament has attracted professionals from across the globe but in limited numbers. I believe that by offering a larger prize fund more pros will be attracted to participate, even if only out of curiosity, but in the end will appreciate the skill of the men and women who made the game popular in its early days.

If your a golfer or just a fan of golf, please consider becoming a sponsor of the event. Your contribution is about heritage and tradition. Memories that can be passed on. In the previous tournaments there has been a lot of interest from local and national media. Radio, newspaper and television. The New York Times did a front page cover on their sports section in 2012. By increasing the prize fund substantially, more pros and likely well known pros will participate and make securing sponsors for the future easier. It just needs some help to get to the next level. That's where you as a contributor come in. This can become a permanent tribute to history and heritage going forward for generations to come.


How You Can Help

I hope to raise $25,000 to operate the tournament and to increase the prize fund which I feel will make the tournament more attractive to male and female golf professionals, and possibly more high profile players. The prize fund up to this point has been $5,000. I have had some members of the PGA Tour and European Tour participate but to attract more of them will require something with more incentive. After all professionals make their living competing for a portion of the purse. If I get a few more high profile players to participate then that most likely will attract more media coverage and my goal of keeping history alive has the best chance of success. The tournament will get bigger and then it will be easier to get sponsors and possibly television coverage for subsequent editions. The origins of the game will not be lost or forgotten.

Your dollars will do a lot of things which include providing authentic vintage golf clubs and balls for the players, cover course rental and provide a prize fund to attract and reward male and female professionals. I do not keep any money for myself. Any excess money left over after the the tournament has concluded is donated to a local charity. In the first four years of operation I have distributed $2,800 to support military families of wounded veterans.



Why Do This?

Studies suggest that the occasional detour down memory lane can give our spirits a significant lift. Memories, in turn, inspire positive feelings of joy, high self-regard, belonging, and meaningfulness in life. Today, the arts, artists, and culture do not seem as valued as in the past. Because of the incredible technological achievements of recent years, we forget to be thrilled and amazed. So this is a trip down memory lane and although specific to golf, it will instill in each of us involved a sense of belonging, a positive reminiscence and part of a cycle that also includes savoring the present and looking forward to the future.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help. People often don’t realize how much influence they have within their circle of life. Just getting the word out to friends, especially golfing friends is a great help. You tell a friend, he or she tells a friend, then on and on it goes as they say. Maybe it becomes a snowball rolling down the mountainside. I would appreciate just passing the word.

The event honors our country’s first golf pro – John Shippen, an African
American who played in the first U.S Open alongside of Oscar Bunn a Shinnecock
Indian. Both men’s story I dare say are unknown to golfers of modern times. This
tournament day will serve as a call to remember the game of days gone by. And
what better way to do that than to have the men and women who
teach and play the game for a living pass on golf’s history by actually competing
like  our forbearers. In its brief
operation the tournament has attracted professionals from across the globe but
in limited numbers. I believe that by offering a larger prize fund more pros will be attracted to participate, even if only out of curiosity, but in the end will appreciate the skill of the men and women who made the game popular in its early days.
If your a golfer or just a fan of golf, please consider becoming a sponsor of the event. Your contribution is about heritage and tradition. Memories that can be passed on. In the previous tournaments there has been a lot of interest from local and national media. Radio, newspaper and television. The New York Times did a front page cover on their sports section in 2012. By increasing the prize fund substantially, more pros and likely well known pros will participate and make securing sponsors for the future easier. It just needs some help to get to the next level. That's where you as a contributor come in. This can become a permanent tribute to history and heritage going forward for generations to come.     How You Can Help

I hope to raise $25,000 to operate the tournament and to increase the prize fund which I feel will make the tournament more attractive to male and female golf professionals, and possibly more high profile players. The prize fund up to this point has been $5,000. I have had some members of the PGA Tour and European Tour participate but to attract more of them will require something with more incentive. After all professionals make their living competing for a portion of the purse. If I get a few more high profile players to participate then that most likely will attract more media coverage and my goal of keeping history alive has the best chance of success. The tournament will get bigger and then it will be easier to get sponsors and possibly television coverage for subsequent editions. The origins of the game will not be lost or forgotten.
Your dollars will do a lot of things which include providing authentic vintage golf clubs and balls for the players, cover course rental and provide a prize fund to attract and reward male and female professionals. I do not keep any money for myself. Any excess money left over after the the tournament has concluded is donated to a local charity. In the first four years of operation I have distributed $2,800 to support military families of wounded veterans.


Why Do This?


Studies suggest that the
occasional detour down memory lane can give our spirits a significant lift. Memories, in turn, inspire positive feelings
of joy, high self-regard, belonging, and meaningfulness in life. Today,
the arts, artists, and culture do not seem as valued as in the past. Because of
the incredible technological achievements of recent years, we forget to be
thrilled and amazed. So this is a trip down memory lane and although specific
to golf, it will instill in each of us involved a sense of belonging, a positive reminiscence and part of a cycle that also includes
savoring the present and looking forward to the future.
  

Other Ways You Can Help 

There are many ways to help. People often
don’t realize how much influence they have within their circle of life. Just
getting the word out to friends, especially golfing friends is a great help.
You tell a friend, he or she tells a friend, then on and on it goes as they
say. Maybe it becomes a snowball rolling down the mountainside. I would
appreciate just passing the word.

story:
Get the schematics

Hello, my name is Patrick Grady and I'm a highschool senior in the US. I'm an avid programmer and tinkerer and love anything related to electronics and computers. 

This past winter I took a class in Digital Electronics and was introduced to the 555 timer. One of the most common applications of the 555 timer is the astable mode, which is unfortunately rather clunky to build on a breadboard. This 555 breakout board does more than expose the 555's eight pins: it sets you up to run your 555 timer in astable mode with slots to insert two resistors and a capacitor of your choice. This board eliminates all the wiring for the 555 timer. The 555 Timer Breakout Board Plus will cut out the tedium of setting up the 555 timer and will allow hobbyists to dig straight in to their projects.

As a electronics hobbyist myself, I recognize the usefulness of this simple device, but also acknowledge its relevance is limited to the niche market of hobbyist electronics. If you want this device or think a friend could use it, please contribute to the campaign and buy a 555 timer breakout board!

We have built a fully functional prototype board, which you can check out above in the campaign images. The board is 0.88 inches by 0.82 inches. 

NOTE: This board does not necessarily reflect the exact final design of the board.

Here you can see the Eagle board layout. We will be using the NE555P made by Texas Instruments. For C1, R1 and R2 we will be using three, 2 pin female headers so that the user can easily stick in whatever resistors or capacitors they want to use in the circuit. The power, ground, and output headers will be male so that this board can easily be used with a breadboard. TRG will be left open to allow the user to use the timer in monostable mode.

NOTE: This board does not necessarily reflect the exact final design of the board.

This board worked flawlessly, so I soldered the other 2 boards with their components. I also figured out how to avoid making a mess with the solder and discoloring the silkscreen.

The result looked like this, and this is what your boards will look like (minus the bits of PCB sticking out to the top and right).


Astable Mode: to use this board in astable mode, switch the switch to the "A" side and plug a capacitor into C1, and resistors into R1 and R2.

Period = ln(2)*C*(R1+2R2)

Monostable Mode: to use in monostable mode, simply switch the switch to the "M" side, insert a capacitor into C1, put a resistor into R1, a piece of wire into R2, and a trigger signal into TRG.

Output duration = R*C*ln(3)

The only thing we need to get started on these boards is demand. Funding contributed to the project will go into producing a batch of PCBs which will be populated and distributed to the contributors of this campaign. In addition each user will get a short guide for using the board. Even if we don't reach the goal, we will still run off all the boards that were ordered and ship them out(because of Flexible Funding).

    PCB & Components: The most significant cost of these boards are the PCB board and the components that are soldered onto it.

    Shipping: This section includes the postage required to ship your board to you in an ESD protected bag. 

    Labor: Depending on how many orders I get, I may have to recruit help for soldering the components.

    Once again, this project will make it easier for you (and other hobbyists like yourself) to get started with the 555 timer and make it easier and simpler to implement in your projects. This means it is easier for hobbyists to use the 555 timer and generally makes the 555 timing circuit more accessible and useful to the average hobbyist.


    I won't lie, the biggest risk you're taking is trusting a highschooler to deliver a solid product. I've never commercially assembled PCB boards and am only a hobbyist myself; not some engineer or technician who has decades of experience.

    But what I lack in experience I make up in conscientiousness and enthusiasm. I have been extraordinarily thorough in every aspect of this process and I am fully confident that I will be able to deliver a first rate product to every backer.

    More specific risks that I take are defects in the boards or ICs, late deliveries and price hikes from suppliers between now and when I place my orders for the PCBs and components.

    These risks and challenges are not very risky or challenging because this board is a rather simple, small and inexpensive device. Not to say I won't be challenged, but that I'll straighten things out quick so you won't even notice a roadblock came my way.

      If you can't contribute, but are excited by this project, please get the word out to your friends and other hobbyists who might be interested in this, and please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out as well.

      Thanks for your time, and I hope you can support the campaign for the 555 Timer Breakout Board Plus.

story:
NEW PERK LEVELS ADDED!

Please see below, you can now get a smaller perk of JUST a couple of the awesome Mechabrick mech kits or JUST the original boxed board-game!

What is Mechabrick?

Mechabrick is a board-game (launched earlier this year) that uses precision plastic robot models which you build and customise to fight epic battles in a futuristic city environment. The unique point of the game and the associated models is that every part of the mechs and every accessory component we make is compatible with leading plastic building brick brands and minifigs. The scenery around which the game is played is also built from your favorite plastic building bricks, bringing a unique element of creativity to the game.

At the core of the game, having taken over two years to develop and produce, are the 22-part precision molded plastic mech models. They are fully articulated and every component is compatible with your favorite plastic building brick components. You can even use a minifig torso and legs in the core of the mech model if you wish.



Playing the game:

The Mechabrick game is a simple strategy board game designed to be accessible for ages 10+ but with enough options to keep even hardened tabletop gamers interested. It is a turn based game that focuses on the choices you make about what weapons and upgrades you will give to your mechs and how those affect its abilities in the game. 
The game itself sees two or more players commanding an equal number of mechs to try and eliminate their opponent's forces. Every mech has two 'action points' to be used per turn for moving or shooting. Their speed of movement around the grid-based board is determined entirely by their speed attribute (which is reduced by adding lots of upgrades to a mech) and combat is undertaken through a dice-based system with modifiers added or subtracted due to the upgrades each mech has been given.

You can find out more about the game and models at: www.mechabrick.com


What is Mechabrick UPGRADED?

The focus of this campaign is to launch the first expansion for the Mechabrick game. Mechabrick UPGRADED includes a range of seven new precision-moulded plastic upgrade components to add to your Mechabrick mechs and give them new powers and abilities in the game. The expansion also includes a new rule-sheet detailing the specifications and rules for these new upgrades as well as a set of 20 playing cards for use with the brick-compatible 'upgrade crates' that are also in the pack. These crates are randomly placed around the board before the game and can be either opened to reveal an upgrade or shot when an enemy mech is near them to potentially make them explode and cause damage.

The new upgrade parts are precision molded in colours to match the existing mechs and upgrade parts in Mechabrick. As with all Mechabrick parts, every joint and attachment point is engineered to fit with standard building brick and minifig accessory parts. The details of the new components and their stats for the game are as follows (the stats are subject to minor change as play-testing continues):



Why back this campaign?

If you have not yet been introduced to Mechabrick, this campaign offers you an opportunity to get a copy of the original game (at well below retail price) along with a copy of the new expansion in a bundle pack that lets you jump straight in and get the most from this awesome game and model range.
If you already have Mechabrick, you can just get the expansion pack to add the new upgrades to your mechs and the exciting new rules to your games.
Whichever level you pledge at there are also some unique and exclusive bonus items we will be including at every perk level that you will not be able to get anywhere else. The bonus items are listed in the perk levels below and we will be adding extra bonuses to the perks as we unlock stretch goals through the campaign!


The Perk Levels:


1: MECHS - $22

This perk is for those who JUST want to get some of the awesome mech models and accessories but aren't interested in the game at this stage. This perk includes:

  • 1 X white 22-part mech kit
  • 1 Xblack 22 part mech kit
  • 1 X white 14-part accessory set
  • 1 X black 14-part accessory set

BONUSES:

  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
  • MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!



2: UPGRADE - $28

This is the 'UPGRADED' expansion pack for those who already have the core game of Mechabrick. This perk includes:

  • 16 X white plastic upgrade components
  • 16 X black plastic upgrade components
  • 2 X white plastic (printed) upgrade crates
  • 1 X Mechabrick UPGRADED expansion rule sheet
  • 1 X deck of 20 'CRATE' cards

BONUSES:

  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
  • MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!



3: UPGRADE XL - $99  ($85 with 'Early Bird' offer!)

For those already heavily into Mechabrick with a LOT of mechs to upgrade, this is the level for you... Including nearly five times as much as the standard 'UPGRADE' perk level this represents incredible value for money containing over $350 retail value of components for under $100!! It will also include even more extra bonus items too, including the exclusive printed white mech kit. This perk includes:

  • 64 X white plastic upgrade components
  • 64 X black plastic upgrade components
  • 32 X red plastic upgrade components
  • 32 X orange plastic upgrade components
  • 4 X white plastic (printed) upgrade crates
  • 1 X Mechabrick UPGRADED expansion rule sheet
  • 2 X decks of 20 'CRATE' cards

BONUSES:

  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive mech kit
  • MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!


4: GAME

If you JUST want a copy of the original boxed Mechabrick board game then this is the perk for you. This perk includes:

Mechabrick boxed board-game containing:

  • 2 X white 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 2 X black 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 14 X white plastic accessories
  • 14 X black plastic accessories
  • 1 X instruction/rule booklet
  • 2 X D6 dice
  • 25 X printed spec cards
  • 4 X 255mm X 255mm laminated heavy card game boards

BONUSES:

  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
  • MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!



5: GAME + UPGRADE - $80  ($69 with 'Early Bird' offer!)

If you don't yet have a copy of the Mechabrick game and want to get involved then this is the ideal starting point. As well as the expansion pack you will also get a copy of the full Mechabrick board game as well. This level includes:

Mechabrick boxed board-game containing:

  • 2 X white 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 2 X black 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 14 X white plastic accessories
  • 14 X black plastic accessories
  • 1 X instruction/rule booklet
  • 2 X D6 dice
  • 25 X printed spec cards
  • 4 X 255mm X 255mm laminated heavy card game boards
+
  • 16 X white plastic upgrade components
  • 16 X black plastic upgrade components
  • 2 X white plastic (printed) upgrade crates
  • 1 X Mechabrick UPGRADED expansion rule sheet
  • 1 X deck of 20 'CRATE' cards

BONUSES:

  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
  • MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!


6: GAME + UPGRADE XL - $165

If you love the sound of Mechabrick and want to go into the game BIG TIME from the start then this is the ultimate perk level. At this level you get a full copy of the game, plus a bonus set of 4 extra game boards to make your game bigger, four extra mech kits, two extra sets of standard accessories AND all the expansion pack items from the 'UPGRADE XL' perk too, including every unlocked stretch-goal bonus! With over $460 retail value of products in this bundle it represents the best value for money of all the perk levels! This perk includes:

Mechabrick boxed board-game containing:

  • 2 X white 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 2 X black 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 14 X white plastic accessories
  • 14 X black plastic accessories
  • 1 X instruction/rule booklet
  • 2 X D6 dice
  • 25 X printed spec cards
  • 4 X 255mm X 255mm laminated heavy card game boards
+
  • 2 X extra white 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 2 X extra black 22-part plastic mech kits
  • 1 X extra white 14-part accessory pack
  • 1 X extra black 14-part accessory pack
  • 4 X extra game-boards
+
  • 64 X white plastic upgrade components
  • 64 X black plastic upgrade components
  • 32 X red plastic upgrade components
  • 32 X orange plastic upgrade components
  • 4 X white plastic (printed) upgrade crates
  • 1 X Mechabrick UPGRADED expansion rule sheet
  • 2 X decks of 20 'CRATE' cards

BONUSES:

  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
  • 1 X white (printed) exclusive mech kit
  • MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!



Shipping and fulfillment:

Postage has been estimated based on past campaigns and will be added to your pledge amount based on your location. The table below shows a quick guide to postage costs for each perk level depending on location.




Stretch Goals:

If the campaign is successful we will be giving an increasing range of free bonus items away with the different perk levels. These bonuses will include exclusive coloured versions of certain upgrade parts as well as custom-printed versions that will be available ONLY to backers of this campaign.
Stretch goals maked as 'All backers' on a grey background will be items that will be given away as a bonus for free to all backers of the campaign. Stretch goals marked as 'XL Backers' on a red background will be items that only the backers at the 'UPGRADE XL' and 'Game + UPGRADE XL' levels will receive. More goals will be revealed as we progress!





Who we are:

My name is Ben Jarvis, For the last 12 years I have run a small games company based in the east of England called 'Megaton Games Ltd' (formerly called Dubreq Ltd) and I have had a life-long passion for robots, gaming and LEGO.

Mechabrick started as an idea I had  over 10 years ago for a range of precision plastic parts to convert minifigs into Japanese style mecha. After a lot of development and design work the idea expanded into a full range of robot kits and add-on upgrades and weapons for them along with a full board-game that uses your favorite plastic building bricks to build the scenery around which the game-play takes place.

I work from our home-office in Norfolk on the east coast of England, helped by a team of awesome freelancers, my wife and my 5 year old daughter (who get roped in to help pack and ship our products!)


Risks and challenges:

This will be the third crowd-funding campaign we have run and the 6th we have provided products for so we have a good level of experience in running and delivering campaigns and know what can go wrong.
To avoid the production delays experienced following our initial Mechabrick campaign (caused by unforeseen financial issues and an unexpected increase in the cost of tooling for the plastic robot kits)  we have invested in all tooling to manufacture these parts already. They are tested, prototyped and ready for production and shipping immediately following the campaign to make this as risk-free and rapid as possible. There are no up-front costs still to raise funds for and we are seeking funding JUST for initial production of the parts and to cover shipping costs and production of the printed materials that go with the new game expansion.

We have listed March 2016 as the expected ship date for the rewards however we hope to begin shipping MUCH faster than that, hopefully by the end of January 2016. The only element of the perks involving a 3rd party  is the printing of the custom printed parts and mechs. These are being undertaken by a trusted UK retailer who we have worked with for two years and we are confident about their estimates for printing schedules.

The final risk is the campaign being VERY successful in which case we may need to push back the shipping date for some rewards to allow extra time for more stock to be manufactured and shipped. In this case we would ship rewards as early as we can in chronological order of when the backers joined the campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute financially to this campaign or not, if you think this sounds like a cool product, please share this campaign with your freinds and/or on social media or in forums where you think it might be relevant!

Thanks for your help spreading the word!

6: GAME + UPGRADE XL - $165
If you love the sound of Mechabrick and want to go into the game BIG TIME from the start then this is the ultimate perk level. At this level you get a full copy of the game, plus a bonus set of 4 extra game boards to make your game bigger, four extra mech kits, two extra sets of standard accessories AND all the expansion pack items from the 'UPGRADE XL' perk too, including every unlocked stretch-goal bonus! With over $460 retail value of products in this bundle it represents the best value for money of all the perk levels! This perk includes:


Mechabrick boxed board-game containing:


2 X white 22-part plastic mech kits

2 X black 22-part plastic mech kits
14 X white plastic accessories
14 X black plastic accessories
1 X instruction/rule booklet
2 X D6 dice
25 X printed spec cards
4 X 255mm X 255mm laminated heavy card game boards

+


2 X extra white 22-part plastic mech kits


2 X extra black 22-part plastic mech kits

1 X extra white 14-part accessory pack
1 X extra black 14-part accessory pack
4 X extra game-boards

+


64 X white plastic upgrade components
64 X black plastic upgrade components
32 X red plastic upgrade components
32 X orange plastic upgrade components
4 X white plastic (printed) upgrade crates
1 X Mechabrick UPGRADED expansion rule sheet
2 X decks of 20 'CRATE' cards
BONUSES:

1 X white (printed) exclusive shield accessory
1 X white (printed) exclusive mech kit
MORE TO FOLLOW IN STRETCH GOALS!



Shipping and fulfillment:
Postage has been estimated based on past campaigns and will be added to your pledge amount based on your location. The table below shows a quick guide to postage costs for each perk level depending on location.






Stretch Goals:

If the campaign is successful we will be giving an increasing range of free bonus items away with the different perk levels. These bonuses will include exclusive coloured versions of certain upgrade parts as well as custom-printed versions that will be available ONLY to backers of this campaign.Stretch goals maked as 'All backers' on a grey background will be items that will be given away as a bonus for free to all backers of the campaign. Stretch goals marked as 'XL Backers' on a red background will be items that only the backers at the 'UPGRADE XL' and 'Game + UPGRADE XL' levels will receive. More goals will be revealed as we progress!







Who we are: My name is Ben Jarvis, For the last 12 years I have run a small games company based in the east of England called 'Megaton Games Ltd' (formerly called Dubreq Ltd) and I have had a life-long passion for robots, gaming and LEGO.


Mechabrick started as an idea I had  over 10 years ago for a range of precision plastic parts to convert minifigs into Japanese style mecha. After a lot of development and design work the idea expanded into a full range of robot kits and add-on upgrades and weapons for them along with a full board-game that uses your favorite plastic building bricks to build the scenery around which the game-play takes place.
I work from our home-office in Norfolk on the east coast of England, helped by a team of awesome freelancers, my wife and my 5 year old daughter (who get roped in to help pack and ship our products!)
   Risks and challenges: This will be the third crowd-funding campaign we have run and the 6th we have provided products for so we have a good level of experience in running and delivering campaigns and know what can go wrong. To avoid the production delays experienced following our initial Mechabrick campaign (caused by unforeseen financial issues and an unexpected increase in the cost of tooling for the plastic robot kits)  we have invested in all tooling to manufacture these parts already. They are tested, prototyped and ready for production and shipping immediately following the campaign to make this as risk-free and rapid as possible. There are no up-front costs still to raise funds for and we are seeking funding JUST for initial production of the parts and to cover shipping costs and production of the printed materials that go with the new game expansion.
We have listed March 2016 as the expected ship date for the rewards however we hope to begin shipping MUCH faster than that, hopefully by the end of January 2016. The only element of the perks involving a 3rd party  is the printing of the custom printed parts and mechs. These are being undertaken by a trusted UK retailer who we have worked with for two years and we are confident about their estimates for printing schedules.
The final risk is the campaign being VERY successful in which case we may need to push back the shipping date for some rewards to allow extra time for more stock to be manufactured and shipped. In this case we would ship rewards as early as we can in chronological order of when the backers joined the campaign.


    Other Ways You Can Help Whether you are able to contribute financially to this campaign or not, if you think this sounds like a cool product, please share this campaign with your freinds and/or on social media or in forums where you think it might be relevant!
Thanks for your help spreading the word!

story:
Hi, I'm Rob Ferguson and this is my project!

You can see a short gameplay video here: http://youtu.be/NdCP_JzVWgA

You can see some of my work at my personal website. There's a page for an Android videogame I recently developed.

You can see some of my art at my deviantART profile.

Stay tuned for a project video and proper trailer!

The Project

The Legend of Zomba is an action-adventure game inspired by the gems of retro gaming. In the game, you will travel to ancient ruins, laboratories, fight mad scientists and solve multitudes of puzzles in your quest to find the three ancient artifacts prophesized to return the dead to the dust of the earth! The game is being developed with Adobe Flash CS5.5, but if stretch goals are reached a console port will be made possible.

The game is being developed as a PC, Mac and Linux game, but with enough funding a mobile port and console release will be possible!

  

In The Legend of Zomba you take the role of Dr. Mann as he travels the world to locate three pieces of an ancient key said to unlock the gates of Hell and send the undead back to the dust of the Earth. You will explore three unique "dungeons", each with its own puzzles, key item and boss battle. in addition to the dungeons, there will be a large overworld with several cities to explore and numerous side-quests to complete!

The game itself features many adventure elements, such as an expansive overworld, tons of cool locales to find, loads of quests and items and a deep backstory regarding the undead. It also features many action elements, as fighting all sorts of zombies is central to the game.

A key feature to the action is that weapons degrade over a long amount of time. Without proper maintenence they will break and become unusable, but maintained they become stronger! Your wooden club, for example, will turn into a studded club and then a spiked club!

The more funding raised, however, the more the game can be expanded!

This means more content, another dungeon, cool new types of loot and weapons and more side-quests and side-stories!

 

  

About Me

I am a programmer and an artist. The aesthetics of retro games have always fascinated me, while the depth, complexity and innovation in many modern games has often brought me inspiration. I have previously worked on Facebook games and have done some freelance programming and writing.

I have an 11 year-old brother with special needs, He suffers from developmental delays, epilepsy and several other disorders. He requires a large degree of care, attention and financial support. He is an inspiration to me and a huge part of my world, but due to the strain on myself and my family it is often difficult to follow my passions. Due to this, I have made the decision to seek funding through IndieGogo to develop and release this video game.

Creating independent video games is my passion, and by donating to my project you can help me follow it!

What I Need & What You Get


The $4000 USD goal will cover the base cost of bringing this game from development to release. However, my aspirations for this project are actually much higher and thus I have implemented Stretch Funding Goals. This means that, the more funding you can contribute, the more work can be put into the game!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't donate, but there are plenty of ways you can help! You can help get the word out by using IndieGoGo's Share tools (located near the top of the page) or by telling your friends about this project!

It would really help me and my family a great deal! Thanks!

 

My Funding Goals

Level 1: $4,000 USD

The $4000 USD will roughly cover the following:

  1. Further design of the game's concept (plot, characters, etc)
  2. Game writing
  3. Creation of all necessary visual assets (graphics, sprites, animations, etc)
  4. Overworld and Dungeon design
  5. Remaining engine programming
  6. Music and Sound Effects
  7. Debugging and polish
  8. PC, Mac and Linux Game Release
  9. Donor rewards and perks!
  10. Small marketing campaign

Level 2: $5,500 USD

  1. Expansion of the final boss dungeon
  2. A new quest-tree in the overworld
  3. A new set of weapons!
  4. A new dungeon!

Level 3: $7,000 USD

  1. Mini-Bosses!
  2. Android and iOS release
  3. A game guidebook for UltraBox and MegaBox donors
  4. Extra Thank-You pack-ins for all Box donors!
  5. Larger scope marketing campaign

Level 4: $9,000 USD

  1. Graphics Upgrade
  2. Epilogue Chapter
  3. Soundtrack will be expanded
  4. A new set of zombies!
  5. Handwritten Thank-You notes for all Box donors!
  6. Special in-game items and bonuses for all BigBox, UltraBox and MegaBox donors!
  7. Multiplayer Horde Mode!

Level 5: $12,000 USD

  1. XBox 360 Community Games Release
  2. Level Editor for players in the PC release!
  3. Customizable player appearance!
  4. Marketing blowout!
  5. The 5 biggest donors will be named in marketing material!

 

 

Project Progress

What's finished:

  • Movement (Duh!)
  • Health and Armor
  • Map/Terrain handling
  • Cinematic event handling
  • Object handling (set pieces, cinematic pieces, destructables)
  • Enemy handling
  • NPC handling (dialogue, quest events)
  • Inventory management
  • Loot crates and items
  • Puzzle pieces: Pushblocks, switch buttons, switch pads, keys, key doors, multi-strength breakable doors, sliding doors, gates
  • Items: Med Kit, Armor (Light, Medium and Heavy), Pistol Ammo, Wooden Club, Samurai Sword, Fire Axe, Baseball Bat, Tire Iron, Pistol
  • Enemies: Drone, Sprinter, Exploder

What's left:

  • 80% of the Overworld
  • New Overworld graphics
  • New "Dungeon" graphics
  • Object graphics
  • Three more ancient ruins and boss chambers
  • Boss Zombies
  • Side-quests
  • More weapons and items, such as: Chainsaw, Garden Shears, Crowbar, Ninja Stars, Studded Club, Spiked Club, Morning Star, Tempered Sword, Shotgun, Assault Rifle, Sub-Machine Gun, Plasma Canon, Flamethrower, Nail Gun, Grenades, Boomerang Canon and more!
  • More types of enemies!
  • More cool tools and items!
  • Sound effects and music

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hayden Morris and i am an indie games developer. My main project is called Broken Council and it is a 3d fantasy game based around wizards and magic. Players take on the role of a young wizard Called Regan Valdor and guide him on a journey all the way from training to becoming a master wizard.

Broken Council is all about a deep magic system. The basis of the design is that you have a series of small rocks called runes. Each rune contains power and a magical effect. Mages operate by calling forth the power within these runes. On top of that they can combine the runes to create differnt forms of magic. There is also a skill system for a set of very specific and very unique set of abilities that mages can use.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently the game code sits at around 85% complete but to progress futher we need to purchase media to replace our temporary content. In order to do this we require money. Your funds will be spent on:

- Character models

- Sound Effects

- Textures

- Map models

In return i am offering copies of the game, extra content, merchandise and personalised interactions with people who help out the project. 

The Impact

Releasing a commerical game has been a dream for me and given this opportunity i believe i can create many more exciting and stimulating adventures for everybody to play and enjoy. Not only is this an investment in a single game but its an investment which might start a career of great games development.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would be greatful for any help to advertise and comment on the game as it develops and when it is released.

story:
Warbirds is Outrider Studio's latest RPG. It is a diesel-punk air combat adventure game that focuses on fighter pilots as they chase after fame and fortune. It combines the action and excitement of early adventure serials with chaos and heroism of World War 2 dogfights.

The game is set amongst the sky islands of Azure. It is an alternate reality version of the Caribbean islands (and the Florida and Yucatan peninsulas), floating in the sky above an endless murk. The islands are populated by fascinating characters and rich cultures which are both familiar and slightly alien. 

 
 

The game uses Outrider Studio’s Rapidfire system for fast, cinematic action. We’ve modified it to fit the new pulp comic setting. 

Warbirds' new dogfighting rules allow for fast and exciting dogfights that do not require any complicated maps, elaborate charts, or specialized knowledge of air combat. While the combat system is streamlined, it retains tactical depth and can handle both small one-on-one arial duals and the chaos of larger air battles.

In addtion to the dogfighting rules, the system also has specialized strafing rules for when fighters attack larger targets like airships, trains, or air bases. As with dogfighting, strafing is fast and easy (though it can be dangerous for the pilots involved).

 

In Azure, fighter pilots are celebrities. Your character’s achievements dictate their fame, and you’ll get to decide how to interact with fans, gain publicity, and deal with scandals. Will you star in movies? Start your own clothing line? Hide yourself away in a mountain top mansion? Or trash your hotel room? 

The fame mechanic tracks a character's progression from up-and-comer to superstar. Characters can increase their fame by completing missions, but they can also compete in air shows and air races, and even obtain sponsors and turn their plane into a flying billboard. 

Being famous means risking scandals. The paparazzi are everywhere in Azure, and they will there taking photos when characters slip up. Dealing with the blowback from scandalous behaviour can be even more harrowing than facing enemies in the air.  

 

Warbirds is already written and in the process of playtesting and editing. We need your help to cover our art, editing, layout, and distribution costs. We are planning for an August 2013 release, and the book will be ready for Gencon.

While we plan to release the book regardless of the success of our campaign,  your contributions will go a long way to improving its production values. In addition, we want to reward our supporters with special extras like custom dice, a GM screen, and our dogfight tracker. 

Please donate what you can, and spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, and at your local gaming table.

You can visit our website:

warbirdsrpg.com

Or check out the designer's blog where Steve talks more about the game and its design. 

thearmouredwriter.blogspot.ca

 

 

We have hit our main goal so its time to roll out stretch goals. 

$1500 - Art Boost - Achieved!

We will lead off the book with a short comic and have comics placed throughout the book that will tell a story about the game world.

$2000 - Planes of the Second World War - Achieved!

We will release a PDF supplement full of stats for WW2 fighters, bombers, and naval ships. It will include rules modifcations for the grittier nature of a war story, and notes about how aircraft evolvedi during the war. The PDF will be sent to all backers who donated $10 or more.

$3000 - Colour Boost - Achieved!

The print and PDF versions of the book will be made in full colour! (At no additional cost to backers) Let's keep this going and make it happen.  

$5000 - You Must Be Mad - Achieved!

No diesel-punk game is complete without a little mad science.  While the main book contains basic rules for using mad science, this supplement will contain dozens of mad creations, monsters, weapons, NPCs, and plot hooks. Expect it to be complete in October 2013. The PDF will be sent to all backers who donated $10 or more.

Further Donations

Any further donations made in the last 24 hours of the campaign will go towards additional art, and to help pay for future Warbirds expansions. We never thought we would get here, and you are all amazing!

From all the Outriders, thank you!

story:
Latest:

  • Spirit Island is now available in Early Access! (See April 16th and April 9th updates)
  • Beta Testing has begun! (See February 17th Update)

  • Pre-orders now live! Visit BackerKit to pre-order now.
  • Surveys Now Live! Visit BackerKit to complete your survey.

  • New Stretch Goal list
  • Campaign extended to November 15th
  • More Beta Edition perks added
  • Developer Stream #3 - Music Soundscaping with Jean-Marc and Designer Eric Reuss
  • Developer Stream #2 - Q+A with Designer Eric Reuss and UI with John
  • Developer Stream #1 - Spirit Island Engine with David and Jean-Marc

 

Campaign:

In the most distant reaches of the world, magic still exists, embodied by spirits of the land, of the sky, and of every natural thing. As the great powers of Europe stretch their colonial empires further and further, they will inevitably lay claim to a place where spirits still hold power - and when they do, the land itself will fight back alongside the islanders who live there.

Spirit Island is a cooperative settler-destruction strategy game designed by R. Eric Reuss and set in an alternate-history world around A.D. 1700. Players become different spirits of the land, each with their own unique elemental powers, forced to defend their island home from colonizing Invaders spreading blight and destruction. Your spirits work with the native islanders to increase your power and drive the invading colonists from your island in this strategic area-control game.

Handelabra Games and Greater Than Games are once again uniting to bring an amazing cooperative game to the digital tabletop!

In Spirit Island, players choose between 1-4 spirits to control. The number of spirits determines the size of the island. A single spirit game uses a single island board like this:

*Pre-alpha screenshots. Subject to change before release.*

Spirits start with limited options but grow in power over the course of the game. The Invaders will spread across the land, destroying Spirit Presence and Dahan, and Blighting the land. You will not be able to contain them forever.

*Pre-alpha screenshots. Subject to change before release.*

At the start of the game, Victory can only be obtained by obliterating all of the Invaders, which is extremely difficult! However, as you grow in power and escalate the fear in the hearts of the Invaders, progressively easier victory conditions will become available. The game ends immediately in Defeat if no more Blight is left in the Blight pool, if any player is knocked out of the game (by losing all Presence from the map), or if you take too long to rout the Invaders.

*Pre-alpha screenshots. Subject to change before release.*

Here's a short overview of how the game plays on the tabletop:

.

.

As you have come to expect from Handelabra Games, the digital version of Spirit Island is planned to be a faithful adaptation of the core game experience. Spirit Island for Steam is planned to cost $25 and include the following:

  • 8 different Spirits, each with 4 Power Cards unique to that Spirit
  • Over 50 distinct Major and Minor Power Cards which Spirits can grow into
  • Modular Island map with 4 double-sided boards
  • Digital components representing the Invaders and Dahan (native islanders)
  • 15 Invader cards, driving a distinctive Invader expansion system
  • 15 Fear cards, showing what happens as you terrify the Invaders
  • 3 multi-tier Adversaries (specific Invaders) for play variety and fine-tuned challenge: England, Brandenburg-Prussia, and Sweden
  • 4 optional Scenarios for even more play variety
  • Local co-op play with 1-4 spirits
  • Interactive tutorial so you can learn the game while you play
  • Brand-new music composed by Jean-Marc Giffin
  • Windows, Mac, and Linux support
  • Steam Achievements
  • Steam Cloud Saves
  • All bonus features unlocked via the campaign

All the above are included with every perk that includes a Steam key for the game.

The exclusive digital playmat is a cosmetic game background item that reflects your status as a backing supporter at the deluxe edition level and above.

What does it mean to become a member of the beta team?

Becoming a beta team member means you will get access to the private beta of the game via Steam ahead of any retail or Early Access launch. You will play the game to help us discover bugs, report them, and help us make sure the game is as good as it can possibly be. 

Choose your perk from the list on the right.

We’ve secured 2/3 of the development budget for the base game already, but we need your help to get version 1.0 completed and shipped in the first half of 2020. 

But fully funding isn’t the end of the story. The other reason we are using crowdfunding for this project is the list of stretch goals you see below. With your help we can make the game even better!

About Backing on Indiegogo:

Indiegogo works differently than Kickstarter in that your card will be charged immediately when you back the campaign. However, you can always cancel your pledge before the campaign is complete for a full refund, or if you wish to change your perk selection. You can also pledge multiple times to claim multiple perks, in contrast to Kickstarter where you can only back a given campaign once.

This campaign is being run as "All or Nothing" – just like how Kickstarter campaigns work. If we do not reach our funding goal by the end of the campaign, all pledges will be refunded.

Why Indiegogo?

We are running this campaign on Indiegogo, in contrast to our previous campaigns on Kickstarter, and some folks might wonder why. Put most simply, Kickstarter's work force is currently attempting to form a union, and Kickstarter management is opposing the process. We support Kickstarter's employees' efforts to decide for themselves whether to unionize, and the choice to use Indiegogo for this campaign is not a boycott of Kickstarter.

Given the timing of our campaign and the possibility that the union may call for a boycott (they have not yet done so), we made the decision to use Indiegogo now so that we could keep this campaign as simple and stable as possible. We know that some people have strong feelings about which companies they support, and our hope is that using Indiegogo for this campaign will give the largest number of people the opportunity to support Spirit Island Digital in a way they feel comfortable with.

Updated November 8th:

 

40k - Fully Funded!

42k - PROMO SPIRIT: Heart of the Wildfire

  • Includes the spirit and associated unique power cards.
  • Included in the Deluxe Edition and greater.

44k - PROMO SPIRIT: Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island

  • Includes the spirit and associated unique power cards.
  • Included in the Deluxe Edition and greater.

46k - BONUS FEATURE: Nexus of Sound

  • Rather than static background tracks, Jean-Marc Giffin will create a dynamic musical landscape for the game!
  • Added to all copies of the game if we reach this stretch goal.

48k - BONUS FEATURE: Adversarial Appearance

  • Adversary specific appearance for invader pieces will further customize the game.
  • Added to all copies of the game if we reach this stretch goal.

50k - BONUS FEATURE: Cartography

  • Alternate terrain styles add even more variety to the game.
  • Added to all copies of the game if we reach this stretch goal.

52k - BONUS FEATURE: Spirit Styles

  • Alternate Spirit artwork added for all core game spirits.
  • Added to all copies of the game if we reach this stretch goal.

 

After selecting your perk, you can add on Steam keys for our other games to get them at a discount. As the campaign progresses, more Add Ons may become available. 

  • Sentinels of the Multiverse - $2
    • Sentinels Season 1 - $15
    • Sentinels Season 2 - $20
  • One Deck Dungeon - $7
    • Forest of Shadows - $7
  • Aeon's End- $15
  • Bottom of the 9th - $2
  • Spirit Island Original Soundtrack - $8

 

NOTE ON ADD ON DELIVERY:

If you add on a Steam Key for one of our other games or expansions, those will be delivered as soon as BackerKit surveys are complete and locked (see below). 

All perks for this campaign will be delivered via the pledge manager BackerKit. We have used it in the past, and it works well for allowing people to administer their pledges and add ons after the campaign. The process will be as follows:

  • Campaign closes on November 15th
  • Surveys sent out 14 days later, on or around November 29nd
  • Surveys locked and cards charged on or around December 9nd
  • Delivery of add ons begins
  • Delivery of Spirit Island planned for Q1/Q2 of 2020
  • Delivery of stretch goals to continue through 2020

 

All copies of Spirit Island will be delivered via Steam Key and our current delivery estimate for the core game experience is in the first half of 2020.

 

 

The goal of this campaign is to bring Spirit Island to Steam. The mobile stores continue to make it difficult for developers to deliver crowdfunding rewards/perks, while also staying within the terms and conditions of selling on those stores. As such, there will not be a perk that will offer a mobile copy of Spirit Island. 

However, we always strive to keep all players involved and excited in our projects, no matter what platform they prefer. We hope to have more information about a mobile version of Spirit Island, and how mobile players can be involved in this campaign as it progresses.

Handelabra Games works with tabletop game publishers and designers to bring their interesting, fun, and innovative games to the digital tabletop across multiple platforms. We have worked with Greater Than Games, Asmadi Games, and Indie Boards and Cards to adapt other cooperative games such as Aeon’s End, One Deck Dungeon, and Sentinels of the Multiverse. Our digital tabletop games have sold more than 300,000 copies since launching Sentinels of the Multiverse 5 years ago.

Jeremy - Co-founder and President of Handelabra Games. Jeremy keeps things running smoothly, and does much of the marketing and outreach.

John - Co-founder and Lead Developer, John does it all! UI/UX, development, Unity, project management - you name it, John probably does it for some portion of his day.

Jean-Marc - Resident composer and one of our game rules engine programmers. He makes sure our games sound good and the gameplay matches the rulebook.

Jenn - UI/UX, 2D artwork, 3D modeling and design, and Unity work are just a few of the things Jenn does for the team.

David - Engine programmer extraordinaire, David makes our games work. And then he tests and tests and makes them work even better!

Crista - Community management, live streaming, and social media are Crista’s main focus, but she also does video editing and graphic design work, among other things.

Cam - Cam is all about our systems. He’s constantly working to make our processes more efficient while also helping Crista on technical support. 

 

Greater Than Games, LLC is a leading tabletop game developer and publisher based out of St. Louis, Missouri. Established in 2011, Greater Than Games is well-known for delivering engaging, richly-themed, highly-replayable card and board games.

With those ideals in mind Greater Than Games merged with Dice Hate Me Games in 2015 and acquired the publishing rights to Cheapass Games in May of 2019. In doing so they add amazing games to their growing catalog. This includes classic titles like Sentinels of the Multiverse, Bottom of the 9th, Tak, and Kill Doctor Lucky.

Spirit Island is now available in Early Access! (See April 16th and April 9th updates)

Beta Testing has begun! (See February 17th Update)
