story:
KURDISTAN'S ANSWER TO THE SYRIAN WAR

This is a joint project of photographer Jeffry Ruigendijk and Belgian journalist/arabist Annabell Van den Berghe. 

Soon we will be heading to Kurdistan to write down the stories of the Kurds. The Syrian civil war has caused a lot of damage, and a lot of changes also within the Kurdish region. The relation between several minorities in the region became even more tense than before. Fear is finding its way to the farest outskirts of the area, and political instability is a fact. 
 
Together we will put down in words and in images what life means nowadays in Kurdistan. We work together on a profound story and on a tvdocumentary. The last preparations are being made. We are buying our bullet proof jacket, getting insured and last but not least buying a lots of antibiotics and blankets for the inhabitants who cannot reach medical support if needed and we insure ourselves.
 
This is a call to all of you to share this project and to follow us through twitter  @Annabellvdb and @JeffRuig. And for those who want to contribute, we made this possible through this website. For every fund there will be a reward. A big thank you, mentioning your name at the credits of the documentary, and even a personal photoshoot. 
 
 
Please spread the word, and thanks a lot for your support!

 

When did we start this project?

Right before Christmas Jeffry got smuggled into Syria to make a photo documentary. What he saw blew him away. His explaination:

"The area I got smuggled into is known to the Kurds as Western-Kurdistan. And what I saw here was a brand new democracy. Idealistic, young, fragile. Every governmental council or organisation was divided by a minimum of 40% elected women, 40% elected men. In the middle of the Middle East! The garbage was being collected, judges made their rulings, police patrolled the streets. Normal for us, but bizarre over there!

I tried to capture all this in images. But then I had to go. I want to go back, and capture the happenings. Both the successes and failures. And I want to contribute where possible by bringing them medicins and blankets." 

By funding this project, you make it possible for us to bring this story to the world. We will spread the news and give it the international attention it needs and deserves. And meanwhile, we can already do something about the bad health situation of a lot of the Kurdish people.  

 

Check the 'gallery tab' to see more photo's, or go to www.ruigphotography.com!  

 

What you gonna do with that cash?

Of course, it's not all peace in Kurdistan. They regularly get attacked by islamist rebels and by the government soldiers and planes. That is why this democracy is so fragile. The Kurds also blame Turkey in aiding the islamists to break their newly founded democracy. And they got oil. Bad position to be in. So they fight both Assad's army, and the islamists. Part of your money will go to insurance for both of us, the other part will go to antibiotics and blankets for those in need.

 

Basically we need:

  •  as much as possible for aid to the local people
  •  1000 euro in airline tickets
  •  700 euro to get smuggled over the border twice
  •  600 euro for 2 go-pro camera's that I can strap to myself or to the     Kurdish rebels
  •  800 euro a month for the fixer
  •  170 a month in insurances
  •  400 a month for my rent
  •  300 a month for gasoline (prices tripled overthere!)
  •  100 a month for food

 

As a contriber you get: 

  • -Over 10 euro: A big fat 'Thank You' on twitter and on this page. 
  • -Over 25 euro: That fat 'Thank you' and an awesome mobile phone sticker. The sticker sports a 'Kurdish sun' on it. It will make you shine! 
  • -Over 100 euro: A 'Thank You' for you or your company on my website during, and months after, the trip. A limited (1/50) photo of your choice (after return), A4 size. 
  • Over 500 euro: That 'Thank You' from above, plus that photo from above, plus a portrait of yourself, or someone you want photographed, shot in Amsterdam. This will be after the trip, upon my return. 

 

!!!Keep checking this campaign for new photo's!!! 

 

You can also help a lot by spreading the word via Facebook, Twitter, mail! Please do help, by sharing this project via the link above! 

 

Who are these Kurds? 

The Kurdish territory is spread over Syria, Turkey, Iran and Iraq. The world counts approx. 45 million Kurds. In Syria many Kurds are stateless. That means they are foreigners on their own land. They are not allowed to speak Kurdish, they have no passports, their identity card identifies them as a foreigner. This means they cannot own a business, or a house. Being active in Kurdish social organisations could get them imprisoned before the revolution. When the revolution started many of Assad's soldiers left to fight elsewhere. The YPG rebels, who are Kurdish, filled in this gap. They fought against the remaining Assad soldiers, and with the Free Syrian Army. Their area is still not totally Assad free. What happens after the revolution is unclear. Kurds fear being overrun by islamists, because of their oil. 

 

And who are we?

Annabell: 

Annabell Van den Berghe is a journalist and Arabist/Hebraist. She started working as a producer and journalist in Egypt for the Belgian broadcast channel Canvas. Since then she has been active as a freelance producer and journalist for Dutch, Arabic and English media. She is also sworn translator for Arabic and Egyptian colloquial and teaches Arabic as a guest lecturer at K.U.Leuven.

Jeff: 

After traveling the world to surf, from age 22 to age 35, I returned to Holland in November 2012. In this time of travel, freedom had become an important part of my life. Something not only I should have, but all people. The single most important human right, if you ask me.

Photography had been a hobby during all those travels, but back in Holland I decided to see if I could make a living of it. I started assisting the renown Dutch portrait photographer Tessa Posthuma de Boer to learn more. One day, after assisting Tessa with the making of a portrait of Dutch MP Diederik Samson, I met a demonstrating Syrian outside the minister’s offices. He told me about the Kurdish struggles, and their current attempt at self-rule. This made me curious, so I went there.

The garbage was being collected, judges made their rulings, police patrolled the streets. Normal for us, but bizarre over there!
I tried to capture all this in images. But then I had to go. I want to go back, and capture the happenings. Both the successes and failures. And I want to contribute where possible by bringing them medicins and blankets." 
By funding this project, you make it possible for us to bring this story to the world. We will spread the news and give it the international attention it needs and deserves. And meanwhile, we can already do something about the bad health situation of a lot of the Kurdish people.  
 
Check the 'gallery tab' to see more photo's, or go to www.ruigphotography.com!  



 
What you gonna do with that cash?
Of course, it's not all peace in Kurdistan. They regularly get attacked by islamist rebels and by the government soldiers and planes. That is why this democracy is so fragile. The Kurds also blame Turkey in aiding the islamists to break their newly founded democracy. And they got oil. Bad position to be in. So they fight both Assad's army, and the islamists. Part of your money will go to insurance for both of us, the other part will go to antibiotics and blankets for those in need.
 
Basically we need:

 as much as possible for aid to the local people
 1000 euro in airline tickets
 700 euro to get smuggled over the border twice
 600 euro for 2 go-pro camera's that I can strap to myself or to the     Kurdish rebels
 800 euro a month for the fixer
 170 a month in insurances
 400 a month for my rent
 300 a month for gasoline (prices tripled overthere!)
 100 a month for food

 
As a contriber you get: 

-Over 10 euro: A big fat 'Thank You' on twitter and on this page. 

-Over 25 euro: That fat 'Thank you' and an awesome mobile phone sticker. The sticker sports a 'Kurdish sun' on it. It will make you shine! 

-Over 100 euro: A 'Thank You' for you or your company on my website during, and months after, the trip. A limited (1/50) photo of your choice (after return), A4 size. 

Over 500 euro: That 'Thank You' from above, plus that photo from above, plus a portrait of yourself, or someone you want photographed, shot in Amsterdam. This will be after the trip, upon my return. 


 
!!!Keep checking this campaign for new photo's!!! 
 
You can also help a lot by spreading the word via Facebook, Twitter, mail! Please do help, by sharing this project via the link above! 

 
Who are these Kurds? 


The Kurdish territory is spread over Syria, Turkey, Iran and Iraq. The world counts approx. 45 million Kurds. In Syria many Kurds are stateless. That means they are foreigners on their own land. They are not allowed to speak Kurdish, they have no passports, their identity card identifies them as a foreigner. This means they cannot own a business, or a house. Being active in Kurdish social organisations could get them imprisoned before the revolution. When the revolution started many of Assad's soldiers left to fight elsewhere. The YPG rebels, who are Kurdish, filled in this gap. They fought against the remaining Assad soldiers, and with the Free Syrian Army. Their area is still not totally Assad free. What happens after the revolution is unclear. Kurds fear being overrun by islamists, because of their oil. 
 
And who are we?
Annabell: 
Annabell Van den Berghe is a journalist and Arabist/Hebraist. She started working as a producer and journalist in Egypt for the Belgian broadcast channel Canvas. Since then she has been active as a freelance producer and journalist for Dutch, Arabic and English media. She is also sworn translator for Arabic and Egyptian colloquial and teaches Arabic as a guest lecturer at K.U.Leuven.
Jeff: 
After traveling the world to surf, from age 22 to age 35, I returned to Holland in November 2012. In this time of travel, freedom had become an important part of my life. Something not only I should have, but all people. The single most important human right, if you ask me.
Photography had been a hobby during all those travels, but back in Holland I decided to see if I could make a living of it. I started assisting the renown Dutch portrait photographer Tessa Posthuma de Boer to learn more. One day, after assisting Tessa with the making of a portrait of Dutch MP Diederik Samson, I met a demonstrating Syrian outside the minister’s offices. He told me about the Kurdish struggles, and their current attempt at self-rule. This made me curious, so I went there.

story:
Short Summary

This campaign is for the travel cost of a flight from North Carolina, a passport, hotel costs (may be split with the other snitches), and other NECESSARY expenses. This will NOT be used for food, souvenirs, or other non ESSENTIAL needs unless specifically stated by the person who donates.
  • My name is Chris Champitto (Chris "Snitch" Champitto on Facebook)  I have been playing Quidditch since 2009 when my high school freshmen English teacher told me I should try the sport out as I was "athletic enough to be the best, yet nerdy enough to not care if I were the best." Never have I had a teacher describe me in such an odd yet absolutely correct manner. Half way through my freshman year my best friend, and closest teammate committed suicide. I had told him a few weeks before I was thinking if quitting Quidditch to focus on track. He tried to talk me out of quitting, but nothing he said was changing my mind enough. Until I read a note he left me after his death. In the note read "Good luck in the upcoming  track season. I know you'll go out and goof off but end up winning it all. But as you're doing that remember that quidditch is a family  and I know you'll do even better at that. So keep playing and keep fighting" since that day I have never thought about quitting because he was right. Quidditch is a huge family. Even though I play for the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC) I am still close friends with all of the Duke Quidditch team. Please donate any amount you can so I can continue to be a part of this amazing family. 
  • Seeing as North Carolina is extremely new to the Quidditch world, and even newer to the snitch part of it, it has been hard to make a name for my self. For the past three year (up until about February 2014) I have been the only snitch detonated to snitching in North Carolina. I have always felt I have been living in the shadows of the thee big snitches, Kyle Carpenter, Rob "Snitch", and Austin Nukols. in my region and the neighboring South Region. Never being a snitch of my own, instead known as the "other Mid-Atlantic snitch" or "Austin and Rob's back up". However that all changed at the World Cup in April held at North Myrtle Beach. I had told all the snitches of my "disguise" but none had believed me. As the game started the crowd was small. I ran off the pitch to my hiding spot (purposely placed in front of the snitch tent) to go though with my "disguise".  I changed my shirt, my short,s my socks, and my cleats to different colors. But that wasn't the end. I started the game with long mop like hair. That soon changed as I shaved my head while off pitch. Soon the snitches heard I was doing it. As I returned to the game I was unnoticed. When they finally realized it was me, I took one last look around and notice I had a sea of yellow as all of the snitches not in a game were watching me. After about 5 minutes I was caught sending the game into overtime. That's when all the snitches were cheering me on telling me this was my game and I was going to win this overtime. As the clock hit zero my fellow snitches stormed the field telling me I had won. It was at that moment that I realized I had stepped out of the shadow of the other snitches and now am recognized as my own snitch. Furthering this belief was being contacted asking if I wanted to snitch the true world championship of Quidditch. That is where I new your help. Any amount will do. I will have some perks related to snitching, some to art, some to randomness.

What We Need & What You Get 

  • The funds raised in this campaign is for the travel cost of a flight from North Carolina, a passport, hotel costs (may be split with the other snitches), and other NECESSARY expenses. This will NOT be used for food, souvenirs, or other non ESSENTIAL needs unless specifically stated by the person who donates.
  • If I am unable to reach my goal and am still to far from the total monetary needs to go. 150% will be donated to the National MS Society. That's right I said 150% I will personally donate, from my own pocket, half of the total funds raised.

Perks

If you donate for a perk on the donation notes just say what perk you would like. Any and all perks also includes the perk levels below (price wise) it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate monetarily just hitting the "share"button can still help. 

    If you have any questions or concerns I'm an open book so much so that I'll give my personal email address out. demoteam1@gmail.com just make the subject "send Chris to Global Games"

story:
ORDER YOUR VEGA RIGHT NOW FROM -  www.zxvega.co.uk !!


The Vega Project Moves On

Responses to the Vega Project

Our Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign for the Sinclair Spectrum Vega games computer has been a great success.  We raised £149,521, which is 50% more than our target.

We also received a lot of positive media coverage for the Vega project, as well as many comments of support. Here is a sample group of recent postings by Spectrum fans.

Paul Vincent

I have all the spectrum computers and they still work now and I have a massive collection of the old tapes and love it just as much now as I did when I first got them

Steven Bohme

Thanks brought back memories. Hope they have Top Gun as one of the 1000 games, spent many hours on that one. Cheers Steve.

Thorlak Barfod

Keep the ZX Spectrum alive – one of the greatest memories from my childhood :-) What a brilliant idea the ZX Spectrum VEGA is!
Keep up the good work!

Vic Howlett

As an grey surfer this appeals to me it’s a great idea full of retro games brilliant – what next?

Fee Sturrock

I use an Emulator for the Nintendo DS, But Cant wait for this , Keep up the good work guys . ZX Spectrum rules :)

Richard Townley

I remember have the 16k ZX Spectrum when it was released and then upgrading it to 48k with the chips. I now use an Emulator now but this would be so much better!!

Ben James

Very nostalgic about this. I’d love to think I can excite my kids about playing Pssst or Atic Atac

Stewart Byron

Can’t wait until June!

silelf

Excellent idea!

The Manufacturing Process Begins

Our manufacturer, SMS Electronics Ltd of Beeston, Nottinghamshire, has now started the various procedures necessary to put the Vega onto their assembly line. They are ordering the electronic components, they are working with the plastics factory to ensure that the tooling drawings are complete and accurate, and once the tools for the plastics have been made SMS will be checking to ensure that the various parts of the Vega’s case and key arrangements fit together perfectly. These are just a few of the tasks that need diligent management and quality control at every stage, in order to deliver thoroughly tested Vega computers.

Inside the SMS Electronics Ltd factory in Nottinghamshire


In the meantime we have been inundated with many offers from the owners of rights to Spectrum games. By the end of January we had already been given permissions from these rights owners for many hundreds of tried and tested games, many of them famous games from the 1980s. And more games are being offered to us almost every day, please do still contact us if you would like to see your games added to the Vega.

More Features Added

During the two months when our Indiegogo campaign was running we received many suggestions and questions from Spectrum fans about various features that they would like to see added to the Vega’s specification. It is very important to us to satisfy as many as possible of these Spectrum fans, so we have considered all of their suggestions, and as a result we have decided to add two of their suggested features to the specification of the Vega.

1  ZX Spectrum games often make use of the keyboard to perform additional game operations. We are therefore adding extra buttons to the Vega, giving the user direct access to such operations for the majority of games.

2   We are designing the Vega with the capacity for expansion by providing a hardware interface on it's circuit board, and by allowing future software upgrades.

These improvements to our original specification have now been completed in the circuitry, on the printed circuit board layout, and in the plastics designs and the tooling drawings.

We will be making more announcements about the manufacturing process from time to time in order to keep you up to date with our progress.

FIRST ENQUIRIES FROM RETAIL DISTRIBUTORS

Even before we could think seriously about our retail distribution plans we began to receive enquiries from companies in the UK and abroad, companies interested in the possibility of distributing the Vega via retail channels. We are having our first meetings with UK-based retail distributors in the coming weeks but we expect it will be another few months before we decide on the optimal distribution policy for retail distribution – whether to work through many retail outlets or whether to make exclusive distribution deals for a whole country or region. Either way, we expect the Vega to be in the shops, in the UK at least, around September 2015.

And of course we will definitely be selling the Vega from our web site and, for the foreseeable future, from the Indiegogo site.

AND FINALLY

Thank you again for your interest in the Vega project and for your support. We will be providing regular news updates on the project as time goes on.


_________________________________________________________________________



Sir Clive Sinclair and Retro Computers Ltd are pleased to announce the launch of the Sinclair ZX Spectrum Vega


Every Vega sold will contribute to a children's charity

(Render of Sinclair Spectrum Vega)


(Photo of 3D model prototype not final model)

The Sinclair Spectrum Vega is a new low cost games computer based on Sir Clive’s hugely successful Spectrum products of the early 1980s.

The Sinclair Spectrum Vega takes advantage of major advances in technology to achieve big cost savings by replacing most of the electronics in the earlier computer products. Instead the Vega uses a low cost micro-controller and a clever piece of software that combine to enable the Vega to run all of the games, 14,000 or more of them, which were developed during the years when some 5 million of the original Sinclair Spectrum were being sold.

The Sinclair Spectrum Vega is being marketed by Retro Computers Ltd, a Luton-based start-up in which Sir Clive’s company, Sinclair Research Ltd, is a shareholder. The development and marketing of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega is under licence from Sky In-Home Service Ltd, who inherited the intellectual property rights to the Spectrum computers from Amstrad.  Development of the product is complete, and a fully-functioning prototype is ready to go into production.

The Sinclair Spectrum Vega is as simple to use as any of the popular games consoles, but far less expensive. It plugs into a TV, so no computer monitor is necessary, and comes complete with around 1,000 games built-in. The Vega has sufficient memory to allow the user to download the many additional games we will be making available from time to time free of charge.

The Vega has been developed by a former ZX Spectrum games developer who is the world's leading expert on Sinclair Spectrum technology.

Retro Computers Ltd is making arrangements with the owners of the software rights to Spectrum games to donate a combined software royalty to a charity – Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children. The company’s Chairman, Dr David Levy, had his life saved by the hospital when he was diagnosed with meningitis as a 3-year-old.

This Indiegogo campaign is to raise funds to manufacture the first 1,000 units of the Vega within the UK and to prepare us for the second production run.

This is your opportunity to be one of the first to own a Vega, as well as a range of other exciting perks. These include: concept art, signed by Sir Clive Sinclair, of our original concept designs; a copy of a new book about the creation of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega; an invitation to the Vega launch party next spring; and an invitation to ‘come to dinner’ and meet some of the Retro Computers Ltd team. In addition those who pledge £50 or more will have their names added to the ‘Digital Role of Honour’ which will be embedded into the Vega’s memory, displayed on our web site (unless you choose to be anonymous) and can be displayed on the TV when using the Vega.

Current Status 

The development of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega is complete, and we have a fully working prototype waiting to go into production within the UK. We are making contact with thousands of the original Spectrum game developers in order to secure their permission to use their games on the Vega, for which a combined software royalty will be donated to charity ‒ Great Ormond Street Hospital for children.

Once the first 1,000 Limited Edition Vegas have been manufactured and shipped, and we move on to the next 3,000 units and thereafter to batches of 10,000 or more, the retail price of the Vega will reduce. But even at £100 the cost of the limited edition Vega, with its 1,000 games built-in, represents a huge saving over the cost of the original product plus the cost of 1,000 of the original Spectrum games. What cost thousands of pounds back in the 1980s is now available for around 1 per cent of that amount.

Inspiration for the Sinclair Spectrum Vega

The Vega is a culmination of many years of work and perseverance by our team, who have come together to create something special that resonates with those who grew up with the original Sinclair Spectrum, as well as being accessible to today’s gamers who are looking for some nostalgic game play while having the ease of use of modern technology at an incredibly low price. For enthusiasts who would like to know more about the project you can pledge to receive, as one of the perks, the book ‘Creating The Sinclair ZX Vega’which has been written by the team about our journey to create the Vega.

Sir Clive Sinclair talks to David Levy about the original Spectrum –


Development of the Vega

The Sinclair Spectrum Vega has been designed and developed by the world’s leading expert on the technology behind the Sinclair ZX Spectrum range of computers.

Features of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega

The Vega is very simple to operate. Just connect it to your TV with the cables provided and off you go. Games are accessed through a menu based system and are easy to access. Games load automatically, taking you directly into the game play mode. When you wish to play another game, simply press the centrally placed reset button and this takes you back to the main menu. Nothing could be simpler.

About us –

Sir Clive Sinclair –is one of the most famous British born inventors of all time. He launched his first mass market consumer product in 1962. An expert at miniaturization, Sir Clive has brought to mass market more than 100 highly innovative consumer products through various companies such as Sinclair Radionics and Sinclair Research. Examples of his famous products include the world's first pocket television in 1966, the world's first pocket calculator in 1972 and the UKs  best-selling personal computer of all time in 1982.

Dr David Levy - is a British International Master of chess who is noted for his involvement with both computer chess and artificial intelligence. He is President of the International Computer Games Association and the founder of the Computer Olympiads as well as the Mind Sports Olympiads. David has also written more than 50 books on computer games, A.I., and robotics.

Manufacture of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega

We already have a fully functioning prototype of the Vega. You can see a game running on the prototype here -


We have a short-list of four UK electronics manufacturing companies, and will soon be making our choice between them to commence assembly of the Vega in the UK.  Following our initial run of 1,000 units we plan to increase production steadily, with 3,000 units in the second production run followed by batches of 10,000 or more. All of our initial sales will be via our web site but subsequently we will be seeking marketing arrangements with distributors in the UK, USA and elsewhere.

Delivering the Vega 

The first 1,000 backers who pledge £100 or more in support will receive the limited edition Vega as one of their perks. Some of the other perks available are: Having your name added to the roll of honour on the Vega, Concept art signed by Sir Clive Sinclair, copies of the book about the Vega’s creation, come to the official launch of the Vega, or come and meet some of the team over dinner!

Risks and Challenges

We have worked very hard to minimize the risks and challenges to this project. We have contracted with Sky In-Home Service Ltd to ensure the correct hardware permissions are in place. We are seeking permissions from the software rights holders to incorporate their games in the Vega. Members of our team have many years of experience in creating, developing, and selling electronic devices, as well as experience in publishing and retail sales.

In the very unlikely event that we do not raise sufficient funding to manufacture the first 1,000 units we will return all pledged money to those who picked a Vega as their perk.

FAQ

Q - Can you explain the TV output/connections please?

A - Composite video, stereo audio, USB for power.


Q - Can I connect a keyboard?

A - We're reviewing our expansion options.


Q - Is a Bluetooth input/output included?

A - No, this is a straight-to-TV game console.


Q - Will it work on my iPad, or just a TV?

A - TV - PAL and NTSC.


Q - Is this an android device?

A - No.


Q - What file format will work on the SD card?

A - The standard FAT filesystem. The Vega will read tap and snapshot files.


Q – Is the ZX Vega compatible with all the Spectrum games?

A – To the best of our knowledge the Vega should work with all games created for the original Spectrum machines.


Q – Can I pledge for more than one perk? For example, a Vega and some signed concept art?

A – Yes you can pledge as many times as you want for different combinations of perks.


Q – Can I load my own Spectrum games onto the Vega?

A – Yes it is possible to use an SD card to load more games onto the Vega


Q - What does the Vega offer over the original Spectrum?

A - Simplicity. The Vega is small, portable, plug-and-go, with instant loading of games. It also includes some newer features such as an increased colour palette and an SDCard to load new games or software updates.


Q - Does it support the 48k and 128k machines?

A - Yes, all models of the Spectrum are supported.


Q - Will you be able to connect keyboards or controllers via USB or Bluetooth?

A - The Vega provides an on-screen keyboard, which can be activated when required. We would very much like to make the Vega as expandable as possible, both with hardware and software, and are considering possibilities.


Disclaimers And Legal Notices

All trademarks are copyright their respective owners.

to run all of the games, 14,000 or more of them, which were developed during
the years when some 5 million of the original Sinclair Spectrum were being sold.


The Sinclair Spectrum Vega is being
marketed by Retro Computers Ltd, a Luton-based start-up in which Sir Clive’s
company, Sinclair Research Ltd, is a shareholder. The development and marketing
of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega is
under licence from Sky In-Home Service Ltd, who inherited the intellectual
property rights to the Spectrum computers from Amstrad.  Development of the product is complete, and a
fully-functioning prototype is ready to go into production.


The Sinclair Spectrum Vega is as simple to
use as any of the popular games consoles, but far less expensive. It plugs into
a TV, so no computer monitor is necessary, and comes complete with around 1,000
games built-in. The Vega has
sufficient memory to allow the user to download the many additional games we
will be making available from time to time free of charge.


The Vega has been developed by a former ZX Spectrum games developer who is the world's leading expert on
Sinclair Spectrum technology.


Retro
Computers Ltd is making arrangements with the owners of the software rights to
Spectrum games to donate a combined software royalty to a charity – Great Ormond
 Street Hospital
for Children. The company’s Chairman, Dr David Levy, had his life saved by the
hospital when he was diagnosed with meningitis as a 3-year-old.


This
Indiegogo campaign is to raise funds to manufacture the first 1,000
units of the Vega
within the UK and to prepare us for the second
production run.


This is your
opportunity to be one of the first to own a Vega, as well as a range of other exciting perks.
These include: concept art, signed by Sir Clive Sinclair, of our
original concept designs; a copy of a new book about the creation of the Sinclair Spectrum Vega; an invitation
to the Vega launch party next spring; and an invitation to ‘come to dinner’ and
meet some of the Retro Computers Ltd team. In addition those who pledge £50 or
more will have their names added to the ‘Digital Role of Honour’ which will be
embedded into the Vega’s memory, displayed on our web site (unless you choose to be anonymous) and can be displayed on
the TV when using the Vega.


Current Status  


The
development of the Sinclair Spectrum
Vega is complete, and we have a fully
working prototype waiting to go into
production within the UK.
We are making contact with thousands of the original
Spectrum game developers in order to secure their permission to use their games
on the Vega, for which a combined
software royalty will be donated to charity ‒
Great Ormond Street
 Hospital for children.
Once the first 1,000 Limited Edition Vegas have been manufactured and shipped, and we move on to 
the next 3,000 units and thereafter to batches of 10,000 or more, the retail price of 
the Vega will reduce. But even at £100 the cost of the limited edition Vega, 
with its 1,000 games built-in, represents a huge saving over the cost of the 
original product plus the cost of 1,000 of the original Spectrum games. What 
cost thousands of pounds back in the 1980s is now available for around 1 per 
cent of that amount.


Inspiration for the Sinclair Spectrum
Vega


The Vega is a culmination of many years of
work and perseverance by our team, who have come together to create something
special that resonates with those who grew up with the original Sinclair Spectrum, as well as being
accessible to today’s gamers who are looking for some nostalgic game play while
having the ease of use of modern technology at an
incredibly low price. For enthusiasts
who would like to know more about the project you can pledge to receive, as one of the perks, the book ‘Creating The Sinclair ZX Vega’which has been written
by the team about our journey to create the Vega. 


Sir Clive
Sinclair talks to David Levy about the original Spectrum –



Development of the Vega

The
Sinclair Spectrum Vega has been
designed and developed by the world’s leading expert on the
technology behind the Sinclair ZX Spectrum range of computers.


Features of the Sinclair Spectrum
Vega


The Vega is
very simple to operate. Just connect it to your TV with the cables provided and
off you go. Games are accessed through a menu based system and are easy to
access. Games load automatically, taking you directly
into the game play mode. When you wish to play another game, simply
press the centrally placed reset button and this takes you back to the main menu. Nothing could be simpler.


About us –


Sir Clive Sinclair –is one of
the most famous British born inventors of all time. He launched his first mass market consumer product in 1962. An expert at miniaturization, Sir Clive has brought
to mass market more than 100 highly innovative consumer products through
various companies such as Sinclair Radionics and Sinclair Research. Examples of his famous products include the world's
first pocket television in 1966, the world's
first pocket calculator in 1972 and the UKs  best-selling personal computer of all time in 1982.


Dr David Levy - is a British International Master
of chess who is noted for his involvement with both computer chess and
artificial intelligence. He is President of the International Computer Games
Association and the founder of the Computer Olympiads as well as the Mind
Sports Olympiads. David has also written more than 50
books on computer games, A.I., and robotics.


Manufacture of the Sinclair Spectrum
Vega


We already
have a fully functioning prototype of the Vega.
You can see a game running on the prototype here -





We
have a short-list of four UK electronics manufacturing companies, and will soon
be making our choice between them to commence assembly of the Vega in the UK.  Following our initial run of 1,000 units we
plan to increase production steadily, with 3,000 units in the second production
run followed by batches of 10,000 or more. All of our initial sales will be via
our web site but subsequently we will be seeking marketing arrangements with
distributors in the UK, USA
and elsewhere.

Delivering the Vega  
The first
1,000 backers who pledge £100 or more in support will receive the limited
edition Vega as one of their perks.
Some of the other perks available are: Having your name added to the roll of honour on the Vega, Concept art
signed by Sir Clive Sinclair, copies of the book about the Vega’s creation,
come to the official launch of the Vega, or come and meet some of the team over
dinner!

Risks and Challenges
We have
worked very hard to minimize the risks and challenges to this project. We have
contracted with Sky In-Home Service Ltd to ensure the correct hardware
permissions are in place. We are seeking permissions from the software rights
holders to incorporate their games in the Vega.
Members of our team have many years of experience in creating, developing, and
selling electronic devices, as well as experience in publishing and retail
sales. 
In
the very unlikely event that we do not raise sufficient funding to manufacture
the first 1,000 units we will return all pledged money to those who picked a Vega as their perk.
FAQ

Q - Can you explain the TV output/connections please?
A - Composite video, stereo audio, USB for power.

Q - Can I connect a keyboard?
A - We're reviewing our expansion options.

Q - Is a Bluetooth input/output included?
A - No, this is a straight-to-TV game console.

Q - Will it work on my iPad, or just a TV?
A - TV - PAL and NTSC.

Q - Is this an android device?
A - No.

Q - What file format will work on the SD card?
A - The standard FAT filesystem. The Vega will read tap and snapshot files.
Q – Is the ZX Vega compatible with all the Spectrum
games?

A – To the best of our knowledge the Vega should work
with all games created for the original Spectrum machines.

Q – Can I pledge for more than one perk? For example, a
Vega and some signed concept art?
A – Yes you can pledge as many times as you want for
different combinations of perks.

Q – Can I load my own Spectrum games onto the Vega?
A – Yes it is possible to use an SD card to load more
games onto the Vega


Q - What does the Vega offer over the original Spectrum?
A - Simplicity. The Vega is small, portable, plug-and-go,
with instant loading of games. It also includes some newer features such as an increased
colour palette and an SDCard to load new games or software updates.

Q - Does it support the 48k and 128k machines?
A - Yes, all models of the Spectrum are supported.

Q - Will you be able to connect keyboards or controllers via
USB or Bluetooth?
A - The Vega provides an on-screen keyboard, which can be
activated when required. We would very much like to make the Vega as expandable
as possible, both with hardware and software, and are considering
possibilities.

Disclaimers And Legal Notices
All
trademarks are copyright their respective owners.

story:
You pick the celebrity, the occasion, and your loved one's name.

Here's An Example.

How cool would it be if you gave your friend named Meredith, who's favorite celebrity is Fergie, a card that, when you open, has Fergie's actual voice, inside the card, saying her name and wishing her Happy New Year?

"Hey what's up Meredith! It's your girl Fergie! Happy New Year!"





100% Of Greeting Card Profits To Charity

Each celebrity that joins the giveStars family picks the charity they are most passionate about.

 

Just A Few Of The Charities GiveStars Supports:

Every celebrity who joins the giveStars family will bring a new charity into the fold. 


We Need Your Help

Our main goal is to work hand-in-hand with celebrities to make a real difference in the world by giving 100% of our greeting card profits to the causes they care about most.

By crowdfunding, we are ensuring that our model remains intact and is being supported by others who feel the same way we do.


We've Come So Far

Celebrities & Prototypes Are Complete

With the blessing of many A-List Celebrities and our prototypes created, giveStars is no longer just a concept or a dream...


Now we just need your help so we can:

 

RECORD THE CELEBRITIES VOICES

With hundreds of celebrities, thousands of people's names and over 25 major holidays and occasions, you can imagine this is no small task. The good thing is, the celebrities have volunteered to do it. We just have to rent the recording studios.

   

BUILD THE GIVESTARS WEBSITE

Creating a website that will enable you to create a card with your friend or loved one's favorite celebrity, as well as the person's name that you're sending it to and also the holiday or occasion that you are celebrating is no small task either. Great news is, we have an expert team of designers and programmers who have already built the  blueprint to the site, making it an easy self-serve user interface.

FINALIZE MANUFACTURING OF CARDS

We have prototypes and are recording and building more by the day. 

Frequently Asked Questions



Who selects the charity? 

Each one of your favorite celebrities selects a cause that is closest to their heart and 100% of the profits from their greeting card sales go to that cause.

Do the proceeds from this indiegogo campaign go to charity?  

Like you, we can't wait to make a significant difference in the world by giving 100% of our greeting card profits to causes that really need it.  That being said, all proceeds during this indiegogo campaign are helping us build this amazing company.  

Is giveStars a non-profit?

Down the line we may look at ways to monetize, but we will never steer away from our commitment of giving 100% of the greeting card profits to charity.  

How big are the cards? 

Each card is 5.75" square x 3/8" thick. 

How long do they last?  

This question is fun.  Each card can last years and years but it really comes down to how many times you want to hear your favorite celebrity saying that special greeting to you. 

Where are the cards made?

Each card is made in United States.  As we expand in to other countries we will build a manufacturing facility closer to those geographic locations that love giveStars.  We believe in lean manufacturing which means we don't build anything until a card is ordered.  This way we cut down on waste and can focus on quality.  

What celebrities will be available when you launch?

Our goal is to have all of your favorite celebrities on board with giveStars.  We haven't had one say no to us.  Who's your favorite celebrity?  Let us know, let's get them!  

Can I leave my own message in the card?

We reserved 65 characters on the back of the card just for you to spill your heart out.  Oh yeah, you can put a photo too.  If you really want to write on the card then have it delivered to you - then write til' you can't write's no more.

story:
Who Are We?

Phoenix Gaming Lounge is the long time dream of Joshua Ogle and Jeff Mumpower. We are lifelong friends who want to provide a retail game experience that is unrivaled in the state of Arizona. We are in the final stages of opening the store and are looking for your support to give our local gamers an innovative and friendly place they can call home. It is our goal to provide a clean, friendly, inviting atmosphere for gamers to play premium board games and card games.

What do We Need?

Every little bit helps. Even a small donation and a social media share with your friends goes a long way. Our doors are opening January 2, 2015 and every dollar raised will be invested directly into our gaming community. This includes, but is not limited to:
  • Free WiFi to visitors
  • Cell phone and tablet charging station
  • Laptop bar
  • Full concession stand
If we are fortunate enough to go beyond our initial request, we will continue to grow our store into the best place to game in the country. 

What are We Up Against?

One of the biggest challenges in starting a business within a niche market (like social gaming) is that many lending institutions shy away from loaning to that company. We were able to save the money needed to open and stock the store but we want to be able to provide our complete vision as soon as the store opens.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out to any of your friends who enjoy social gaming by liking our Facebook page and using the share button.


Thank you for reading our request, and for your continuing support.

-Joshua Ogle

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We’re Pipeline Gaming, and we’re a group of Ryerson students who are producing a big e-sports tournament in mid-December. There are six of us working on this project, our thesis project, and the culmination of four years spent accruing massive student debt. It all comes down to this. No pressure.

Thanks mom.

WHAT ARE WE DOING?

We’re gathering 128 players to compete in an NHL 16 tournament over the course of three days, with a $1,500 cash prize pool. The finale will take place in the former Maple Leaf Gardens...a perfect historic site for our obviously historic tournament.

We are going to make this a real-live broadcast event which will be streamed on twitch.tv. For the finale at the former MLG, we plan on having multiple announcing crews, a panel, make-up, the whole shebang. Our players will feel like real NHLsuperstars...including the sweat. We expect a few hundred viewers.

And EVEN MORE, we’re also producing a documentary about the process behind making this production a reality.

WHAT DO WE NEED?

But we can’t do it alone. We need money for venue costs, equipment rentals, catering, printing, crew, and just-in-case we fuck up. It doesn’t sound like much, but believe you me, it can all add up. And that’s why we’re here today.

Every cent donated to the project will go into our costs. While we have covered the costs of the prize pool with our tournament buy-in, we’re not breaking even with the amount of production quality we’re going to put into this broadcast. Being blunt, we need your money. We will spend it all. Our group will not profit from this venture. There’s only so far our blood, sweat and tears can take us, and that’s where you come in, Internet. Help Pipeline Gaming legitimize the burgeoning world of e-sports.

WHY SHOULD YOU CARE?

This tournament will showcase some of the most talented players who’ve picked up a controller to play NHL16. This will be a game played to its highest potential, pushed to its limits. These are no small fish.  And we want to share their skills with the world wide web.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Donations are obviously greatly appreciated. But even if you can’t donate, if you like our project, please feel free to share this page with your friends, family, relatives, that guy who you always see walking his dog in the park...eyeballs will help us succeed.

story:
RepliCade x Centipede is a fully-playable miniature arcade cabinet developed by New Wave Toys and officially licensed by Atari

Featuring a custom made smooth rolling Trackball with customizable sensitivity setting and Fire button with modern gamepad quality. 

Media Coverage

Prototype Gameplay Demo

Check out our Halloween video update to get a closer look at the product, features and game play!

What size is the RepliCade x Centipede cabinet?

Designed with fine 1/6th scale details to fit perfectly with your toy collection, game/bookshelves or desk.

RepliCade x Centipede Features and Specs 

  • Accurately reproduced 1/6th scale cabinet profile
  • Mixed media cabinet appointments: wood, metal, plastic, rubber
  • LED back-lit Marquee & cabinet accents
  • Custom made mini Trackball and push buttons
  • High-quality speaker, 3-watt amp for accurate audio reproduction
  • RepliCade high-performance chipset for smooth, lag-free gameplay 
  • On/Off switch and volume control knob
  • Accurate art reproduction, laminated vinyl side and control panel overlays that look great, won’t rub off or bubble 
  • Powered by built-in rechargeable Lithium ion battery 
  • Includes micro USB charge cable 
  • Large 3.5” LCD full-color screen (4:3 aspect ratio - vertical orientation)
  • Dedicated Centipede game featuring original arcade game ROM 
  • Officially licensed by Atari
  • Premium retail packaging
  • MSRP: $160

Cabinet Art Reproduction

The spectacular Centipede arcade cabinet art work is reproduced by heat transfer, and high quality vinyl overlays.

Coin Door Functionality

 

Simply press the left Coin Return/Free Play button to add credits or push the right Coin Return/Main Menu button to access the system menu.

Officially Licensed by Atari

All RepliCade 1/6th scale collector's edition cabinets are officially licensed.

What are RepliCade Amusements?

At New Wave Toys, we believe that bringing home the arcade experience means more than simply playing the original arcade ROM. The video arcade experience is a blend of many things, and to truly bring that experience into your home requires great attention to detail. 

RepliCade Amusements combine a blend of traditional design and materials with modern technology to recreate your favorite arcade classics in sixth scale. 

These miniaturized arcade machines are fully playable and officially licensed by the original manufacturers. Every detail in these amazing works of arcade art has been painstakingly reproduced, including:

  • Wooden cabinet in perfect profile
  • Accurately reproduced control system
  • Backlit LED marquee with authentic art
  • Authentic metal coin door
  • Vividly reproduced side panel art, bezel, and control panel overlay graphics 

For our RepliCade X Centipede Collector's Edition, the Trackball and push buttons have been resized to coordinate with the sixth scale cabinet while retaining a fully-functional and satisfying gameplay experience. 

And of course all RepliCade machines run the original arcade game ROMs you expect! 

Our goal is to give you the ability to recreate classic video game arcade ambiance in your own home for a fraction of the cost and size of full-sized, vintage arcade cabinets. 

With RepliCade Amusements, you can finally build your very own collection of classic arcade machines from the 70's, 80's and 90's, the perfect complement to your toy collection, game room, home or office. 

Special News Investigation on New Wave Toys and RepliCade

Team

Our team of makers has over 20 years of experience in design, development, marketing, and manufacturing of video game software, hardware, accessories, and collectibles. Now we’ve struck out on our own to form New Wave Toys, a company dedicated to making the products we wish we had growing up. 

 

RepliCade x Centipede at IndieCade 2017

We showed RepliCade x Centipede in public for the first time at IndieCade 2017. People of all ages were blown away with the attention to detail and the authentic arcade game play experience.

Would you like to own a miniature replica of one of the most iconic arcade games of all time? 

1/6th scale Centipede X RepliCade alongside a vintage upright Centipede arcade cabinet (note, vintage Centipede cabinet has reproduction CPO control panel overlay). 

Premium Centipede Collector's Edition, Limited Production

For collector's who demand authenticity and quality craftsmanship, New Wave Toy's presents the RepliCade x Centipede Collector's Edition arcade machine. The iconic Atari arcade machine Centipede, is available for the first time in 1/6 scale. Start your collection of 1/6 scale RepliCade arcade cabinets today.

Special News Investigation on New Wave Toys and RepliCade

Team
Our team of makers has over 20 years of experience in design, development, marketing, and manufacturing of video game software, hardware, accessories, and collectibles. Now we’ve struck out on our own to form New Wave Toys, a company dedicated to making the products we wish we had growing up. 
 
RepliCade x Centipede at IndieCade 2017

We showed RepliCade x Centipede in public for the first time at IndieCade 2017. People of all ages were blown away with the attention to detail and the authentic arcade game play experience.

Would you like to own a miniature replica of one of the most iconic arcade games of all time? 


1/6th scale Centipede X RepliCade alongside a vintage upright Centipede arcade cabinet (note, vintage Centipede cabinet has reproduction CPO control panel overlay). 

Premium Centipede Collector's Edition, Limited Production
For collector's who demand authenticity and quality craftsmanship, New Wave Toy's presents the RepliCade x Centipede Collector's Edition arcade machine. The iconic Atari arcade machine Centipede, is available for the first time in 1/6 scale. Start your collection of 1/6 scale RepliCade arcade cabinets today.

story:
Hi everybody, 

My name is Lorenzo, but if you like playing "The Sims 4" using custom contents or mods you probably know me as LorySims. 

Sometimes many users ask me to bring their favourite cars to the game, but I can't afford the 3D models, so I decided to start launching crowdfunding campaigns for the most wanted vehicles. 

This Tesla Roadster is my first crowdfunding project, if I succeed I'll keep launching campaigns.

 

It's planned in 7 different default colors: red, silver, gray, black, white, blue and dark blue.

 

Even if the minimum goal I can set for an Indiegogo project is $500, I only need $99 in order to buy this model, and I will start the project as soon as I reach $99. Eventual exceeding money will be used to buy tools in order to create more contents.

If you donate $9, you'll be able to choose an extra paintjob, If you donate $19 or more, you'll get a custom license plate on your Tesla!

If the goal isn't reached within 1 month, all of your donations will be refunded.

 

Risks

The 3d model has an average amount of polygons, meaning that most of the modern computers should run The Sims 4 smoothly even if you're using this mod, but a very weak PC may lag your game or even overheat, so I recommend you to try this car that has a similiar polygons amount first: https://www.mediafire.com/file/71uiux511b452m9/...

story:
Kardland Board Game 

       A long time ago when darkness and evil owned the land, many dreadful creatures and warriors were trying to rule the world.The player have to be wise enough and enough sly with his mortal enemy using their cards to become a winner. 

    The Kardland is a medium complexity game that plays between 2 enemy players fighting each other with the cards help which can take more than 20 minutes . 


 

  With Ancient Card Creatures, the players fight each other to keep themself  alive. They have different powers and ways to fight which the player must use against his enemy.

                                                                          Rules by short...

                                                       

         As you know all of us are different, with different tastes, with different brains, but we all have something in commun: by our nature we are born with a great fighting spirit. So, we tried to make  Kardland, by design and role, a mix of Harry Poter, Vikings, Lord of the Rings and Avatar storyes.

         We tried to make simple rules in order not to allocate precious time for understanding it and get bored before playing. Also Kardland is not hard to set-up because doesn't have many, many small pieces and it's not hard to pack it after you finish it.

         Only for this campaign we have wonderful unique assets with a special design built to meet the unique needs of the game project. 

         We love the idea of working together as a community and for the community to make something awesome, so if you support our project and we have over 100 Perks Comment Requests we are able to take it to the next level and procede for an IOS and Android Karland Game.

         By perking this campaign we will be able to understand if this is on the public taste or not and we can't do it without you.

         Please support our project even by a small contribution and you'll be mentioned on our Indiegogo Campaign Supporter List.


 $1       Any support is welcome and we thank you a lot! And for that you receive six digital HD Wallpaper with our cool heroes.


$5        Only for purchasing this perk you will receive a set of 6 HD wallpapers with our heroes + PDF file format with 50 cards(PDF format- high resolution)


$25     Our Pocket Kardland Game it's the smaller (6/4 inch or 15/10 cm) version of the Standard  Kardland Game but without the 3D Characters. This is only for this campaign!

$30    A special set of ten 3D Characters which can be used also as individual or in other games.

$55   This is what it's all about! One Standard Kardland Game to play and have wonderful time with your "enemy" friends. You have also our eternal gratitude for makeing this dream a reality.

$80     The big and the small version of the Kardland Game for special moments.

$100   Here we have some nice exclusively items like the box for the Standard Kardland Game which is a handmade wood box with an old look, a t-shirt with a "wear what you play" model at your choise from the three styles, 100 additional cards designed only for this campaign and a dedicated and signed poster.

$150    A 3D Deluxe Character (6 inch/15 cm) and all from the previous reward.

                                             


              We aim at delivering not only a good game, but also high quality materials. Thus, the materials and manufacturing process makes up the largest portion of the scheduled budget, including tooling and sampling costs to make sure the miniatures meet our quality goals. 


            All rewards will be shipped from Europe through our local postal provider so your package should arrive also via your local postal service provider.

This is an average value and if we're lucky, it can become cheaper.

For Canada, US, and Europe $15 will be added to your perk value.

The rest of the world $30 will be added to your perk value.

Please be aware that for countries outside the EU or USA, import taxes or customs may apply depending on your local regulations. Please familiarize yourself with customs handling in your country in order not to be surprised by any customs fees.

I know this is complex so please contact me or post a comment if you have any questions.


         The risks and challenges to bring Kardland to life have already been addressed. The Production "molds" have been completed. All of our 3D characters are made here,  so we won't have to deal with any problems.

We don't have any specialist to come and say: "Hey, this is a good or a bad game!"We let you to judge all the aspects of Kardland Board Game and more than that we are open to your preference suggestions as well as the constructive criticisms.

Throughout the Indiegogo (as well as after it ends) we will be available to answer any questions, and will do our best to keep everyone informed about the status of this project. I  will be live in the comments section as often as possible, and I will also be monitoring any messages sent through Indiegogo or Facebook.

We have worked very hard to bring this game in your hands, and we are almost at the finish line. We just need your help.

 

                                       

           We are a family team which work in Design/Game field firfiricastudio.com . We have almost ten years of experience and Kardland is "our child" because is our first Tabletop Game project.

Since last year we decided to begin this challange because we considered to have enough experience designing for other companies.

That's why we need your help for this project.



Folks please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools anytime or join us on facebook.

                                                  KardLand FACEBOOK

story:
Welcome to our Indiegogo campaign! We're launching this campaign to turn Springfield Mania into a Puzzle-Trivia-Adventure-Social game that will be bigger and more ambitious than anything we've ever made to date! If you loved watching The Simpsons™, this game is for you! This game will be offered to the entire community as a FREE GAME on iOS, Android, Windows Phone/Tablet, and via Facebook on PC & Mac.

Such a big game idea requires hiring talented game developers and artists, plus a lot of hard work! We promise that ALL funds we raise will go toward the production of this game. The more we raise, the more we can bring to you.

How can you help make this game happen? You can help us by FUNDING, SHARING and FOLLOWING the campaign. Be sure to come back and check out our UPDATES tab (above)! 

 

 

 

Why indiegogo?

Our full-time investment of time and money has produced 55% of the game. Additional resources are required to complete the production for a timely release in July 2015. Through this indiegogo project, you can help us raise money to finish the production of an amazing and unforgettable cross-platform game.

How will the money be used?

Money raised will be used to meet these milestones:

- Goal of $10,000: finish development of the iPhone, iPod and iPad (HD) version of the game

- Goal of $20,000: extend the game for use on Android and Windows operated mobile devices

- Goal of $30,000: extend the game for use on PC and Mac through Facebook

 

About the Game:

 

In Springfield Mania, players will be challenged to solve and name popular (and not so popular!) characters from The Simpsons™, testing their knowledge and competing against friends as they progress through each level. Players drive through the city of Springfield and earn points by correctly guessing the characters. Bring your friends on board and get help when needed. Springfield Mania, is an easy-to-play and addictive game. 

 

 

     

    1,000+ puzzles to solve

     

     

     

    More than 100+ vehicles to choose from

     

     

    Be one of the residents in Springfield

story:
Short Summary

For almost a year now, Evaluate Decks tool has been developed and supported by one person completely free as a hobby. However, some time ago it started to have an impact on my real job so it had to be put on hold. Now, even if it’s developed in some way by third persons (due to its code being available to the public), you can help the person who made the idea real initially by sharing some funds (which you may have accidentally spent on unnecessary cards in Tyrant, instead of using an up-to-date Evaluate Decks and buying much more needed cards!).

What We Need & What You Get

All money gathered will go directly to the developer(s) to compensate for time spent on this hobby instead of our real jobs. This is a test run, but if things go well, there is a wide TO DO list that could be implemented regarding visual look and functionality of the Sim in future patches.

Right now you'll get:

  • Summon Ability Support
  • On Attacked Modifier Implementation
  • Full Feedback Support and Reasonably Fast Bug Fixes
  • And as always, free access to the program code via svn repo

The Impact

Evaluate Decks simulator allows Tyrant players to save energy, time and especially money by providing a way to simulate in-game battles with various deck compositions without actually needing to spend energy or buy new cards. This is especially helpful with the Tyrant Fansite, which allows users all over the world to upload and share their Decks and results with the community. Even if YOU have never used Evaluate Decks, you have most likely used the Fansite’s suggested decks area, where the win percentage is uploaded from Evaluate Decks!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help Evaluate Decks Project to live and grow in other ways, feel free to share this page with your friends (You can use Indiegogo share tools for that purpose). Also, feel free to check forum page on Kongregate and leave your feedback.

story:
WE DID IT!  MASSIVE THANKS TO ALL WHO CONTRIBUTED TO OUR CAMPAIGN.  TOGETHER WE'RE BRINGING FREEDOM TO YOUNG GIRLS IN HONDURAS.

FOLLOW OUR JOURNEY ON FACEBOOK & INSTAGRAM.  


The Needle Gate Project is a journey from the Space Needle to the Golden Gate Bridge.  It’s a pursuit of physical and mental limits.  It’s a platform for freedom both to the individuals riding and those whom are yet to be free.


We're Glad You're Here

If you’ve found yourself on our campaign page then chances are likely that you’ve let one of us bend your ear about our trip down south.  We are Team Bike Raising; Stefano Altamura, Nathan Getzin, Braden Lenny and Joshua Stinger and we’ve been looking forward to this moment for nearly a year.  We are proud to partner with She Dances who is doing the great work of providing holistic restoration for young girls who have been trafficked and sexually exploited.  Our gratitude cannot be put into words that you’ve chosen to back this campaign and bring freedom to the young girls in need of rescue.  


Credits:

Special thanks to Aaron McConkey for his spectacular eye for quality film.  If you enjoyed the footage please check him out on Facebook.

story:
The Story

My brother Scott has suffered autism all his life, he's very uncomfortable in any in-person social experience, he struggles to hold down a vocal conversation and often interprets what you say as an attempt to upset him.

Because of this he prefers to spend a lot of his time indoors on the decayingly old family PC, he either plays video games or chats to a few people from different corners of the globe. In the past when the PC has broke he has becoming very bored, and somewhat depressed.

At the moment he is studying cooking under a special needs education provider called CASE. Because Scott has chosen a different path of education than computers/IT he has been refused funding to buy a PC from his disability payers as they believe he doesn't need one. 

Whilst he doesn't need a PC I still find it to be essential as it is his only enjoyable form of entertainment and the only way he feels comfortable talking to people.

By donating to this campaign you'll be helping buy and build a new PC for Scott to play games and communicate with his friends.

 

What I Need?

To build Scott a decent PC I only need £400 to cover the components and delivery cost the £500 is an imposed minimum set by indiegogo. I will help Scott to build the PC as he has always taken an interest in such a thing.

If the funding goal is not reached then the money will be placed in my savings account and I will look at alternate sources to cover the remainder of the funding.

If the funding goal is reached or exceeded then the extra cash will be used to pay off the IndieGoGo Charge/fee, and any excess cash will be spent on better components, any further cash which is insufficient for purchasing hardware will be spent on buying software/games for Scott or donated to charity (depending upon Scotts choice).

The list of parts I currently plan to buy for Scott are:

 

LINK: http://puu.sh/2Aanx

Keep in mind the parts may change as per availability or extra funding recieved but all contributions WILL be spent on the PC or Software/Games for Scott.

The Impact

Whilst I can't say your contribution will cause a globewide difference or help improve the living conditions for a huge amount of people I can say that It will help keep Scott happy and also prevent the worry of the family PC dying in the near future as well as eliminate the monthly break downs the current PC is having.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help fund this campaign, firstly recieve my thanks for viewing this and taking an interest. 

If possible please show this to your friends. 

 

Thanks to all of you for any contributions and for reading.

 

For those curious below are the basic specs of his current (family) PC:

Motherboard: Unknown 

Memory: 1.2GB DDR1 RAM

Processor: 2.8Ghz Intel Pentium 4 single-core processor

Graphics Card: Nvidia Geforce 6800 Ultra

story:
Why Communism?

Creating a game about communism just seemed like the perfect idea, by purchasing, funding, and playing the game, you are using the benefits of capitalism, all while shoving communism in the dirt. The game over all started as just a funny thought to try to bash communism but we quickly realized it could actually turn into a real game that could be really fun. While this is by no means a AAA game it is made with care and giving the player a unique experience was one of our top priorities.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal will be set at $1,500, this will facilitate our hiring of another coder as well as getting some of the more custom art pieces made, for example many of the cut scenes are placeholder or non-existent at this point.

By funding this game you will, along with helping us create an awesome game, receive a game code for itch.io as well as steam code once the game makes it through steams admission process. The higher level donations also have bonuses such as a smattering of our concept art or our complete soundtrack featuring some of our originally composed music.

The Impact

This type of game is relatively rare these days, our game may look like the many other political games on steam and itch.io but ours will be back up with actual substance. Right now we're looking at a 6-8 hour long story line when complete. This is still with the relatively small price tag of $5 or (3.9 pounds) 

Challenges

This game has some relatively large challenges to over come at this point the first being the garnering of more funds to assist in our production of the game. We could also run into unforeseen difficulty with any one of the many aspects of the game, art or coding or even sound. These will all however be sorted out in due time, the worst thing that could happen would be a delayed release. Our biggest hurdle currently is getting the game on steam through steam direct. If this does not happen however you WILL still receive your game, it will just be through itch.io instead of steam.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help by spreading this indieGoGo page and telling your comrades about the game
  • Help share on social media too!

The Story

The game follows a small band of upstart rebels known as the hoppean resistance first operating out of a small village in the Ural mountains near western russia. After the resistance is confident enough (through your help as their lead operative) they overtake the town finally moving into Moscow and setting their eyes on Stalin, the tyrant of the time. This story is made up of 5 central acts with 3 chapters in each. At this point we're looking at a run time of 5-8 hours.

Gameplay

The game is an action RPG that follows your custom character through his development from down trodden peasant to upstart hero to full fledged rebellion leader. Along the way you'll meet several colorful personalities (a few of which can be customized with a high enough donation) and gain their trust and aid in helping you on your personal journey through the communist oppression. The game play centers around our fighting system which will feature numerous period firearms and other goodies. However on some missions going loud won't get you very far and you must stealthily evade the Red star police while completing your mission. The game will also focus around gaining the support of the local citizenry usually through doing side missions for valuable members of the community.

Budget

Our Team

Our team is comprised of talented  individuals who are able to help progress the game with their own unique skills. Our head programmer teaches and takes classes at DigiPen, one of America's top video-game schools. We also have a talented musical lineup including Brett Ambler, you may not know him by his real name, but you probably know him as the "Kazoo Kid".
story_txt:
Why Communism?
Creating a game about communism just seemed like the perfect idea, by purchasing, funding, and playing the game, you are using the benefits of capitalism, all while shoving communism in the dirt. The game over all started as just a funny thought to try to bash communism but we quickly realized it could actually turn into a real game that could be really fun. While this is by no means a AAA game it is made with care and giving the player a unique experience was one of our top priorities.

What We Need & What You Get
Our funding goal will be set at $1,500, this will facilitate our hiring of another coder as well as getting some of the more custom art pieces made, for example many of the cut scenes are placeholder or non-existent at this point.

story:
We are trying to raise money for our awesome FPS game that will have amazing graphics and will be very fun to play. Some of the features that it has right now are: Drive-able tanks, helicopters, and jeeps. You can also have a machine gun, a pistol, and a shotgun. There are a few enemies with guns and we will add more and hopefully more types of enemies. Please note that this game is in a very early stage and the final product could change do to the many different things that can cause problems. You are probably wondering how your money will be spent, It will be spent on advertising, getting the software and equipment that we need, licencing fees, and possibly on getting some other people to help us make this game better. If you can't donate please help us get the word out!

Thanks

story:
Greetings fellow Mechwarriors. If you are not a MechWarrior, greetings all the same!

I am Oathmaster CoffiNail Tseng of the pc game MechWarrior Online gaming Clan Ghost Bear International (CGBI) Known as Chris in the non gaming world. A father of two boys, I am an avid fan of the MechWarrior games and the Battletech universe they take place in.

What is an Oathmaster? Basically a fancy title for me, being the founder of CGBI. I established it January of 2011 while playing another integration of the MechWarrior series, MechWarrior Living Legends, a mod for Crysis.

My gaming rig that I bought for MechWarrior Living Legends has called it quits. After almost 4 years of hard work with graphics maxed on two crysis engine based games, and a heavy load of photoshop cs2 has had some part run down.

This indiegogo campaign is my attempt to get a new pc that I cannot afford, or in the least to find what needs to be replaced and upgraded to get me back in to the game, where my extended family of CGBI is.

Being a unit founder, I have grown very close to those in my gaming Clan, and without a pc and the ability to join them and enjoy their company I feel a piece of me is missing. My wife, and mother of my two children suffers from severe anxiety and depression, as such online gaming is my social outlet, and how I deal with the sometimes stressful situation of keeping my loving wife stable.

I am the only income source for my family and I do not have the ability to save and purchase new components or even a new pc. It is my hope that I can raise enough funds through the kind hearts of others to help this dispossessed MechWarrior establish a new PC. Allowing me to continue to again play with the friends I have made in the MechWarrior community.

If enough are generous and I can get enough raised to build a new decent rig, I intend to start a streaming/twitch channel, something I was not able to do with my last computer.

I hope you can find it in your heart to help this loyal fan of MechWarrior Online enjoy the game again.

-Oathmaster CoffiNail Tseng

We regret to inform the viewer that we have recently moved to greener shores.

The New Language Launch has been reborn where it should have been all along, here on Kickstarter. We apologize for any inconvenience.
