story:
whatisfiction?

Hi my name is Jonny Eaglefeather and I am the brains behind one of the craziest, most ambitious gaming projects ever conceived. whatisfiction is a hybrid medium that combines alternate reality, augmented reality, mediated reality & personal reality gameplay experiences. What this means in laymen’s terms is that the ‘ultimate game’ takes place in the real world in multi reality universe.

The premise of using the real world as gaming platform is not a new idea. ARG’s have been around for well over a decade and they have already inspired some pretty insane experiences. What makes us instantly different, is our approach… whatisfiction is a mixed media movement, operating within a bold new partnership that bridges the gap between dance culture, gaming, reality television, film & the art of illusion.

 

A World First?

As you may have gathered this has never been attempted before and is clearly a ‘WORLD FIRST.’ The medium is powered by a clothing label called Deeper Meaning, which acts as an organic dispersal mechanism to distribute clues and items throughout the world itself; while simultaneously acting as one of the primary revenue streams to fund the whatisfiction universe.

It is a universe populated by players, the audience, brands and the various underpinnings of the five realities. I can promise you one thing, this will be like no other game you have ever played, or will ever play. If you dare to venture deep enough into our universe, it will inevitably change your ideas about reality itself.

 

Inside the whatisfiction Universe...

I bet most of you have imagined being some character on television or in the movies, perhaps even the hero or heroine. Traditionally the hero is on a mysterious quest, battling unknown forces, while travelling the four corners of the earth in search of the ultimate ‘prize’. whatisifiction takes this classic tale & digitally re-masters it for the 21st Century in a new medium that will take you well beyond virtual reality itself. whatisfiction is a hybrid medium that combines alternate reality, augmented reality, mediated reality & personal reality gameplay experiences.

An alternate reality game or ARG is an interactive narrative that uses the real world as a platform & makes use of ‘transmedia’ to deliver a story that can be altered by the ‘participants’ ideas or actions. Augmented reality or AR is a live, direct or indirect, view of the physical, real-world environment whose elements are fundamentally augmented by computer generated sensory input such as video, sound, graphics or GPS data.

 

A Future Game?

The whatisfiction universe consists of five levels of reality; the first two realities introduce you to the various levels of the Mind Game, the basic interactions of the new medium & also allow us to share key information about the whatisfiction universe. The other three realities will be where Ultimate Reality takes place, and where the game evolves even further, as the audience & players have to work closely together to unravel the inner mystery of whatisfiction.

The idea of a futuristic game isn’t new or even remotely farfetched by Hollywood standards. One of the earliest examples was 1975’s Roller Ball, but it didn’t end there. We also had The Running Man, Escape from New York, Starship Troopers, Star Wars Ep. 1 Phantom Menace, Death Race, Real Steel, Gamer & the Hunger Games, to name but a few.

Read more…  

 

A Race?

When I created whatisfiction I didn’t think that anyone else would be in the race toward the ultimate game, primarily because of the nature of the format. I was pleasantly surprised when Will Wright shared his game concept ‘HiveMind’ towards the end of 2011. 

For those of you who don’t know him by name, he is the legendary creator of the live simulation video games Sim City, the Sims & Spore. While our approaches differ radically we do still share a number of common ideas, primarily because he is one of my inadvertent teachers.

You can click the hyperlink above to get an idea of how Will wants to shape the future of gaming…

FATE = whatisfiction

 

DISCOVERING ‘Our’ Deeper Meaning?

Deeper Meaning is the culmination of that vision. It represents the ‘remarkable triumph’ of a fledgling creative movement to give life to a reality altering idea without ever having had ‘any real money’ to pursue, or even create said idea...

The key to the whatisfiction universe is a label called Deeper Meaning, which is VERY IMPORTANT...

  • Because we only ever make one hundred of any design.
  • The shirts are customised to suit your individuality with a personalised 6 digit code
  • The first edition shirts feature only twelve designs.
  • There are two types of special edition shirts: the first has hidden clues & the second comes with a unique graphical novel that offers vital clues to unlocking the twelve digital realms.
  • whatisfiction acts as a platform for artists to have their art immortalised as part of the whatisfiction Universe forever.
  • A dollar ($) from every piece of whatisfiction (Deep Meaning) merchandise sold is used to create the ‘greatest crowd funded jackpot of all time’ for the Ultimate Game. This jackpot will also be amplified through sponsorship deals with other affiliate brand partners. The deeper meaning label will see an exponential organic growth, without sacrificing the exclusivity of the experience & leading to over commercialisation.
  • We never waste money on advertising but rather choose to reinvest in your experience.

 

Click Here to view:  Mens | Womens

‘First Edition shirts’ go on sale 10/08/2012

 

Please Note: We cover all shipping costs in full for any of our campaign perks that require shipping

 

The Crux of the Matter

This campaign serves two purposes: (1stly) it is a funding tool to add much needed resources so we can grow our community before the launch of the Ultimate Game & (2ndly) to create global awareness about the project so we can secure the relevant big brand partners to create the entire whatisfiction universe. 

Why should you invest the time or the money to help us?

You should support us because we are the under dogs, the unknowns, the x-factor that no one anticipated and we are not offering you a one dimensional experience. While it may not be the easiest concept to wrap your head around, the chances of anyone ever attempting this again are slim to none. I can honestly say we not doing this to make ourselves rich and this experience goes way beyond money, so we feel that counts for something.

We want to make it to the number one spot on Indiegogo with your help, to do this we need to get back into the gaming section which means we need another $30 this week to feature in the gaming category (followed by another $400 for the following week to stay in the running). We could artificially push ourselves over this point, but I think that defeats the spirit of crowd funding and that’s not what we are about.

 

Getting Super Social 

What we are asking is for you to be active, to spread the word and to share the campaign via the Indiegogo tools, on social networks, blogs, and forums, & everywhere you think it will make an impression. Talk to your friends and other gamers about it, like this campaign, love it, champion it and we will reinvest in your experience over and over again.

Ideas that spread WIN – So if you believe in us then so will you…

 

Where is the Money Going?

  • ‘whatisrevolution’ sticker pack campaigns for all new registrations on the whatisfiction.org website. So you can help us get super visible in a really awesome way for all concerned
  • The second goal will be to actualise our social media initiatives where we give back to our community as they create awareness about the project
  • Our third goal will be to setup a permanent base of operations for the movement to work from  

 

What is impossible?

This is not my first attempt at Indiegogo project my last campaign ‘Road to Fiction’ failed epically except for a solitary pledge of $20 by Emilio Barden. That’s where my story should have ended had it not been for friends & fellow creatives who decided to rally around me & help me chase down this seemingly impossible dream. They are my ‘fictionaries’ & they have sacrificed their time & resources for just over a year, so we could finish what I had started.

#teamwhatisfiction Present & Past

Deniel Briers, Hamza Jacobs, Adrain Gemini, Antonio Del Rossi, Hadie Ismail, Marco Del Rossi, Duncan Nieuwstadt, Simone Maharaj, Peter JV R, Ashok Bali, Nanette Pistor, Jacques Sueur, Lea Z Frost, Michael Dupre, Ilse Violin, Armien Fakier, Zehra Fakier, Greg Boyle, Gizelle Loots, Taryn Conway Naurattel, Paul Wentzel, Michael Bredenhand, Jason Van Wyk, Karen Bouwer, Helene Fourie, Bianca Griebenow, Tahier Variawa.

This project has been blessed by the diverse talents of a handful of amazing people, and we have undoubtedly had our fair share of ups and downs. I can honestly say there have been points where I wanted to quit because the challenge of creating without financial backing was almost unbearable. But thankfully we didn’t and we never sold out to get the job done… 

 

Leading the way

They say it takes 10 000 hours to become a master at something. In my journey to get here I have amassed more than twice that amount. Seth Godin helped me to take ownership of what I had learned & inspired me to dare to dream big enough & change everything in my reality.

I began to realise that the economics of this new medium would have to be different in order for it to realise its full potential. There would need to be more balance & constant redistribution of resources. So I made a rather selfless decision. I would own whatisfiction as much as it owns me. Fifty percent of all profits are mandated by the movement to be reinvested into the whatisfiction universe for the benefit of its patrons, while the remaining fifty percent will be paid out in remuneration for the work of active members, on a project-by-project basis.

whatisfiction’s ground breaking nature means that the technology we were planning to incorporate into the whatisfiction universe would allow us to build a ‘New System’. Perhaps this may be very controversial to you or not, but it is inherently true.

#occupyreality

I Choose To Learn More

I Choose To Be More

I Choose To Do More

I Choose To Share More

 

What is the Art of Revolution?

We live in a world where material things have greater value than human life. Yet the irony is that Art is the only priceless commodity in our world - a resource that cannot be mined or mass produced that arises out of the tireless pursuit of seemingly impossible things, & can never be ‘synced.’ Standing at the proverbial gates of our own Social Creative Revolution, some of us will choose to take responsibility & begin to fix the mistakes of our forefathers.

The rules exist to be broken & we must learn to live our own ‘fiction’. And when we do, the rules will begin to change. So my advice to you is that you keep evolving; start your own movement; lead your own tribe; build your own system; connect with us & make this a global revolution. Mankind is now faced with new problems that can only be solved using new ways of thinking.

It’s time we start to make new choices & change everything. I believe that one of the truest forms of Freedom is expressed by the choice to do something different. I am a man with nothing to lose & if that’s what true Freedom tastes like, then think I shall drink my fill...

For those of you working in the film, TV, gaming, magic, music, IT & other creative industries, the message is simple - ‘This project is history in the making’. Building it changes everything. The big question remains... Will you be a spectator or will you join us in breaking the mould forever???

 

Here's to the crazy ones by Jack Kerouac...

Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can praise them, disagree with them, quote them, disbelieve them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They invent. They imagine. They heal. They explore. They create. They inspire. They push the human race forward. Maybe they have to be crazy. How else can you stare at an empty canvas and see a work of art? Or sit in silence and hear a song that’s never been written? Or gaze at a red planet and see a laboratory on wheels? While some may dismiss this sort of behaviour as sheer madness, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are usually the ones who Do...

 

In Closing

If you want to know why I chased this idea, it’s because I know & believe that we can get there. I have done my best, given everything I have to give & more. This experience has undoubtedly been one of the hardest, most amazing experiences of my life & I really can’t say I have any regrets. I think that above all, I wanted to show people that you don’t need money to do remarkable things & that if you try hard enough you can make a difference in a unique way.

whatisfiction has proven to be remarkable enough that a group of people have chosen to listen & then go on to work in supportive roles without remuneration for over a year to help realize this vision. Thank you for your interest in this campaign. I hope the project will inspire you to make a real difference out there in the world so that we would have made a difference in yours. Let’s co-create a different future together... 


Rise

 

So what’s Remarkable about this Story?

  1. whatisfiction is a mixed media movement, operating within a bold new partnership that bridges the gap between dance culture, gaming, reality television, film & the art of illusion.
  2. The Deeper Meaning shirts are not just any shirts. They are part of the Ultimate Game.
  3. The whatisfiction movement is building a future game set in a multi-reality universe.
  4. We are in a Race with Will Wright, the creator of the Sims, to build the ultimate reality game.
  5. We built a self-actualising Blueprint for whatisfiction without any 'real' money.
  6. We are not a company, we are a social creative movement.
  7. whatisfiction was created by South Africans.
  8. The technology we are using in the ultimate game will allow us to build a ‘New System’
  9. My name is Jonny Eaglefeather, I am an ‘organic intellectual’ & I am Responsible

 

How Can you get Involved?

  • Register on the whatisfiction website for updates & info on how to get involved!!!!
  • Please Share this Campaign on Facebook & any other social networking platforms you are active on. Help us to create awareness about the whatisfiction movement
  • Please share & like our Facebook fan page • Buy a first edition t-shirt when they go on sale on 10/08/2012
  • Follow whatisfiction on Twitter @fictioniswhat & @jeaglefeather (& retweet)
  • Join #teamwhatisfiction, #HitFollowTeam, #FamilyPoWeR on twitter
  • Show your support & hash tag #whatisfiction. HELP US TREND GLOBALLY on Twitter!!!!
  • If you are interested in finding out more about the whatisfiction movement & joining us you can mail me directly at eaglefeather@whatisfiction.org

 

Join Our Tribal Revolution on www.whatisfiction.org

FACEBOOK www.facebook.com/whatisfiction

TWITTER www.twitter.com/fictioniswhat

TWITTER www.twitter.com/JEaglefeather

E-MAIL: eaglefeather@whatisfiction.org

 

RISE, The Revolution Starts Within

#BeatTheSystem

‘First Edition shirts’ go on sale 10/08/2012
 
Please Note: We cover all shipping costs in full for any of our campaign perks that require shipping

 

The Crux of the Matter
This campaign serves two purposes: (1stly) it is a funding tool to add much needed resources so we can grow our community before the launch of the Ultimate Game & (2ndly) to create global awareness about the project so we can secure the relevant big brand partners to create the entire whatisfiction universe.  
Why should you invest the time or the money to help us?
You should support us because we are the under dogs, the unknowns, the x-factor that no one anticipated and we are not offering you a one dimensional experience. While it may not be the easiest concept to wrap your head around, the chances of anyone ever attempting this again are slim to none. I can honestly say we not doing this to make ourselves rich and this experience goes way beyond money, so we feel that counts for something.
We want to make it to the number one spot on Indiegogo with your help, to do this we need to get back into the gaming section which means we need another $30 this week to feature in the gaming category (followed by another $400 for the following week to stay in the running). We could artificially push ourselves over this point, but I think that defeats the spirit of crowd funding and that’s not what we are about.
 
Getting Super Social 
What we are asking is for you to be active, to spread the word and to share the campaign via the Indiegogo tools, on social networks, blogs, and forums, & everywhere you think it will make an impression. Talk to your friends and other gamers about it, like this campaign, love it, champion it and we will reinvest in your experience over and over again.
Ideas that spread WIN – So if you believe in us then so will you…
 

Where is the Money Going?

‘whatisrevolution’ sticker pack campaigns for all new registrations on the whatisfiction.org website. So you can help us get super visible in a really awesome way for all concerned
The second goal will be to actualise our social media initiatives where we give back to our community as they create awareness about the project
Our third goal will be to setup a permanent base of operations for the movement to work from  
 

What is impossible?
This is not my first attempt at Indiegogo project my last campaign ‘Road to Fiction’ failed epically except for a solitary pledge of $20 by Emilio Barden. That’s where my story should have ended had it not been for friends & fellow creatives who decided to rally around me & help me chase down this seemingly impossible dream. They are my ‘fictionaries’ & they have sacrificed their time & resources for just over a year, so we could finish what I had started.
#teamwhatisfiction Present & Past 
Deniel Briers, Hamza Jacobs, Adrain Gemini, Antonio Del Rossi, Hadie Ismail, Marco Del Rossi, Duncan Nieuwstadt, Simone Maharaj, Peter JV R, Ashok Bali, Nanette Pistor, Jacques Sueur, Lea Z Frost, Michael Dupre, Ilse Violin, Armien Fakier, Zehra Fakier, Greg Boyle, Gizelle Loots, Taryn Conway Naurattel, Paul Wentzel, Michael Bredenhand, Jason Van Wyk, Karen Bouwer, Helene Fourie, Bianca Griebenow, Tahier Variawa.
This project has been blessed by the diverse talents of a handful of amazing people, and we have undoubtedly had our fair share of ups and downs. I can honestly say there have been points where I wanted to quit because the challenge of creating without financial backing was almost unbearable. But thankfully we didn’t and we never sold out to get the job done…  
 

Leading the way
They say it takes 10 000 hours to become a master at something. In my journey to get here I have amassed more than twice that amount. Seth Godin helped me to take ownership of what I had learned & inspired me to dare to dream big enough & change everything in my reality. 
I began to realise that the economics of this new medium would have to be different in order for it to realise its full potential. There would need to be more balance & constant redistribution of resources. So I made a rather selfless decision. I would own whatisfiction as much as it owns me. Fifty percent of all profits are mandated by the movement to be reinvested into the whatisfiction universe for the benefit of its patrons, while the remaining fifty percent will be paid out in remuneration for the work of active members, on a project-by-project basis.
whatisfiction’s ground breaking nature means that the technology we were planning to incorporate into the whatisfiction universe would allow us to build a ‘New System’. Perhaps this may be very controversial to you or not, but it is inherently true.
#occupyreality
I Choose To Learn More
I Choose To Be More
I Choose To Do More
I Choose To Share More
 

What is the Art of Revolution?
We live in a world where material things have greater value than human life. Yet the irony is that Art is the only priceless commodity in our world - a resource that cannot be mined or mass produced that arises out of the tireless pursuit of seemingly impossible things, & can never be ‘synced.’ Standing at the proverbial gates of our own Social Creative Revolution, some of us will choose to take responsibility & begin to fix the mistakes of our forefathers.
The rules exist to be broken & we must learn to live our own ‘fiction’. And when we do, the rules will begin to change. So my advice to you is that you keep evolving; start your own movement; lead your own tribe; build your own system; connect with us & make this a global revolution. Mankind is now faced with new problems that can only be solved using new ways of thinking.
It’s time we start to make new choices & change everything. I believe that one of the truest forms of Freedom is expressed by the choice to do something different. I am a man with nothing to lose & if that’s what true Freedom tastes like, then think I shall drink my fill...
For those of you working in the film, TV, gaming, magic, music, IT & other creative industries, the message is simple - ‘This project is history in the making’. Building it changes everything. The big question remains... Will you be a spectator or will you join us in breaking the mould forever???
 

Here's to the crazy ones by Jack Kerouac...
Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can praise them, disagree with them, quote them, disbelieve them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They invent. They imagine. They heal. They explore. They create. They inspire. They push the human race forward. Maybe they have to be crazy. How else can you stare at an empty canvas and see a work of art? Or sit in silence and hear a song that’s never been written? Or gaze at a red planet and see a laboratory on wheels? While some may dismiss this sort of behaviour as sheer madness, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are usually the ones who Do...
 

In Closing
If you want to know why I chased this idea, it’s because I know & believe that we can get there. I have done my best, given everything I have to give & more. This experience has undoubtedly been one of the hardest, most amazing experiences of my life & I really can’t say I have any regrets. I think that above all, I wanted to show people that you don’t need money to do remarkable things & that if you try hard enough you can make a difference in a unique way.
whatisfiction has proven to be remarkable enough that a group of people have chosen to listen & then go on to work in supportive roles without remuneration for over a year to help realize this vision. Thank you for your interest in this campaign. I hope the project will inspire you to make a real difference out there in the world so that we would have made a difference in yours. Let’s co-create a different future together... 
Rise
 

So what’s Remarkable about this Story?

whatisfiction is a mixed media movement, operating within a bold new partnership that bridges the gap between dance culture, gaming, reality television, film & the art of illusion.
The Deeper Meaning shirts are not just any shirts. They are part of the Ultimate Game.
The whatisfiction movement is building a future game set in a multi-reality universe.
We are in a Race with Will Wright, the creator of the Sims, to build the ultimate reality game.
We built a self-actualising Blueprint for whatisfiction without any 'real' money.
We are not a company, we are a social creative movement.
whatisfiction was created by South Africans.
The technology we are using in the ultimate game will allow us to build a ‘New System’
My name is Jonny Eaglefeather, I am an ‘organic intellectual’ & I am Responsible
 

How Can you get Involved?

Register on the whatisfiction website for updates & info on how to get involved!!!!
Please Share this Campaign on Facebook & any other social networking platforms you are active on. Help us to create awareness about the whatisfiction movement
Please share & like our Facebook fan page • Buy a first edition t-shirt when they go on sale on 10/08/2012
Follow whatisfiction on Twitter @fictioniswhat & @jeaglefeather (& retweet)
Join #teamwhatisfiction, #HitFollowTeam, #FamilyPoWeR on twitter
Show your support & hash tag #whatisfiction. HELP US TREND GLOBALLY on Twitter!!!!
If you are interested in finding out more about the whatisfiction movement & joining us you can mail me directly at eaglefeather@whatisfiction.org

 
Join Our Tribal Revolution on www.whatisfiction.org
FACEBOOK www.facebook.com/whatisfiction
TWITTER www.twitter.com/fictioniswhat
TWITTER www.twitter.com/JEaglefeather
E-MAIL: eaglefeather@whatisfiction.org
 

RISE, The Revolution Starts Within
#BeatTheSystem

story:
Go Go Monkey Squad is a HTML5 game for touch screen mobile platforms, which we plan to publish on the platforms below through their respective stores for free!

  • iOS
  • Android
  • Tizen (?)
  • Blackberry 10 (?)
  • Windows 8 (?)

Release Date: Late 2013 (Aiming for October release!)

 



Go Go Monkey Squad is proudly developed using the HTML5 Game Engine - Construct 2! The game will then be powered by Ludei's CocoonJS to run on mobile like any other native app.

About the Game

Go Go Monkey Squad is an Endless Run & Shooter game where you play as four monkeys interchangeably. You change between characters through swipe gestures.

The goal of the game is to shoot enemies continuously to build up your combo. Once your combo ends, it rewards you with score depending on how long you managed to keep the combo going.

You also collect Bananas to unlock hats which work as upgrades to each monkey, providing bonuses such as an increase in rate of fire, or unlocking a special double jump ability!

The Combo System

Shoot & slash enemies continuously maintain a combo. The larger your combo is, the more points you get at the end of it. You must only take mere seconds between each hit, to count as part of a combo.

Once a long combo is broken, the environment will change and you will face new enemies and terrain.

The 4-Monkey System

You are be able to swipe the screen upwards and downwards to switch between monkeys. It is an interesting mechanic, and a new concept, never before done in an endless runner game!

Each Monkey has their own Health Bar and you lose the game when all 4 monkeys die, or when you get pushed out of the screen.

The Hat System

Each monkey can equip one hat item at once. Each hat has a unique design, and works as a unique upgrade to that monkey. For example, Equip Rico with a Cybotech Visor, and you may increase his attack range. Equip Malfozzo with a wizard hat, and he will shoot ice attacks instead of fire attacks. We're still looking into possibilities!

Interactive Enemies

We spend time and thought into each enemy and right now, we have an arsenal of enemies and ideas for enemies that involve more complex mechanics than simply - shoot this and it dies. We have Spike Turtles which die but remain as a "spike" obstacle. Bandit Turtles which throw axes while they are alive, but become a tool to attack enemies once they die!

We want to make each enemy special, and make the in-game experience truly challenging with replay value.

Rory Soh is the main artist and programmer of Couch Knight. He has collaborated on many small projects with other game developers around the world, and created the engine "Eclipse Origins" alongside Robin Perris. He has a strong love for pixel art, illustration and any art. He is also the programmer for the game, using a tool called Construct 2, he is out to prove that anyone with an idea, can make a game.

Yeo Xie Hang is the artist and level designer of Couch Knight, working alongside Rory to create more content and levels for the game. He is a passionate game developer who wants to pixel art his way into your hearts. In his free time, he plays tabletop games and hits the bar once very so often. But while he is working on the game, he will try not to be under the influence of alchohol.

We're working on this full-time right now, we spend all our time creating a game that we hope you will want to play! We don't have any income, besides the money we earn from freelance work!

Despite this, we would really like to work with other artists, animators and musicians to create content for the game.

Right now we've got a gameplay demo fleshed out, and we have developed 2 levels and created art assets for another 3 out of the final 10 we're aiming for before release. We have no finalised Sound Effects and Music, and there is still a ton of polishing to do.

Your contribution will matter a lot to us now as it will allow us to focus all our time into developing the game.

It will allow us to hire a musician to create some great soundtracks for the game, it will take the burden off the licenses we need to purchase and so much more.

 

*All normal perks include the perks of their predecessors!

The $200 Perk package includes the following shirt shipped to you!

We estimate that you'll get it a month or two after the campaign ends.

If you do purchase this, we hope proudly wear it and tell all your friends about the game, tell them it's a game you helped make possible!


 

*Tentative design, may change when finalised!

 

FAQS
Q: None Yet!
A: Ask us some.

You may send any questions and/or business enquiries to Rory Soh.
Rorysoh@gmail.com

If you can't support us through funding, something you can do that will mean a lot to us would be simply following us on Facebook!

story:
Hello, there!

My name is Aaron Bolyard. I’m a 21-years-old self-educated programmer with years of experience in C, C++, C#, and Lua, and I’ve constructed my game, Eight Seasons, from scratch over the past two years, on and off. The unique experience delivered by my game is unparalleled, from one area to the next. Everything is carefully constructed by me—gameplay, graphics, storyline, and dialogue—except for audio (which is expertly composed by my brother). Regardless, the cohesive experience offered in Eight Seasons is truly unique once the adventure starts.

As the pitch video points out, I’m a games developer from the US with a passion for classic literature, such as Paradise Lost and the Iliad. Reading was not always my strong point, but when the “light bulb” finally turned on, I have had an endless thirst for literature of all kinds. Still, the classics always remain close to my heart.

My video game strives to be a modern rendition of the classic epic form. However, unlike Paradise Lost in which there is only one outcome, my game will have many ways of interacting and changing the progression of events.

You can get a feel of the game already by trying out a recent demo! Check it out here.

Much of the inspiration of Eight Seasons comes from my mom—a strong-willed woman who is close to finishing her English Literature degree. Indeed, her very personality is entwined within the game’s protagonist, Haiku.

So, contributions to my game—be it a small comment, constructive criticism, or funds—will ensure that I can realize the dream of sharing my passion with others. I wholeheartedly believe that poetry is not reserved for English class, and my game strives to reinforce this sentiment.

So, why do I need help?

Eight Seasons may be a game, but it is also an experience. To properly render this experience, I need resources that unfortunately are generally a bit pricy. A large portion of the goal is to be used on sound effects and music.

My brother is the composer of this project, and the tools he uses are dated. Reaching the goal would ensure I can get him the software (such as Reason), the content (such as samples and sounds), and even hardware (such as a MIDI keyboard) that would allow him to fully realize the musical potential of the game.

There’s also other miscellaneous costs, such as submission to Steam Greenlight and software licensing, that add up.

Contributions are not unrewarded, however! Each contribution will be rewarded, be it with thanks or a gift:

  • At $8, you get to updated beta copies of the game, and when the full game is released, you’ll get to have it.
  • A little more and you get  specialized wallpapers featuring concept art.
  • Up from there and you get prints of game artwork.
  • The last notch is a copy of the soundtrack to be released upon completion of the game!

Of course, there is always the threat of the game not reaching its funding goal. In this case, the game will take longer to realize than intended (by how much is to be seen). I will still continue updating the game, but it would have to be put on the backburner, which sadly means that progress will be much slower.

How helping me will help you!

Aside from the perks, each contribution is a small (or large) step towards seeing the game completed. The game itself, as stressed previously, is an experience that strives to merge two seemingly different forms—poetry and interactivity—into one unique rendition.

By helping me, you will not only get to experience the magical world of Eight Seasons, you will get to see it grow from a dream into a reality.

If you can’t fund the project...

Don’t fret—you can still provide feedback and help promote the game! Reach out to anyone you think would be interested and show them. Word of mouth is the best way of drumming up interest!

story:
DoubleTurtle Games presents: Dropit!

A fun puzzle game for Android and possibly iOS.

We are a team consisting of 5 Game Developers, each with their individual set of skills. 

We are developing this game in our spare time, to gain more experience so that we can start our own company.

The reason why we submitted ourself to indiegogo is because we want to reach a wide target audience and we believe that you, the contributors, can help us realise this dream!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $500. The reason we need this amount is because we need to purchase Android and iOS licenses + a testing device for iOS.

We need this goal because otherwise we would lose the chance to release Dropit on iOS which will decrease our target audience by half.

Our Game

The main goal in dropit is to find your way to the next level. You do this by turning the world around, this will make the character fall down. There are various gameplay elements involved, like the teleporter, turn-around barn, move-able block and more, which will either help you or confuse you. It's your job to puzzle your way to the end!

If you like our game so far we would appreciate it if you share this page with friends, family etc. This would really help us achieve our goal to release it for iOS as well.

If you choose the perk Creator (create own level) we will keep in touch and provide you with a way to create your own level.

We apologise for the bad video, we are not movie-editors, we are game developers!

story:
Commander Keen is a fun old side scroller game, which needs no introduction. It was released by id software back in 1991, and used revolutionary for the time fast scrolling tactics which were thought not possible on PCs.  id would later release legendary games such as Wolf3d and Doom.  

From id's site:

Commander Keen's very first adventure, and the debut of id's groundbreaking side-scrolling technology. In the game you play the role of Commander Keen: the alter-ego of an eight year-old genius by the name of Billy Blaze. When Billy learns that the Earth is in danger, he dons his brother's football helmet and his homemade interstellar spaceship to become Commander Keen -- Defender of the Earth!

Nowadays, Steam sells a "Complete" Keen Pack, which is not accurate, since it doesn't include 2 episodes because they were published by different parties than id/Apogee and thus they can't be included. Well, this could be different if this campaign is successful. 

Keen Dreams' current rights holder is interested in transferring the rights to the episode, and I've been in talks with them to get it done. The asking cost is $1500 to get Keen Dreams re-released digitally and legally across major digital stores.  With your help, we can add the Lost Episode to Steam's Keen Pack, and to other stores like GOG.com, across win/mac/linux.

What this campaign wants to achieve:

- Keen Dreams available legally, digitally on Steam, GOG,com, Ubuntu Store, Gamersgate and other stores.

- Steamworks integration on the Steam release, with achievements, leader boards, Big Picture support and more!

- Full source code released under the GPL and available on Github.com

- Keen Dreams on other mobile devices besides Android, like ios, depending on the success of this campaign.

- Eventual full legal release of the game.



- As strech goals, if we reach $6000 or more, we will include even more Softdisk games like Rescue Rover and Slordax !

I will personally contribute towards this goal with my own funds, even if the campaign is not successful. I'll also cover any costs related to submitting the game to any store.

Let's get this game finally released up to the expected modern digital release standards!

 become Commander Keen -- Defender of the Earth!Nowadays, Steam sells a "Complete" Keen Pack, which is not accurate, since it doesn't include 2 episodes because they were published by different parties than id/Apogee and thus they can't be included. Well, this could be different if this campaign is successful.  Keen Dreams' current rights holder is interested in transferring the rights to the episode, and I've been in talks with them to get it done. The asking cost is $1500 to get Keen Dreams re-released digitally and legally across major digital stores.  With your help, we can add the Lost Episode to Steam's Keen Pack, and to other stores like GOG.com, across win/mac/linux.What this campaign wants to achieve:- Keen Dreams available legally, digitally on Steam, GOG,com, Ubuntu Store, Gamersgate and other stores.- Steamworks integration on the Steam release, with achievements, leader boards, Big Picture support and more!- Full source code released under the GPL and available on Github.com- Keen Dreams on other mobile devices besides Android, like ios, depending on the success of this campaign.- Eventual full legal release of the game.- As strech goals, if we reach $6000 or more, we will include even more Softdisk games like Rescue Rover and Slordax !I will personally contribute towards this goal with my own funds, even if the campaign is not successful. I'll also cover any costs related to submitting the game to any store.Let's get this game finally released up to the expected modern digital release standards!

story:
Prepare for trouble
And make it double
To protect our tails from devastation
To unite all seekers in ruination
To reacquaint you with the ground with every throw
To deflect your reach from the ass below...

Walter and Kosta have been selected join eight world-class snitches in this year's IQA Global Games, a biennial event in which national teams representing quidditch-playing countries from around the world meet to compete and crown a global champion. 

These teams are bringing the foremost players from their respective countries and Walter and Kosta have both been deemed worthy of competing alongside them as two of the best snitch runners in the game. 

By helping us get to the Global Games, you are ensuring that two great snitches will be putting the world's top seekers through mental and physical anguish (in the nicest way possible). This joint effort will also bring one of the Northeast U.S.'s most successful snitch pranks to the world stage. 

What We Need

Where we really need the most help is in covering travel expenses. Vancouver is on the other side of the country. Actually it's in another country altogether. This money will cover our flights from NYC to Seattle and the wheels from Seattle to Vancouver. 

We get it. Money's tight. (Snitches ain't swimming in riches.) Any amount you can contribute will help us immensely. And check over there—>  We'll make it worth it. 

If you are unable to contribute, please share this campaign and help get our plea out there. Thank you!


Photos courtesy of Michael E. Mason Photography

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE:

We need 240€ for the booth, but the minimum we can ask on Indiegogo is 500 USD (~370€). The whole campaign was made in a few hours, so we might need to fix some details.

Necesitamos 240€ para el stand, pero el mínimo que podemos pedir en Indiegogo es de 500 USD (~370€). Toda la campaña se ha hecho en unas cuantas horas, así que puede que tengamos que arreglar algunos detalles.

Warning: This is raw gameplay from an alpha build, it doesn't reflect the final product. Some assets are just placeholders.


Update #1: A message from the artist

What is "Missing Translation"?  // ¿Qué es "Missing Translation"?


It's an upcoming game that will be launched on Android and PC.

It's inspired on classic PC point & click games, but also on FEZ and other modern titles. There's some plot behind it but it's pretty abstract, it's all centered around puzzles. The game introduces a couple of different sets of mental challenges, each of these sets has different rules and mechanics, if you get stuck or don't like a certain type of puzzle you can just skip it and come back later.

We are making it accessible to everyone(not too hard to complete with some effort), but we'll also add several hardcore puzzles with really cool rewards for people who seek a greater challenge. It doesn't mind what kind of player you are, we'll have suitable content for everyone to enjoy if you give us a chance.

//

Es un juego que lanzaremos próximamente en Android y PC.

Está inspirado en juegos clásicos de aventuras para ordenador, pero también en FEZ y otros títulos modernos. Hay un argumento, pero es bastante abstracto, todo está centrado alrededor de los puzles. El juego presenta varios sets distintos de retos mentales, si te atascas o no te gusta un cierto tipo de puzle puedes saltártelo y volver luego.

Estamos haciendo el juego accesible para todos los jugadores(no es demasiado difícil con un poco de esfuerzo), pero también añadiremos algunos puzles más hardcore con recompensas interesantes para la gente que quiera un reto mayor. No importa el tipo de jugador que seas, si nos das la oportunidad, tendremos contenido de sobra para que todo el mundo lo disfrute.

BSO Preview



Why do we need the money? // ¿Por qué necesitamos el dinero?


We need 240€ to showcase our game at Madrid Games Week, a huge gaming event with AAA games. Since "Missing Translation" is going to be free, we don't have enough money for the booth.

//

Necesitamos 240€ para presentar nuestro juego en Madrid Games Week, un evento enorme de videojuegos con muchos proyectos comerciales. Como "Missing Translation" va a ser gratis, no podemos pagar el stand.


Why should I give you money? // ¿Por qué debería daros dinero?


We're just three developers who don't have much experience yet, but we're doing what we love and we are pretty sure you'll enjoy "Missing Translation". Supporting the campaign you will help us get more exposure and keep growing as devs :)

//

Sólo somos tres desarrolladores que no tienen mucha experiencia todavía, pero estamos haciendo lo que amamos y estamos bastante seguros de que disfrutaréis "Missing Translation". Apoyando la campaña nos ayudáis a ser conocidos y a crecer como desarrolladores :)

Risks and challenges // Riesgos y desafíos


The game should be finished before October ends, we might wait for a month to fix some bugs before releasing it.
All the campaign rewards are separated from the game, so even if something happened to the project you'd get what you paid for.

//

El juego deberia estar acabado antes de que acabe Noviembre, puede que esperásemos un mes más antes de lanzarlo para arreglar errores.
Todas las recompensas de la campaña están separadas del juego, así que si algo le pasase al proyecto obtendríais lo pagado.

    Media and links // Imágenes y enlaces




    Devlog (more info) // Blog de desarrollo (más información)

story:
What is it?

Abandoned is a 2d top down puzzle horror game about a guy called Nick. For more information about the story, please read 'The Story' down below.


The Beginning:

I started talking with a friend about how cool it would be to make my own horror game, because normally I only make shooters and puzzle games. So he said that it would be pretty awesome, so a week later I went on vacation and I started to write the story line. I kinda wanted to affect the story line on my biggest fear: horror movies/games. I played Amnesia: The Dark Descent, and I was horrified. So I wrote the story, and added all the things that I personally find scary so that I could know that the finished product would be my game. Not a random game, but my game.

 

The Story:

The story is about a charachter called Nick. Nick owns a small company that makes websites, so he is a webdeveloper. One night, Nick was very tired and fell asleep in his office. He had a bad dream and woke up. He looked at the time and realized it was very late so he ran outside, he forgot his keys inside and closed the door. It was raining and he couldn't open the door, the busses didn't come at this late hour and it was too far to walk home. He had to find shelter, but how?

We dont want to spoil the amazing story. So if you want to continue the story, then help us out so that you can enjoy playing the game yourself!


The Team

  • Ionas Skopelitis will do our head programming.
  • Jordy Dragt will help program the game.
  • Myrto Skopeliti will design the graphics and do level-design.

story:
Short Summary

We believe that computer games are not only about realism, but it's about having fun playing it. We believe that games are not just about spend time, but it's about growing as a person, learning new skills, learning about life and about humanity. 

We at Digital Soul Games are passionate in what we do. We began as a couple friends doing games at our spare time, but we know we can do better if we do it full time. Thus we are releasing our first game: Thanatos.

We hope that with your help we can solidify our company and fund our next projects.

What We Need & What You Get

Your funding will help us to solidify our company and build our next game, as we are for now just a Start Up at UPTEC's.

Thanatos is in alpha version and we plan to release it in the Q1 2015.

We now offer to everyone that helps up the Demo version with a small peek of the entire story of Thanatos, as well as a full licensed copy of the release version when we finish it according with the amount of funding.

You also will be informed about our future projects.

We hope that we get to our funding goal, but Thanatos for sure will not be stopped from being finished if this goal is not achieved. So we guarantee that all sponsors will have their gifts.   

    Risks & Challenges

    As any Start Up, we are for now funding ourselves with our sweat, blood and tears and your help will be a great value for us and for our next projects

    We have several challenges and we have the skills to overcome them, but with your help they will be a lot easier for us. And remember we will be eternally grateful for your help.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you cannot help us with money, please help us spreading our work. Tell about us in blogs, social networks. We are open for interviews and for sure accept opportunities for publishing our press releases.

      We are also accepting any contribution as Fan Arts, suggestions and ideas.

      Don't forget you have the Indiegogo's share tools.

      Kind regards,

      Digital Soul Games.
